So I must have hit my seventeen-month mark because for no reason I can articulate, I found myself at Sauce for a very late lunch. Late being like 2:30PM, and I was starving. Don't let other people schedule your work life. 

You merely suffer from accommodating everyone around you, and what do you get? Indigestion. It's certainly not cheap for solitary diners like myself as they give all the deals on their social plates like Portobello Mushroom Fries and Ham Hock Tater Tots, which were $10.50 each. I gorged and first ordered the $14.50 Maine Lobster Bisque, which came piping hot for such a creamy broth but lacking oomph in its flavor. It came with a small crostini with a piece of buttered lobster tail, just enough to make you wish you really were in Maine in front of a whole one (photo: http://bit.ly/1D7KiEC). I followed this with the $14.50 Baby Iceberg Cobb Salad.

This dish was inexplicably presented as a Napoleon neatly stacking the ingredients in a way that made it impossible not to topple over. The lettuce was at the bottom with the red onions on top of that with the ranch dressing acting as a glue with the chunks of chicken breast over that and the bacon pieces over that. The tomatoes were somewhere in there, while the egg slices couldn't be bothered and were left on the side (photo: http://bit.ly/1JEPcxb). It was a generous portion but such a chore to eat I wasn't really enjoying it that much. As I was already north of $30, I stopped and decided a different circumstance would have to get me back to Sauce. Like someone else's expense account. See you in seventeen months, Brindisi.

FOOD - 3 stars...this would be a hit in Philly or Boston, I think, but Californians like me are probably looking too hard for the alfalfa and seaweed to appreciate the heavy dishes here
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...it's Belden Place, you know the drill...and stop yelling at me, I'll eat here
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...a polite server who didn't lift his eyebrow at my order
TOTAL - 3 stars...missing the East Coast?...this may be your ticket
author: Ed U.

description:
We had a good time at SAUCE:BELDEN PLACE while San Francisco Restaurant Week. With a bar and a few tables inside (noise level: insane!) and tight outdoor seating this American restaurant has some fine food on the menu - the portions are more on the smaller side so you'd need three courses in order not to leave hungry.

The menu was exclusively made for Restaurant Week - Butternut Squash as starter, a few small but fantastic New York Sirloin cuts (I liked the sea salt on top of it, as well as the sauce!), and Cherry Pie as dessert. A well combined selection and together with a Welcome cocktail worth the $40.

The drinks came fast, the service was attentive, and the meal delicious. Good job, Sauce.
author: Sebastian F.

description: gross. I'm laid up, the most nauseated I have been in a long time after lunch at Sauce earlier today. I took a Lyft home from work and it was the closest I've ever come to not being able to refrain from vomiting. We had the mini chicken pot pies, which were lukewarm, the crab rangoons which were flavorless and came with a dish of applesauce to dip them in (wtf?), the mac and cheese which was rly bland and the (braces to avoid barfing) portabello fries  I'm positive that was the dish that made me sick. They were so oily and greasy and were dredged in an all purpose flour coating then fried in old, rancid grease. I'm so sick, I will never be able to return to Sauce. I feel bad because my coworker highly recommends this place so I didn't tell her that I didn't like it, maybe it was an off day, but all of the food we had was terrible in my opinion :( not to mention: I'm sick!
author: Emma H.

description: Came here for dinner on a weeknight to try their dinner menu. I've been here for lunch and enjoyed the food very much. The place was busy but not fully packed.  We ordered the grilled shrimp salad, mini chicken pot pies, bowl of Bacon and New England seafood chowder. I was disappointed with the food because they were room temperature warm. I was expecting hot pot pies and chowder.  Service was good. I wouldn't go back for dinner.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Food = good. 

Social Plate Sampler Platter (Portobello Mushroom Fries, Lobster Rangoon, Bacon & Eggs (deviled eggs) and Bowl of Bacon (thick cut with brown sugar glaze) = awesome!  We had leftovers of bacon and mushroom fries. I loved the mushroom fries and lobster rangoon, and he loved the bacon! $34.99. (Only complaint was that they put the apple sweet and sour sauce right by the bacon, and we didn't know until we looked at the menu at the end, that it was intended for the lobster rangoon.) 

Sauce Classic Tomato Bisque with white truffle cheese on house focaccia = awesome! Tangy, great seasoning and definitely tomato!  It was hard to put down the cup, and we didn't leave a drop. The sandwich was perfect with the soup, and I couldn't stop dipping it into the soup either. $7.99 cup (bowl for $10.99). 

Mini chicken Pot Pies (4 miniature deconstructed pot pies) = we were not a fan of the heavy dark meat, so we thought it was okay.  $10.99.

Kentucky Buck (Bulleit bourbon, lemon, strawberry & ginger beer) = good and strong. $11.50.

Service = friendly & efficient.  

Seating = tight spot. Bar seating, and mostly 2-tops and 4-tops. Usually there's outdoor seating but it was fairly late, so the outside chairs were up on the tables. 

Oh, and they've got TVs at every angle! They had Vegas Vacation and then it switched to Groundhog Day, and from what I'm reading in other reviews...I'm sure you can catch a ball game here, too. 

Prices = moderate. Late dinner for two came out to $71.20. 

Overall = if you need late night food, this is the place. Kitchen is open until 1 a.m. every day! They've got a full bar, too.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Came to Sauce to celebrate a birthday with friends. Party of 10. 

Nice ambiance. I like the high bar stools- though sometimes I forgot and didn't realize I was so high off the ground. 

The chicken pot pie appetizer: Pretty tasty. Just two or three bites. Not really a chicken pot pie (I imagine a bit more liquid filling, and more puff pastry on top), but flavors were great combo and it was fun to eat.
The burger: This is not on the menu. We had to ask our waitress about it, and since our group was large, she had to repeat it for different people several times and get back to us about the pricing every time we had questions. They should really put this on the menu. It'd make all our lives easier and we would have ordered like ten minutes earlier. 
Lobster bisque: Not my thing. I was sick when eating this so that could have drastically affected it, but everyone at the table was not enthused with this. They all said it tasted too strongly of "seafood". It was really gross for me (but sick, so my half my tastebuds were turned off). 
Tomato basil soup: I didn't enjoy the soup very much. It was too acidic for me, so it started hurting my tongue. However, I thoroughly enjoyed the truffle cheese sandwich that came with it. It even came in four little triangles- yes basically I am a little girl and I like my sandwich cut into smaller pieces. I dipped my sandwich into the soup to deepen the flavors. It was yum. But once I finished the sandwich, I stopped drinking the soup. 

Weird outcome of the night: My friend paid our whole bill on her credit card. They ended up calling us less than 10 minutes later asking why she didn't tip. She had assumed that since we were a group of 10 that the tip was already added onto the bill. Poor thing- they didn't have to make her feel bad about it. She ended up just telling them to add 18% tip. I'm sure our waitress was much happier after that phone call- so that's good. 

I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but eating here with friends is pretty fun. (:
author: Tiffany W.

description:
This place is a 5 star place for sure. BUT our server was a little disappointing. I still left him a 20 dollar tip, because I'm a descent human being. 

Food: hands down, probably the BEST burger I've ever had. It was unbelievable. The burger was perfectly cooked to medium. It had some time of caramelized bacon that was to die for.

Pro tip: they have happy hour. I got a huge glass of wine for 6.50

They also have a "cocktail of the day" goes by the day of the week. Today's special cocktail was great. Similar to a margarita. The regular price was 11.50 (happy hour price was 8). 

Appetizers: bacon scallops. Delicious but small plate/portion for 12 dollars. 

Mushroom fries: tasty. Idk if I would order them again. 

Burger: 5 stars. Best I've ever had. 

I go to school 10 minutes away walking from the restaurant. It's located in an adorable alley. Very European looking. There's an outdoor patio or you can sit inside. Everything on the menu sounded delicious. From the pics on Yelp it all looks the same, very fresh and colorful. I'll go back in a heartbeat. The drink specials are amazing for the financial district!
author: Cece F.

description: The food was so good and sitting outside under the Edison lights in SF with work colleagues.
author: peter k.

description:
Sauce's social plates = appetizer bliss

Sauce is a casual restaurant with a little something for everyone. I was lured here by its promising starters and wide selection of drinks, and I definitely got what I asked for. The portions are the perfect shareable size and surprisingly filling! 

Between two people, we ordered:
- Ham hock tater tots: Perfectly crisp on the outside, and a decadent mashed potato texture on the inside. Served with ketchup and a zesty green sauce.
- Mini chicken pot pies: So cute! Chicken was tender, and these were so fun to eat.
- Portobello mushroom fries: Possibly my favorite dish of the night. I gobbled these up (by myself).
- Garlic cheesy bread: So. Much. Cheese. So. Many. Carbs. How could I say no? 

Overall, Sauce was a positive dining experience that made a lasting impression. There's something about its comfy atmosphere that makes it the perfect spot to catch up with friends. They also have patio seating with heated lamps and cute hanging lights in the alleyway that it's located in. I'll be back soon to try the delicious-looking entrees!
author: Nicole P.

description:
I'm in love with Belden Place! I didn't even know this alleyway of restaurants existed until I was Yelping somewhere to eat lunch with a friend and came across Sauce. There's indoor and outdoor seating. We chose to sit indoors, even though it was rather loud with the TVs blaring. Sauce is a good place for a casual catch-up either for lunch or dinner.

I ordered the highly recommended Mushroom Fries, which were SO GOOD. Mind you, they're only good when they're hot so eat them all right away. Once they get cold... they're kinda nasty. The dipping sauce is tasty. For my entree, I had a cup of the Seafood Chowder, which the waitress recommended over the Lobster Bisque. Very hearty and filling.

I kept having to look around for our waitress, who was socializing with her colleagues. It was a little annoying after awhile. Even though she was friendly, she was not very present with her customers. Anyways, the food was good. High class bar food, I would say. Oh they also have bar seating so I'd imagine this is a good place to watch the game, have some beers, and chow down on their menu munchies.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Ripped off, that's how I feel. Totally ripped off. Service was adequate to good (varied through the evening) and the ambience is fine. The food portions, however,  were miniscule and of insufficient quality to make me feel ok about the small servings. Food was bland and completely uninspired. I hate to give a low rating like this, but Belden Alley has so much better to offer. 

We ordered the beef carpaccio and fried chicken entree and flourless chocolate cake. Carpaccio was $9 for about 3 slices of meat. I thought it would be fine spending over $20 for fried chicken because the menu dedcribed it as a breast with wing and leg (maybe it said thigh). I really thought I was getting 1/2 a chicken, which is why we decided to share the entree. What I got was the smallest airline/frenched chicken breast ever, accompanied by tiny frenched thigh. The coating wasn't very crispy and the whole dish lacked seasoning and flavor. The one good part was the sauteed spinach amd kale. How is it that the greens are better than the fried chicken?!  Dessert was very rich and beautiful, so that's safe. 

I'm sorry, but never going back. This city has too many other options where I will happily spend my hard earned cash.
author: Areena M.

description: Enjoyed the meal - service was great and friendly atmosphere eating in Belden Ally.
author: Roland G.

description: Delicious! Period! the MAC AND CHEESE was phenomenal! I also had the carpaccio which was fresh and delicious. Definitely a place on my list every time I visit SF :)
author: Homa S.

description:
Met up with a friend for an early dinner on a Friday night. We hadn't made reservations but since we were super-early it wasn't a problem. It's a pretty small place, very long and narrow, but had a nice upscale-casual ambiance. I started things off with a Ballast Point Grapefruit Sculpin IPA on draft and almost did a double take when I saw that it was $9. Seriously? For a semi-fancy beer?? Prices overall were on the high side (it's SF, after all), but at least the quality of ingredients and preparation was good. I got their Tomato bisque with truffled grilled cheese and an order of the portobello mushroom fries. My friend got the ham hock tater tots and the lobster roll. My soup and sandwich were great, but the portobello fries were just OK to me--something about the texture didn't agree with me, I think. My friend really liked her food (especially the lobster roll) so not a lot to complain about on the food front. Service was good, too--our waiter was friendly and prompt. So overall a good experience, but am I dying to go back? Not really.

STEPH JUDGEMENT: Good food and ambiance, but a bit pricey, especially the beers!
author: Steph H.

description:
My friends and I (who haven't seen each other in forever) made reservations at Sauce for a Friday night. Like most Yelpers said, it's easy to miss so keep your GPS open and your eyes peeled. It was down a super cute alley with lots of other cool looking bars and restaurants. 

We were seated right away outdoors and let the reunion begin. We ordered a round of drinks -
I got the Moscow Mule. For $10.50 it was pretty tasty. 

We started with the appetizer sampler - it came with deviled eggs, mushroom fries, a bowl or bacon, and lobster wontons. It was delicious and the perfect thing to share with our beverages. We also ordered the tater tots - delicious! Their appetizers were delicious in my opinion - I didn't want to move past that portion of the menu. 

For "dinner" I ordered a side of Mac-N-Cheese (couldn't resist) - and shared the lobster bisque with my boyfriend. Both were very tasty in my mind. 

I thoroughly enjoyed Sauce and would come back in a heartbeat.
author: Courtney P.

description:
Late Night Option
Contemporary American

The chef/owner and bartender were incredibly kind and accommodating to our late night visit. Healthful options, filling, and great flavor. Corn salad with tomatoes was tasty, nothing over the top amazing, but everything was good.

The Scene: Casual, Comfort
Destination Rating: 6
Date Rating: 3
Hob Nob Potential: 4 

Note: Home cooked with love... especially the bacon...mmmm bacon.... ;)
author: Megan C.

description: Trendy place. My house made veggie burger was not good. It really lacked taste.  My husband had the grilled  chicken breast sandwich and it was chicken pieces overloaded with cheese. I thought the tortilla chips the came to the table were tastier than my food. And we were both hungry having a long flight and not eaten in 6 hours so you would think anything would be good.
author: Lisa F.

description:
Excellent spot if you have a big group! I came with a party of 8 and they were very accommodating. 

I recommend getting the Social Platter if you have at least 4 people. It has basically all the social plates and is excellent for sharing. You get mini pot pies, deviled eggs, portabello mushroom fries, and a bowl of bacon. The portabello fries were crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside, Mmmm.

Brussel Sprouts Salad - The bacon candy makes this dish. It was an excellent contrast to the fried and rich items we ordered.

Mac & Cheese - creamy, cheesy, and delicious! The mac was chewy, much like gnocchi.

The food took a while but they start you off with some dinner rolls. Service was great and they even let us split the check even though there were so many of us. Will be back for the food, ambiance, and service!
author: Lucy N.

description:
Took my parents here in April and they were both disappointed. They both ordered the $12.99
Rainbow Quinoa & Kale Salad which is not a salad at all. It's basically quinoa which has been shaped in a small dessert ramekin with bits of kale. Totally overpriced and with little flavor. My parents don't send back food & were too polite to complain. When I mentioned it at the end of the meal, that it was poorly described on the menu, the man taking our plates was rude and said it was accurate. He could have at least told us he would pass along the feedback. I had the beet salad plus chicken which was fine although pretty easy to make. Not going here again.
author: Shana L.

description: Sauce was our first stop of many in San Francisco, and it definitely set the bar for us. We tried the mini meatloaf dish and the scallops. Both were executed very well and presented nicely. They tasted just like the menu described, and if we weren't meeting up with others elsewhere, I would have indulged on more items.
author: Monica V.

description: Brussels sprouts salad with seared salmon--very tender fish and the pumpkin seeds complimented the leaves so perfectly. Service was good and responsive!
author: Raya K.

description:
09.22.15 etc.
 
We did it. We turned rounds of appetizers into dinner. And left stuffed!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sauce-san-francisco-3?select=VnZfWfNWizkVZFTOua1YDg

Mini chicken pot pies - the crust could use a bit more flakiness, but the filling was flavorful.
Mushroom fries - I can just order these and be happy.
Dungeness crab rangoon - fried deliciousness.
Deviled eggs - topped with bacon.
A bowl of bacon - need I say more?
Mac and cheese - creamy and gooey.

Shoutout to our lovely waitress who was beyond patient with us and handled our awkward humor with grace.

Total damage for three: $146
author: Jenny L.

description:
Had catering from here once and wasn't particularly impressed. Catering was fine in terms of freshness and preparedness, but the food itself was forgettable. 

-BACON WRAPPED MINI MEATLOAF ($10.50) - 2.5/5
Meh. Bacon lovers might enjoy it because of the bacon, but I didn't like the flavor of the meatloaf itself. Tasted kind of sour.

-CANDIED PECAN & ASIAN PEAR SALAD ($9.50) - 3.5/5
Not super special. Dressing is light and citrusy

-FRIED ROSIE'S ORGANIC CHICKEN ($21.50) - 2.5/5
Disappointing. Greasy on the outside, dry on the inside, especially the breast pieces. The drumsticks are a little juicier but still on the dry side.
author: Jessie L.

description:
I always wanted to try this place and finally had a chance to on Friday night.  I love the ambiance.  They have an outdoor area and plenty of space inside as well.

We ordered:
Moscow Mule 
Bowl of Bacon 
Braised Beef Sliders
Mac n Cheese
Garlic Bread
S'mores

The bowl of bacon was bit of a disappointment.  It was hard and the texture was like beef jerky.  It would probably taste better with the eggs.  I ate it with the mac n cheese and was pretty good, but for $8.50 or however much it was, I don't think it was worth getting.  

The sliders were really good.  Mac n cheese was really good with the garlic bread and bacon.

For dessert, we had the s'mores and it was AMAZING!  I definitely suggest the s'mores.  The marshmallow top was like candy.  Everything went well with each other.  

Great place for a date or group of friends!  The Moscow Mule was really delicious too.
author: Rachel L.

description: Great food, great service.  Durning our one week vacation to SFO, we ate here 3 times and it was great every time.  We went late on week nights and our kids were welcome.  This place has a cool bar and good dinner seating.  It is a bit on the high side price wise, but, you get what you pay for.  I had three dishes and they were all excellent.  Give this place a try, you won't be sorry.
author: Reggie V.

description:
Wanted to try.. then saw a rerun of "check please, Bay Area" (for the Gough location)-- and remembered they had one on Belden Place, which is more convenient-- anyway!! Finally ended up here after theater matinee-- 5pm, we made it in time for the happy hour-- which included sliders if preferred (we did, they were fried chicken, and the best thing we had all night.)
The happy hour drink was only meh.  We ordered a 2nd round based on value.. not the best, but we didn't want to try anything else and risk spending more.
Next we shared the portabello mushroom fries (good, cut a bit too thick.. got soggy) and the amount of ranch ratio against the amount and size?  Didn't really match up.
Lastly, we shared bacon-wrapped scallops?  On the small side and one-note, but not bad at all.

Nothing BAD here.. and the people and service really are top-notch.  Very attentive and nice.
I just wasn't blown away, and can't think of reason to come back.
I'm bummed kinda.. but I do love Belden Place, and there are lots of options if you want them.
author: Kelly C.

description:
Finally had a chance to check out Belden Place aka French Quarters after passing by it so many times. My friend decided we should meet at Sauce, a place she frequents often when kicking off her night.

Drinks
The changing daily drink special is refreshing but also limiting
Variety of draft beers is adequate but the size is disappointing 

Food 
Mac and Cheese-good portion, gooey chessy goodness 
Tater Tots-well made, liked the addition of the ham hocks inside
Mini Pot Pies-PASS!!!! dried out, bland, totally lacking comfort 

Overall Thoughts

Some highs in food but not much when it comes to drinks but still a nice place to start off the night
author: Eddie W.

description: A really good food in a quaint little alleyway. I stopped by for wine and the appetizers plate, which was really good. The mini chicken pot pies are probably my favorite appetizer of them all, I could just eat them all day long.
author: Bryan M.

description:
I was in the area and Sauce came up when I was looking through OpenTable for a dinner spot. We easily made a reservation for 2 people on Friday, July 31st at 8:45pm.

Food:
*Social plate sampler platter ($34.99): mushroom fries, crab rangoon, deviled eggs & a bowl of bacon
-Portobello mushroom fries: fat boy ranch dipping sauce
-Dungeness crab rangoon: fresh crab, cream cheese, green onion & cilantro, sweet & sour apple sauce
-Bacon & eggs: cage free deviled eggs with crispy brown sugar
-Bowl of peppered bacon: thick cut with brown sugar glaze
*Baked mac & cheese ($10.99): fresh pasta, six cheeses, ham hock & fresh herbs
*Maine lobster bisque ($14.99): crostini & butter poached lobster
*Grilled akaushi Kobe sirloin steak ($27.99): arugula, pumpkin seeds, point reyes blue & red wine onions, crispy potato skins served with baked potato accompaniments, buttery demi Glace
*Warm maine lobster roll ($27.99): 4oz maine lobster, lobster butter, dijon aioli, house made butter toasted bun, cheddar tortillas with green goddess dip & side salad
*Strawberries & cream ($7.99): fresh strawberries, brown sugar and cream

The sampler platter is huge! No way two people can finish this. I really enjoyed the crab rangoons and mushroom fries. The deviled eggs were okay. The bowl or bacon was way too much. I don't know how even a party of four could finish this. I liked the lobster bisque. Creamy and good lobster flavor. The baked mac and cheese was great as well. Super cheesy and comforting. So I don't know if they changed the entrees, but our entrees seemed to be missing some components. We didn't get any baked potato accompaniments with the steak. And our lobster roll didn't come with cheddar tortillas with green goddess dip. But the proteins were delicious and nicely prepared. The strawberries & cream was a nice way to end our meal.

Drinks:
*Barrel aged root manhattan ($12.50): russell's reserve 10 yr bourbon and pre-prohibition era root spirit with punt e mes vermouth, aged in a lightly charred barrel and finished with orange bitters
*Manhattan whistle ($17): whistle pig 10 year rye, carpano antica vermouth and a dash of bitters
*Irish coffee ($9.50)
*Mexican coffee ($9.50)

Drinks were great! I enjoyed my manhattan whistle. Though I did think at $17, it was a little pricey. The Irish coffee at the end was nice too. Paired well with the strawberries.

Even though we had a late dinner, the restaurant was bustling. Lots of diners coming by for dinner, snacks and drinks. Our dinner was four hours long and it was more or less busy the entire time.

Cute place to take someone for dinner. And the food is reasonably priced for the portions. We sat inside, but if you'd like more of an outdoor feel, there was plenty of seating on Belden Lane. On a nice SF night, I'm betting it would be quite romantic.
author: Elena N.

description:
This  restaurant is definitely worth a taste if you are in the area. It is a place well suited for group dinners. They have an excellent assortment of group sampler dishes.

I had a taste of the mini chicken pot pies and they were rather good. They don't exactly taste like pot pies, but there are qualities that that are similar. The mini pot pies are a bit of the soft side. They lack a well formed exterior crust that most people love in chicken pot pies. Don't get me wrong, they are still rather good, nonetheless. They have a delightful, yet simple taste to them.

Lastly, I recommend ordered the Braised short rib stroganoff. The meat is incredibly tender, and so the soft noodles compliment the dish well. All of the flavors come together to compliment one another. The only thing that is off about this dish is the asparagus, which does not properly blend with the taste of everything else.
author: David N.

description:
Romantic.

With a row of restaurants tucked away in an alley set against a backdrop of high rises in the Financial District, the atmosphere at Belden Place is very European and most restaurants here are. Sauce is a bit different, serving American comfort food.

It was a no brainer to get a variety of small plates for our group: portabello mushroom fries, deviled eggs with bacon, mini chicken pot pies. Also try the bowl of candied bacon and ham tater tots. While the apps were meant to be shared, I was ecastatic that the lobster roll was all mine! Generous mound of fresh lobster in a split top buttery roll, it's wholly satisfying and won't weigh you down.

Our server had to keep up with all our requirements for lent: mocktails for the girls, no desserts for me, no fried food/meat for my friends, etc. He joked that we were a very "complicated" table and yes, it did take us a long time to order! =)  But when you're at a splendid place like Sauce, you can't help but take your time and linger.  

Strolling into Belden Place on a rare 70 degree San Francisco night is magical. I can't wait to come back here again and create more delicious memories.
author: Janice C.

description:
After going to Sauce on Belden on a few occasions, I can safely say it's my go-to spot for having a nice al fresco dining experience and also for taking out-of-town friends for a nice dinner.

While Sauce has a pretty extensive menu, most of their focus is centered towards their Social Plates which is great if you're dining in groups.  With my first two visits we pretty much ordered all Social Plates.  

Social Plate Sampler Platter  -- http://bit.ly/1kU8epH
Mini Pot Pies, Deviled Eggs, Portabello Mushroom Fries
Also comes with a Bowl of Bacon! -- http://bit.ly/1eFKWMU
This is basically what every party should order their first time dining at Sauce since it pretty much covers most of their popular Social Plates.  And it's a lot of food!  The real highlights of the sampler are the Portabello Mushroom Fries and the Bowl of Bacon.  The PM Fries come with a Ranch Dipping sauce and is so good!  I think even if you're not a mushroom fan, you'll probably want to dive into these suckers!! 
Here's another look at the Portabello Mushroom Fries when ordered separately --  (http://bit.ly/Pz7maK).  And the Bowl of Bacon is just simply magical.  Their Bacon is really sweet and smokey.  It's almost like candy!

If there's one constant that featured through their menu, it's definitely their Bacon.  They serve it in a bowl, on their Deviled Eggs, with their Salmon, and wrapped around mini meatloaf nuggets.

Here are more of their Social Plates that are pretty amazing:

Bacon Wrapped Mini Meatloaf --  http://bit.ly/Pz7irn
Whipped Potato & Pan Gravy

Prosciutto Wrapped Figs -- http://bit.ly/SoHY4o
Point Reyes Blue Cheese, Balsamic Reduction, Arugula

Seasoned Fry Poutine --  http://bit.ly/SoHYBA
Mozzarella Cheese Curds, Pan Gravy

They do have main entrees ranging from Fried Chicken, a Deviled Egg Filled Bacon Cheeseburger, and Lobster Rolls to highlight a few.  But believe it or not, one of my favorite items from their main course menu is actually a Veggie dish.

Vegetarian Strudel --  http://bit.ly/1eFL66W
Asparagus, Tomato, Spinach, Herbed Cream Cheese & Four Cheese Blend Wrapped in Phyllo Dough and Served with Tomato Bisque
This was surprisingly good!  While the strudel itself was like an awesome Hot Pocket, it was really the pairing with Tomato Bisque that made it shine!  Don't overlook this item, it's really underrated!!

I do like how they are open pretty late on the weekend so that if you can stop over for a late bite after having a few drinks around town.  And they seem to have some great Happy Hour specials.

Overall, if you're looking for a spot that's easily accessible for dinner and for a very unique dining experience in the FiDi, I highly recommend Sauce on Belden.
author: Rodney H.

description:
You got two options at sauce - order a bunch of apps to share or order an entree and feast. You'll be just fine either way! 

Standouts from the night were: 

Ham Hock Tater Tots: piping hot, crispy, great seasoning.  

Brussel Sprouts Salad: Did not know brussel sprouts could taste so good! They were sliced super fine and tossed in an amazing vinaigrette

This place can get kind of crowded and you feel like you might lose your arm for how much you have to wave for a check but all in all a cute stop with some tasty bites.
author: Kelly E.

description:
What a great trip to Europe on Belden Place! My office team and I enjoyed an afternoon lunch at Sauce on a sunny Wednesday. The atmosphere of Belden Place is hard to beat... tiny cafes squished together on a side-street of Bush, in the heart of FiDi.

Sauce offers a menu that I would consider perfect for dinner, but a bit heavy for lunch. The fried chicken that my coworkers had would be a great Sunday night meal, but not so much a lunch before heading back to work for 4 more hours. The shrimp salad (the only salad on the menu for an entree) was completely doused in dressing, and should have tasted much fresher for including so much avocado and shrimp.

I appreciate the effort by Sauce to meet the lunch crowd, but I noticed the inside was completely empty on that Wednesday. I'd reccomend Sauce for happy hour (starting at 2:30pm!) because their drinks look divine, but steer clear during lunch hour unless you want to head back to the office with a food coma.
author: Kerry G.

description: This is a nice late night restaurant/bar located on Belden Street. As of this writing, there are two locations for Sauce.  Both locations have identical menus.  I had a nice experience dining at their Belden Street location.  The food and customer service was very good.  I highly recommend the Portobello Mushroom Fries.  It was light, not oily, and flavorful. I liked it more than regular fries. I also recommend  the Bowl of Bacon.  The bacon was cooked perfectly.  It was flavorful. It smelled wonderful. As for entrees, the Maine Lobster Roll which was pretty good and well made. The meat was delicious. I also had the bacon wrapped meatloaf, which was also pretty good.  As for dessert, I recommend the Guinness Milk Shake.  A nice combination of Guinness beer and ice cream.  Moreover, this place has Cronuts on their dessert menu.  I tried their Cronut dessert (at their Gough Street location), it was also very good.  It came with a tasty and sweet sauce.  The Cronuts were nice and crunchy.
author: Hiroshi K.

description: Ate here for the first time this week and brought a client. We sat outside, which was very pleasant. There's a casual, outdoor cafe type vibe to the place, and to be accurate, I would say that pricing is approximately $$1/2. We had the ham hock tater tots and portobello mushroom fries as starters, which were delicious and flavorful. For mains, I had the Maine lobster roll, which was delicious. Fortunately, I didn't have an allergic reaction (yes, it's happened previously), but it would be an understatement to say that the lobster portions in the roll were generous. There were huge chunks of lobster, and it was awesome! Highly recommend. Only recommendation would be to expand the wine by the glass menu, as there was only one Pinot Noir available by the glass.
author: Ravi K.

description:
So the day I ended up coming to Sauce was the same day that I got slightly drunk (okay more than slightly) because one of the coolest directors at the firm got promoted to partner.  But I met up with a few friends here and we ordered some drunken munchies for me. 

We got: 
-Mini Chicken Pot Pies: These were supposed to be the highlights - what we were going to 
-Mac n Cheese: cheesey, but not the best mac n cheese I've ever had - that's for sure. 
-Mushroom fries: Even though I'm not in love with mushrooms, I'll did really enjoy it. It was a good combination of crunchy and soft. The sauce was pretty good as well. 
-Tater Tots: Apparently they had ham in it? I didnt even realize that. They were decent, but again, I've had much better tater tots. 

I really wanted to enjoy the food here - it seems like a pretty awesome bar, but it wasn't the best I've had food wise. 

Protip: get there early, it gets backed pretty quickly!
author: Nina Y.

description:
Everything we got here was really good. 

Mini meat loads
Ham hog tots
Tomato bisque 
Portobello mushroom fries(my fav)
Chicken sandwhich

Plus our server was very nice and ran out after a customer who left their phone in the restaurant. She caught them but not after chasing them for a bit. 

Definitely would come back
author: Timothy T.

description:
Very good meal! 

It is restaurant week so there was a menu for $40 which included a Caesar salad, Seared salmon on vegetables followed up with a warm mini brownie and ice cream served with a pour of Port wine. The food was prompt, service was nice and friendly and the atmosphere was great for dinner at a bar.
author: Caleb S.

description:
Sauce has a beautiful outdoor patio on Belden Place. It's kind of their thing. And when the sun goes down and SF cools off (as it's wont to do), they've got heat lamps out there. 

Unfortunately for the folks inside the actual restaurant, the door stays open and there are no heat lamps, so it's cold as fuck, and you probably have to keep your jacket on as you eat. 

My whining aside, Sauce is a good spot. A better than decent beer selection, and plenty of specialty cocktails to choose from can take care of your beverage needs. (Personally, the barrel-aged root manhattan was a bit too bitter for my taste, but to each their own.) 

I haven't had the pleasure of a full meal yet, but for a snack I recently ordered the bacon-wrapped mini-meatloaf. I didn't realize that this dish is actually four mini-loafs, which explains why the lovely bartender pitied me so much (nothing sadder than a share plate for one). 

The four loafs atop their bed of mashed potatoes makes for a SUBSTANTIAL amount of food, far more than I would've thought. They were solid enough; the bacon didn't add much, but the gravy/mashed combo was a good one. By extension, I think you could do a lot worse than Sauce for a cold, lonely dinner.
author: Peter D.

description:
BOMB food and located in a really cute alley. I would consider this a great date night spot in the summer. They have seating outside in the alley with heat lamps so I can totally imagine the romantic mood.

I came here on a Friday night for a friend's bday and didn't wait at all for a table to be open - granted we came around 10 PM.

We waited for our waiter a little bit (he was a litto slow all night) and finally flagged him down to get our drink and food orders. Friend and I ordered the portobello fries, stroganoff and the "kobe" beef. Food was super delicious and came in huge portion. I HIGHLY recommend the portobello fries. They were fat, lightly fried in batter and very very juicy. Normally I don't like mushroom but they were so so good here.

Total came to $140 (2 appetizers, 2 entrees, 2 shots, 2 mixed drinks). Not too bad right?

The only gripe I had was that our waiter was really disinterested in us for some reason. And the hostess sat us next to the bathroom and unfortunately we would get waves of poo smell. 

But at least the food was good?
author: Tina T.

description:
I dropped by Sauce last Friday to meet an old friend for lunch. I have been in a lull at work (bored), which actually makes me crazier than being insanely busy (not bored), so I decided to do all of those things I've been meaning to do but haven't. ... Restless person syndrome, and all. 

Sauce is located in Belden Place, one of my favorite alleys for lunch in the Financial District. Be careful that you don't confuse it with Belden Taverna right next door--they have an extremely convincing hostess (but that place is fly too, so no worries if you have a brain cramp). 

I booked a reservation on open table with no hassle. Briefly, did you know you can't reserve a table for greater than five people on Open Table? Weird, because having a large party is probably a major reason to reserve a table in the first place. 

Anyhow, I was sat immediately for a 1:00 p.m. reservation on a Friday (hurrah). My friend joined, and we ordered drinks--he ordered an iced tea (bored), whereas I ordered a dark and stormy (not bored).  It was a solid cocktail-not too dark and not too stormy.  You can't really go wrong with black rum, unless you don't drink enough. 

Sauce's menu is quite appealing. I wanted all of the social plates: mini chicken pot pies, sausage cheese bread, bacon wrapped mini meatloaf... All of that sounds smashing to me. Social plates at lunch, however, are hard to justify, so we skipped right to entrees. I ordered the salmon (bored?) and my friend ordered the burger (not bored). 

I note that almost everyone gets the burger, and it is a lovely thing to behold. It's a double, served with bacon, American cheese, chipotle aioli and ketchup. Yum--as an aspiring burger savant, I admit I was tempted to order it. But as a girl who has been clocking mad hours at the gym due to December's peppermint bark fiasco, I could not. I would not. 

But as boring as I thought my order was, I was dead wrong.  It may have been the best salmon dish I've ever had. Sauce's menu describes it as "sustainably farmed, spinach, bacon, tomato, horseradish and lemon." It is all of those things AND a new handbag!  Those flavors were complementary and so delicious together. The bacon--oh, the bacon. And the horseradish was just enough to give the dish a kick of excitement. The salmon was tailored to my taste--not so underdone that it's practically swimming off of the table, yet not so overdone that it's dry and flavorless. 

The service is great. The price is standard for San Francisco. You won't be bored.
author: Sunny S.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday dinner. The beef stroganoff I ordered was good - the pieces of meat were tender and the sauce was flavourful, although the pasta was slightly past al dente. The social plates sounded intriguing but no one in our party wanted to share any. 

Service was friendly and attentive, especially considering our large party (and no automatic gratuity was added either - a rarity). 

Would definitely not mind coming back to try out their other offerings.
author: Oliver L.

description:
I was in town for work and this restaurant was recommended by a friend. First off, the outdoor patio is adorable and has this whole Euro thing going on (which I loved), although it is a little cramped for space.

We started with the Moscow mules (yummy) and the crab ragoons (just OK). The ragoons were loaded with crab meat and had little cream cheese, so really just not what I'm used to. 

For main course, we both had the Kobe steak sirloin, which was outta this world good! So juicy and tender! And I couldn't pass up the cinnamon doughnuts for dessert!

Service was decent, judging on how busy they were. Next time Im back in SF, I will be back for sure!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
We saw a late show at the Embarcadero and had the munchies.  We went back to the Hyatt but everything was closed.  Nobody could think of anything that might still be open close by except the clubs on Broadway.  We got in a cab and our driver said he knew of a place.  It was 1am on a Thursday night and this place was open.

There were just two guys sitting a the bar.  They told us we could cuddle up next to each other at a booth in the back.  We had the fries with gravy (well she did, not me)  I had the mini pot pies which hit the spot.  Small dish put it was late and we did not want to fill ourselves up.  

Very romantic late night eatery.  Highly recommend!  Friendly staff and they did not rush us even though we stayed past 2am closing
author: Erik H.

description:
I was pretty excited when my date told me we would be going to Sauce. I have heard many good things about this restaurant! 

First of all, the alley way with all the restaurants and the outdoor seating is so charming. (: 

We got there at about 1130 PM for a late late dinner on Friday night. We seated ourselves and service was prompt! I had a yummy glass of the only Chardonnay they offer by the glass, I'm blanking on the name but it was good. We split the mini pot pies, the lobster roll and the hangar steak. I just wish the hangar steak didn't have so much sauce, but I get that's their theme, lol. The lobster in the lobster roll was excellent, I couldn't even get myself to try the roll it came on because it just looked to rich and buttery but my date said it was good. I didn't try the polenta fries or Cajun fries either that came with our entrees, but my date said they were great. I had one mini pot pie with gravy and it was yummy! 

They serve til two on Fridays, we stayed until about 130. Great late night restaurant! I recommend you try at least once!
author: Anne C.

description:
I came here with a friend after a long day at work - ready to eat and drink. We were really excited for the Ham Hock Tater Tots, but unfortunately they were mediocre. We couldn't taste the flavor of anything other than potato. I still love tater tots...but if I'm paying for speciality flavors, I better taste it! 

On the other hand, the Portabello Mushroom Fries were good. They were perfectly breaded and light considering they were deep fried. We couldn't eat a lot of them though since it was still a little too much oil for us. 

Our favorite was the mac and cheese. Super creamy and full of cheesy goodness! The macaroni had the right amount of chewiness. Would def recommend this.

Overall, this place is alright. It's a nice, cozy place to catch up with a friend but it didn't really stand out to me.
author: Evelyn C.

description: looooove this place! go there! The people who work there are awesome, the food is amzing. Belden Alley rocks!
author: Chazz D.

description:
We made reservations on a Friday night, and as we turned the corner on Belden to get to the restaurant, there was a ROW of other restaurants in an alley-- this was surprising to me (haha SF n00b) but I loved how creative these restaurants utilized the city space!

We got seated immediately in the cute patio area. I was excited to see their beer menu-- they had a pretty good selection of craft beers. I chose one of the Firestone IPAs (it was perfect).

I ordered the Seared Safe Harbor Certified Salmon. The Salmon was amazing because on the outside, it was slightly crispy due to it being seared, but when you pierce your fork through it, the salmon was soft on the inside. I was so happy when I ate it-- so freaking happy because it was perfect and was not even a bit over-cooked.

My boyfriend ordered the Braised Beef Short Rib Stroganoff. I know I really liked my salmon dish, but his was even better. The beef had a robust flavor, and the long/flat pasta (how I usually like my pasta) was supple. 

When we finished off our entrees, our waiter tempted us with the dessert menu. Normally my bf and I never order dessert-- but we just couldn't resist the PB&J (pan seared sponge cake layered with homemade strawberry preserve and frangelico peanut butter vanilla ice cream center). When dessert arrived at our table, the presentation of it didn't look like much, but when we dug in, I was able to quickly realize the PB&J flavor was apparent, the cake-y part of it was also light and fluffy. Such a good way to end our dinner.

Sauce is definitely a great place to dine. It had a nice ambience (it's funny how you can turn an alley into something so cool), great food, and a wonderful selection of craft beers. The only thing that inhibits me from wanting to give it the full five stars is that the amount of food that you receive isn't what you're paying for. I didn't think I was full even after dessert.
author: Grace H.

description:
One of the best meals I've had in a while! Food wise we ordered the sampler, clam chowder, lobster roll and the cinnamon sugar donuts.

The sampler was so simple but so tasty! When I read the description and it said it came with a bowl of bacon, I questioned it! Really?! A bowl of bacon?! The server said it was so good we would eat it like popcorn! And they were right! The sampler came with a bowl of bacon, deviled eggs, portobello mushroom fries and something similar to crab wontons. Everything was so good! Except the mushroom fries were just okay for us. My boyfriend loved his clam chowder, and we split the lobster roll which was delicious! The cinnamon sugar donuts were good, but even better with the dipping sauce it came with!

For drinks we ordered the ginger Cosmo, dark and stormy, rock n rye and the lemonade vodka drink. All of them were a hit except the lemonade one was way too sweet. 

Would definitely recommend this place!
author: Jasmine J.

description: Great service, food quality was very good but every thing from the appetizer to the salad to the entree was heavily salted.  You really had to concentrate to get to the actual flavors of the food.
author: Grümpi V.

description:
This place would have definitely gotten five stars had it not been for the great service that went south at the end. 

Called up to ask about dress code and the girl that answered the phone was so friendly and so helpful that it cemented me eating here (I was looking at several places). I don't know her name, but she was adorable!

Went in and was greeted by the girl I spoke to on the phone. I asked at first to be sat at the bar, then changed my mind, then changed my mind again. She never got irritated or aggravated. Just sweet the whole time! I wanted to sit at a table she first said was reserved, but then she changed her mind and let me sit there anyway. I wish I could have remembered her name, she was great!

Went in and was greeted by my waiter and at first all went well. He was really quick. I ordered the portobello mushroom fries and they were mind blowing. I could have just eaten those and been happy. I wanted to try everything, but with that not possible I ordered the pan seared salmon and it was very, very good. I had to tell the waiter how I wanted it cooked, but oh well. It came out pretty quickly and was really good. It sat on a bed of greens with onions that I had to pick out, it was a little much, but overall really great.

My water got low and my waiter just kept passing me by the more tables he got until the bartender had to start waiting on me. I was disappointed that the service dropped like that and I was ignored for the larger parties when it started out so well. 

At any rate, it was a good meal and I'd recommend the mushroom fries all day long!
author: Nic P.

description:
Amazing late night restaurant/ bar. Serving food until 1am.
It is down an alley and at 11:45pm it may look closed from the end of the alley but it isn't. 

Fantastic staff, delicious food, wonderful menu, luscious drinks and great atmosphere!
Go if this sounds appealing to you and you want a chilled out atmosphere where you can eat and drink until your heart is content!
author: Emma A.

description:
Great service from Rebecca. It was a cold rainy night so this comfort food was very welcome. It's comfort food in a very nice bar setting. 
The hostess didn't want to sit us at the roomier 4 person seating (we were just a couple) and we asked very nicely but got some attitude. The restaurant was only 1/4 full. 
After this start it only got better. The server Rebecca was most accommodating. She made great suggestions on the food. The tomato bisque, Brussel sprout salad and pot roast were very good. 
A very enjoyable evening!
author: Walter T.

description:
I came here with my friend pretty late on a Wednesday night and got seated right away! We chose outdoor seating and it was nicely heated and lighted. 

Mini Chicken Pot Pies: So good and so cute! They were pretty tiny but they were super delicious. My friend says he would come back just to order these again!

Peppered New York Steak: We both ordered this and it was really good! It was a bit pricey considering how few slices you got but the steak was cooked perfectly and the salad complemented it really well. The potato wedges came with baked-potato toppings and they were really good too!

Overall a really good meal! We came hungry and left pleasantly stuffed.
author: Jessica Z.

description:
Italian food in a beautiful intimate restaurant located in a cool little alley that isn't sketchy? I'm down to try it! 

Came here w/my bf for our 1 yr & the food did not disappoint. For appetizers, my bf & I started w/ the Portobello Mushroom Fries, Ham Hock Tater Tots & Crab Cakes, their special of the day. We went through each one & literally went "yummm!" by how delicious it was. The apps are on the smaller side, but they are perfect portions to share, jst enough to leave you room for your main dish. For my main meal, I ordered the Beef Stroganoff. Amazing flavors w/tender beef&mushrooms. Then for the grand finalé, we got the Mini S'mores. It's not your usual graham cracker,chocolate bar & marshmallow all squished together. Trust me this is better. Try it all! 

Overall, Sauce delivered great quality food&amazing flavor, along w/friendly services as our waitress was energetic & always smiling, which added to the experience. I will def be coming back again,& I highly recommend checking out when in Belden Alley
author: Trina N.

description: Just had amazing mushroom fries and grilled cheese with tomato soup for lunch! So good- it's a little pricey but the tomato soup was by far worth it!
author: Martie A.

description:
Vegetarian Strudel was the best veg strudel I've ever had. Perfect crispness and just enough filling. My girlfriend ordered the chicken parm and said it was very average. 

Service and ambiance was great (we dined at 11pm on a Monday). No crowds and pretty quiet. 

Would recommend going, especially for a late dinner. One negative was the prices seemed a bit higher than that should be.
author: Anish N.

description:
Went on a Sunday, not packed and not quiet.. was just nice :) Hostess and waitress were chill and friendly. We got seated immediately and we picked to sit outside under the heater. I looked at yelp and decided to order most of all the appetizers cause everyone seem to love it.

Lobster Bisque- 
Was pretty good. Has a little bit of this bitter taste to it but not bad.

Bacon wrapped mini meatloaf- 
Has mash potatoes to go with it but the wrap itself was a little salty. 

Baked Mac&Cheese- 
Cheese oozing.. pretty tasty but the shells were a little tough. 

Mini Chicken Pot Pies-
I wish they could add more sauce inside but overall, it was good! Tasty and soft in the inside.. crispy on the outside.

Portobello Mushrooms-
Love love love! Very juicy in the inside and nice golden crisp on the outside. Very flavorful! My favorite! I recommend this for all you veggie lovers out there :)

To be honest, I thought of this experience to be more like a bar. I think because we ordered only appetizers.. ops! I gave 4 stars cause my bf truly enjoyed it which made me glad cause it was our anniversary. He liked everything and the plating was beautiful! I would love to come back and try their entrees next time.
author: Sharmaine M.

description: This place just accommodated a party of 50 (that's right FIFTY) people with 90 minutes advanced notice. My friend was in town from Arizona and wanted to get dinner with me and the 49 people he had with him from a work conference. Ben (the owner) was the only person to say they could accommodate me out of all the other restaurants I called. They treated everyone so well and all 50 guests were so happy with the service, the food, and the experience. I couldn't be more pleased with Sauce for taking care of my friend and his work family. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.
author: Jessica F.

description: This is a great spot for lunch - fun setting for friends but serious enough for business.  It's modestly priced with interesting and tasty food.  The inside can be a bit noisy so ask for an outside table which benefits from heat lamps and an awning.  Service is friendly and the menu selection literally offers something for everyone.  I loved my corn and tomato salad.  My lunch companions enjoyed their burger  a lot (I'll get that next time!) and the quinoa with salmon added on the side.
author: Rachael K.

description:
I went with co-workers for lunch and the food was incredible!   It was truly a restaurant focused on comfort food.  I think almost every dish had some type of bacon in it.  We started with the bacon wrapped meatballs over mashed potatoes and ham hoc stuffed tater tots.  Both were incredibly good.  For the main dish, four out of five of us ordered the All-American burger in various ways; mine had bacon, fried egg with their aioli dressing.  The fifth person had their shrimp salad which looked great.  We also had a side of spinach and kale with truffle cheese.

I can only say the entire meal was great and I will definitely be going back to try the other items on the menu.
author: Jimmy W.

description:
Came here for company lunch and it was a splendid affair.
Highly recommend the mushroom fries, chicken pot pies, and shrimp wontons.

I had the grilled shrimp and crab louie salad which was extremely delicious and super generous in portion. 

Since we had a large party, we sat indoors and although we missed out on the nice weather, it had a nice and cosy vibe. 

Would love to come back again to try their bisque and sandwiches.
author: Christina N.

description: The food at Sauce was pretty tasty. My friend and I were in a huge rush and our waitress, who was super nice, understood and delivered quickly. I mean, obviously the chefs were back there in the kitchen whippin' up the goods really fast, so kudos to them, too. I'm giving 4 stars because of MY personal preference, I did not enjoy one of the appetizers because it was a bit more mushroom-y than I would have liked. But if you like mushrooms a lot, that dish might be your bag. I think the location is really adorable. It's in a cute little alley with a few other restaurants. I'd go here on a date. It was dim and intimate.
author: Najee C.

description: Food is definitely worth the $$, but favor wise is a little lacking. Maybe it's the new trend to not salt and pepper anything? However their roasted red potatoes are very good- crispy, salty, with the right dash of pepper. The dessert-this is only for the mini docunts are bland and dry. Cocktails, well don't even bother; worst Manhattan I've had. The waitstaff is attentive with air of bitchy, the hostess girl was super rude. Al fresco dinning is wonderful if the ground is level and the interior isn't all that inviting.
author: Sabrina D.

description:
Personally I like the location of this place. Its hidden in a paris themed alley way alongside with a bunch of cool restaurants. I had a meeting with a couple of my work peeps and they decided to come here around 11:45 on a tuesday.. my suggestion is.. if your coming here for lunch come earl because this place gets packed.  

One of my work friends ordered the deviled eggs as a sharable appetizer. Couldn't complain it tasted like deviled eggs LOL nothing really special about them except the fact that it had a bacon piece on top.  Then as my lunch option i chose the $28 lobster roll. The toll was nice and soft which I liked, I didnt care so much for the dijon mustard sauce because it was really bland.. I felt like some other sauce would have been better. The Lobster itself was delicious, can't really complain there its LOBSTER, and they give you a pretty hefty portion of the lobster as well. My lunch came with fries.. they were like any normally seasoned fries, and it also came with a side salad, it was OK, I like the pickles, didnt really like the dressing for it tho. Overall Id say 3.5, can't really say "Im a fan!". Ill probably come back here to try other options.
author: Mariethonnie M.

description: Absolutely the most delicious home made fries and Cobb salad in SF. Sauce's portobello fries are my favorite appetizer. I get cravings for them all the time, English peas and carrots with gravy. The crust was cooked to perfection - light and not too flaky. The dish came with 4 mini pot pies and I thought it was just the right amount of food for me. Their entrees are good, but nothing to write home about.
author: Aaron T.

description:
It was a nice place tucked in an alley, sat outside. I had the lobster roll with fries and it was delicious. They didn't overwhelmed the lobster with a bunch of stuff, very simple . Cooked just right . 

Can't go wrong with fries. A little bit on the pricey side , think it was around $27.
author: Nhung T.

description:
Cozy little place with tons of outdoor seating. Seems like all the restaurants on Belden Place have wizened up to expanding in the alley with a canopy and space heaters. 

We had lobster bisque, wild boar chili and some grilled salmon. All of which was excellent. Service was top notch too.
author: Vinod P.

description:
Was hungry in SF...the wife and I stopped by sauce to check it out. I tried the mixed quinoa salad (added shrimp) and she ordered the tomato bisque (comes with AWSOME grilled cheese sandwich). Everything was great!!

If you are a mushroom lover, get the mushroom fries. To die for!
author: David C.

description: Though the menu is meat-heavy, the food at Sauce is excellent. We ordered the carpaccio, mini meat loaf, shrimp salad and lobster roll, which were all delicious. Our server was friendly, and we didn't wait too long to be seated or served. The one-star knock is for the loud and crowded interior. To be fair, several waiters pointed out a large party milling around the bar, so we must've dined on an unusually busy night. That said, it was so loud we nearly had to shout. Sauce is great with friends, but if you are on a date and would like a more intimate setting, I'd recommend elsewhere.
author: Sonya C.

description: This place is delicious. Where else can you get booze and perfect NE food from a Bostonian chef. Crab roll was perfect. Don't go to chains like super duper when you can support cute little Belden Place alley eateries.
author: Tracy Y.

description:
We had a fantastic dinner, couldn't have found a cuter spot for a quite date night on the eve of Super Bowl 50, sat outside under the heaters surrounded by the wonderful alley way ambience. 

The food: 
Portabella Mushroom Fries- beyond delicious! 
Rainbow Quinoa & Kale salad- I want more! 
Texas Wild Boar Chili- spicy but so amazing

Presentation was great too! Split all three plates between myself and my manfriend and we were pretty satisfied. 

The BAD: the service- our waitress was the nastiest most horrible waitress I've ever experienced. She was so snotty from the moment we sat down, told me her bartender would "bitch at her" if I ordered a gin fizz, so I asked if I could have a glass of sparkling wine and she retorted (with rolling eyes) "uhm pick a flavor- look at your menu, I'll come back." And left.....

Given I hadn't had but about 45 seconds to look at the menu before she asked us for our order, so I get the lack of enthusiasm over my indecisiveness but she didn't have to be such a jerk.

With each time she returned to our table to check on us she was removing a plate while we we still holding food-filled-forks about to put in our mouths, that just feels so awkward. She literally pulled a dipping sauce away from my manfriend while he was dipping an avocado fry. She was forcing us out and they were still serving for another three hours (We sat at 10pm, serve until 1am)....

Now I get that some people have shitty days, especially in a weekend like Super Bowl 50 and all its ridiculousness, and I do try to give people a  benefit of the doubt and show them I'm a pretty nice and accepting patron who'll not want to trouble you so, but she was just SUCH a rude person to us. 

I wrote on her receipt "everything else was fantastic :(" next to her small tip. 

She just pretty much ruined it!
author: Erin W.

description:
Sauce is great!!

My friends and I yelped this place for dinner while walking around Union Square. It was around 8:30pm so our options were slightly limited.

FOOD:
-ham hock tater tots - these were so yummy! You get plenty of tater tots and they definitely have a different kick to them! Super creamy inside as well - almost like a mashed potato ball.
- portobello mushroom fries - yum! Not as good as the ones at Bottega Louie in LA but still very good.
- cauliflower salad - this was weird. There was some sort of olive cream sauce underneath (that we didn't know about) that kind of killed the taste for us.
- lobster roll (comes with fries and salad) - YUM! Generous chunks of lobster on a brioche roll. The fries were GREAT and the salad had this great citrus-y vinaigrette on it.
- tomato bisque - very creamy and came with grilled cheese toast sticks.

SERVICE:
Good! Never caught our server's name but he was quick and checked in on us several times. Food came out quick and hot and he was nice to recommend a beer for my friend and give her a sample as well.

VENUE:
Loved it! Located in a small street that was super cute and slightly hidden. Spacious, with an outdoor patio area as well. Bathrooms are clean.

Would definitely recommend this place to others! Very interesting things on the menu and they have a decent selection of beer on tap.
author: Yenny D.

description:
TLDR order:
- Scallops wrapped in bacon 
- Portobello mushroom fries
- Mini s'mores
and your life will be changed.

The food they have here is really good if you order the right things! I've come here twice and I'd say that the appetizers are much better than the entrees. The scallops wrapped in bacon was super juicy and just delicous and the portobello mushroom fries are just amazing when you bite into them. The mini s'mores for dessert was just mouth watering. We also got the mac and cheese. I think it was good but it got a bit much.
author: Derrick C.

description: Decent spot for more casual, sit-down lunch restaurant near the financial district/china town except you definitely need a reservation as it is popular! To start we ordered the chicken pot pies and they were tasty but weren't heated through all the way and that is my biggest pet peeve for food. They came probably 5 minutes after we ordered them so a little more heat and preparation time would be beneficial. For my meal, I ordered the salmon which was served on a bed of sliced spinach, tomatoes and bacon bits; large piece of salmon but was on the pricier side of $28.00. Another girl ordered the burger which looked amazing and another girl ordered the cob salad. My issue with this place is that their menu is mostly heavy/fried foods that for me aren't ideal for lunch and otherwise have a seemingly limited healthy selection; and the healthier items (e.g. the salmon) are on the pricier side of the menu.
author: Aryn C.

description:
We went to Sauce after a Warriors game on a Monday night so it was a little late and there wasnt alot open. Our concierge at the Ritz Carlton Club recommended it.  It's in the financial district down a little alley. We got there around 11 o'clock and there was only two other couples in there. We sat at the bar. I was thinking, great, it's late, the foods probably gonna be luke warm and mediocre. The bar tender was very friendly and funny. I ordered the deviled eggs per his recommendation and the beef carpaccio, my wife ordered the kale n spinach and mini chicken pot pies. The bar tender brought out a trio of hot sauces for the deviled eggs per my request and they were so delicious, the carpaccio could have used a little more something, say olive oil or dijon mustard, it was just a little dry but not bad at all, I'd order it again. My wife loved her kale n spinach, she said the chicken pot pies were ok then proceeded to eat all of them with ease saying they were actually very tasty. 
   The desert menu was brought out and we decided on the Strawberries w/ whip cream n  brown sugar and the PB&J. I loved the strawberries and my wife said the PB&J was the best dessert she had ever had. 
   All in all, really good service, good cocktails and really good food. We'll be back for sure and would highly recommend "Sauce"!
author: Jesse S.

description:
Kudos and rounds of applaud to the owner of Sauce! 
Let me start by saying that the restaurant has a great selection of dishes (not very veggie friendly, but...), wine ON TAP, great ambiance that plays really well with Belden Place's French Quarter atmosphere.  The prices are reasonable, the staff is friendly and helpful, and service is attentive.  The food is delicious and exactly the kind of food you would expect in a restaurant like this gem. 
We ordered:
1. Mixed Heritage Greens Salad
2. Classic Tomato Bisque with white truffled grilled cheese 
3. Hanger Steak served with arugula, dried fig, blue cheese, and toasted almond salad and crispy russet potato skins. 
Also we asked to split a glass of wine, which they gladly accommodated and brought a little carafe of wine so we can pour ourselves. 
Oh, forgot dessert - MINI SMORES are soooo good, I wish they were elephant sized smores,  not that we had any room left, but still, you know... there is always room for dessert.  

The food was really good, not the healthiest option, but totally worth all the calories.  Specifically the truffled grilled cheese was really good and went to well with tomato bisque soup - I ended up stealing it from my husband.  The steak was very moist and tender, with arugula salad being a perfect compliment.  

Now, you know how I mentioned special kudos to the owner? We had a little confrontation with another patron in the restaurant... Apparently they had a problem with some of the discussion we were having at our table, which had nothing to do with them, and why were they even listening??? The guy from the table decided to come talk to us and said a few nasty things, which got my husband boiling, who is typically a very nice and calm person... Luckily for me, I missed a lot of that and will leave in the unknowing happiness. The owner did tremendously great job resolving and smoothing the conflict, he was attentive and jumped right on the issue.  They moved us to another table, and did all they could to make sure we have a great experience.  Kudos for that and THANK YOU! 

I was very glad to discovered they have another location in the city since I loved the food and atmosphere... But might be a tough sell to come back to this place.  I hope to visit the Gough street location soon and have another pleasant experience with Sauce!
author: Marianna K.

description:
Love coming here for appetizers and drinks w friends! 
The outside dining is fun when the weather is ok otherwise inside has a fun atmosphere too. 

Favorite dishes: 
Ham hock Tator tots
Everything on the shared appetizer plate 
Mini chicken pot pies 
Mac n cheese 
Steak- tasty and comes with a nice side salad and potatoes
author: Daniela J.

description:
The 3 stars is not for the food but for the price. Overpriced!! 
 My husband and I had the grilled kobe Sirloin steak. The steak was really tasty but very tiny pieces of meat :( I had more spinach than meat.  We were kind of disappointed. When you order kobe steak, the meat should be the MAIN ingredient!
Sorry, but I don't think we are coming back again...
author: Ornella G.

description: Mediocre food. Honestly. Nothing stood out, and nothing was amazing. What I did remember was the bill which was more than it should have been given food served. Mac and cheese was okay. The tater tots were not as great as I imagined they should have been and was actually lack luster.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Aww yeeeee. Okay, let's get this out of the way first: Sauce is not really healthy food. But, it's hearty and damned delicious, so, feel free to let loose a little (or a lot, depending on how tight your pants are before you come!). 

Coming on yet another team outing several weeks back, our group of ten or so had the misfortune of being eating in the alley during one of the first major rainy days SF experienced. The overhangs, umbrellas, and heaters all certainly helped, but only so much - that said, their staff was fabulous and profusely apologetic the whole time, which was awfully nice given their lack of control over the elements!

How was the food itself though? Fabulous. We ended up getting their:

* Appetizers: mini pot pies, deviled eggs, and tater tots to share. All solid, with the first two being particularly notable. 

* Main: wild boar chili, all to myself. Quite tasty, very hearty, and packed just a little bit of a kick. 

* Desserts: I think most of us were planning to skip this, but we ended up getting their ice cream cake and warm fig cookies. The cake? Oh. My. God. To die for. The cookies? Not quite as orgasmic, but still very, very enjoyable: basically a sugar cookie with some dried figs.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - I can't speak to Sauce's interior, but the outdoor seating in the alley is all pretty accessible, though you may be find your chair parked on a left to right incline (rather than a forward to back). Not exactly the most comfortable, especially over longer meals, but technically accessible.

Bathroom - No comment because I didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description: Sauce is pretty legit when it comes to food.  The service was awesome as well.  We ordered mac n cheese, tater tots, fried chicken, and the pb&j desert!  Mac n cheese was rich and creamy just like how it should be. I had high expectation for the tater tots but it didn't give me the wow factor but it was pretty good still.  The fried chicken was delicious and oh my the pb&j!  Not your ordinary pb&j but it was quit delicious.  I find it more enjoyable if you eat one side at a time.
author: Len L.

description: I loved coming here and sitting at the bar and having a drink and eating their tater tots.  They serve everything that will make your thighs a little wider (and your smile too).  Great spot with great service and ambiance.  I'll be back!
author: Christine L.

description: As mentioned in my tip, I was served a bowl full of bacon, which I will not dare to complain about. I was definitely in my happy place. I like how they serve your beer in the representable glass associated with your order (see photo). They were also open late, which gave my friend and I a chance to munch on their appetizer sampler post a few drinks. The sampler included a bowl of bacon, deviled eggs, portobello fries, and shrimp wontons, all with a side of (what tasted like) aioli and ranch. It might be difficult to find at first because it's not located on the street, rather in the alley on Gough. I wouldn't mind coming back here to munch on late night (gourmet) food.
author: Sarin P.

description:
came here (Belden Ln location) for a weekday lunch with my sister, parents, and husband. Good location if working in FiDi, as evidenced by the crowd. Got quickly packed right between 12-1.

We were seated in close quarters outside; it was a nice day, and after asking we were very glad they turned off the heat lamps.

Amongst the 5 of us we shared the ham hock tater tots, Tomato soup with grilled cheese triangles (4), Lobster rolls (surprised that it was chunks of lobster rather than shredded lobster), Lobster bisque, Mini pot pies (4 mini quiche-sized pies with chicken, really), Kale and spinach, Deviled eggs topped with bacon (4), the burger (2 patties! quite big) + salad and cheddar chips (gourmet Doritos), and the veggie burger (fried lentil patty with avocado, quite filing). The best out of everything was the ham hock tater tots. 

Service was friendly and chipper.
author: Debora L.

description: Food was deliciousss! I love that its also hidden in a little alley, felt like I was in New York for the night.  The host graciously accomodated our party of 10 for  quick bite (our group kept getting bigger.. I know- one of those groups) and we sat outside under heat lamps. Our server was very friendly and patient; we only needed to ask her once for things.  Our side of the table ordered a round of well made moscow mules- ginger was not over powering! The lobster bisque was great, but wish it had a few more pieces of lobster. The Social Platter was a hit, but a little pricey for the portion size. We especially loved the portobello mushrooms and the deviled eggs.
author: Rachelle C.

description:
This is just a quality restaurant, but what really gave it 5 stars was the service. It was the last weekend of Burning Man, at 10PM on a Sunday... I don't have to tell you how dead it was. 

My friends and I were just looking for the nicest place possible to eat, as my boss had made the mistake of giving me the company card, and telling me to "treat myself." 

While every other restaurant was shutting up shop, Sauce welcomes us with open arms and kept the kitchen open so we could dine like kings. 

I wish I remember our waiters name! He was so knowledgeable, and so nice and so funny...  he really made our experience. But I was drinking champagine out of a cute little pink can with a straw so.... you know how that goes. 

I had the Kobe Steak and it didn't disappoint.
author: Claire O.

description:
Dear Sauce,

Why? Why do you force me to do it?

I really loved you and now you break my heart.

My friend and i went to HAPPY HOUR and ordered the sliders. The bun, lettuce and tomato were beautiful but the burger meat was AWFUL. AWFUL. AWFUL..........thin, no taste and so overcooked it almost turned into dust when I bit into it. There was some runy sauce with no taste that had no reason to be on the slider or plate. 

My friend hated the HH cocktail special and I thought it was just meh.

What saved the day was the social plates and the bowl of bacon.

Please Sauce........revamp your HH..............so that I might rekindle my love for you.
author: Yvette C.

description: Awesomeness. I love the food, the staff, the atmosphere. ...can't go wrong. Outdoor and indoor dining
author: Kathy S.

description:
We stumbled across this place when searching for restaurants for dinner. The picture of poutine (which was posted 2 years ago) hyped us up, since I mentioned to my boyfriend earlier that I was craving it. We got there, no poutine on the menu. Instead we ordered the tater tots, bowl of bacon, baked mac & cheese, and the fried chicken. This was all shared between us two. 
Let me start off saying this was the best meal I've had dining out in a LONG time.
1) Ham Hoc STUFFED Tater Tots- need I say more? Melt in your mouth good. 
2) Bowl of Bacon- I didn't want this, my bf ordered it and I took one bite and literally ate the whole bowl, so so so amazing/flavorful/I mean come on who doesn't love bacon?
3) Baked mac&cheese- with bacon bits, so delicious. 
4) Fried Chicken- absolutely amazing, the mashed and gravy were out of this world as well. 

To drink we ordered our favorite, Moscow Mules, which were made perfectly. 

For desert we had the flourless chocolate cake bites, my boyfriend and I have the biggest sweet tooths, they were a chocolate lover's paradise. 

Overall experience, we picked outdoor seating, the hostess turned on the overtop heaters for us since it was a tad bit chilly. Our waiter was exceptionally great. Not long of a wait at all. Great service. I will definitely be back again!
author: Alyssa S.

description: The Toasted Vegetarian Strudel is, seriously, one of the best things I have ever eaten. And I almost never choose vegetarian food.
author: Rich G.

description:
The food is good, but relatively simple. 
The highlight is it is a nice spot and they serve food till much much later than most places.
author: David T.

description: Great food here.  Great cocktails.  Great service.  Great great great.  There is a reason the other restaurants around Sauce look relatively empty.  It's because they can't hold a candle to Sauce.  Despite being a busy Friday night we got a great table with no wait and the service was fast and spot on.  Will be back!
author: Michael W.

description: I didn't have a burger so maybe that would have been the move, but otherwise this place was very average. My chicken parm was fine and most of the other stuff I tasted was the same ...just decent.
author: Rohan S.

description:
I do enjoy this place for dinner. It's on a quiet alley and offers yummy dishes. No reservations needed and not crowded. My friends and I came after hitting up Sutter saloon for happy hour. Of course we needed the mini pot pies, mac and cheese, bowl of bacon, and beef short rib stroganoff. I like my mac and cheese more cheesy, so this makes me happy topped with bacon. The pot pies were a let down. It seemed like mini biscuits drizzled with chicken pot pie filling. You don't get the nice crunchy top to puncture. 
We should've doubled the order for the stroganoff. It was delicious and so tender with the beef ribs infused in the sauce over their homemade pappardelle.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Yummy chicken pot pies and hamhock tater tots! Service was great, loved their outside patio. Service was quick and friendly!!!
author: Korina K.

description:
