So cute!  I love Belden Alley because of the outdoor seating in the alleyway.  Never been to Europe, but I trust when people say its a little slice of Europe's cafes with the outdoor seating.  I've been to Cafe Bastille in the alley before and Janice C. and I were looking forward to Sauce when we saw it was participating in Dine About Town.

I called the restaurant a few nights prior since they didn't list the menu online, and they were very nice about reading me everything.  She and I got one of the last outdoor seats available though it was by the door so it was more so in the shade, but still great to people watch.  

We both chose the medium rare roast beef sandwich as our entree.  The appetizers came out first which were a sampler of their popular portobello fries and their deviled eggs.  Their portobello fries had a light batter which didn't take away from the texture or the wonderful meaty taste of the mushroom.  They were so good and served with a indulgent sour cream ranch dipping sauce.  Alongside it were the deviled eggs, I did give my other half to Janice, as I don't care for deviled eggs, but I have to say that these were pretty good though not my thing.  The flavor was mild and you gotta love that crispy sweet bacon piece on top!  Next came the mid rare roast beef sammie, I was skeptical that they would have gotten the temp right, but they pretty much did!  Mine was slightly borderline medium rare/medium, but Janice's looked spot on.  The portion was huge..lots of meat and a ton of veggies!  I forgot to ask them for the horseradish on the side as I usually don't care for it.  After about 4 bites in, the horseradish became intense as I was starting to feel it in my sinuses.  They coated both the bun and the bottom of the bread with it, so I picked some of the arugula off and didn't eat all the of the bread.  Fries were seasoned fries and fine.  The nice little treat was, that even though we were so full, they included a third course which was a fresh baked cookie with chocolate sprinkles and a cherry in the middle.  I ate around the cherry, since I don't like them, but the cookie was huge and had the right amount of sweetness.  

Service was attentive as well.  I want some more of those portobello fries and want to comeback to try more of their shared plates sometime after work.  3.5 stars rounded up.
author: Cat C.

description:
Actually 3.5 stars.  Apparently there is an alley of restaurants with outdoor seating on Belden - we had no idea.  It's a pretty nice atmosphere.  We got:
- Mini chicken pot pies (4/5)
- Deviled eggs (3/5) - the bacon on top was amazing but the rest was pretty ordinary
- Brussels sprouts salad (3/5)
- Mac n'cheese (5/5) - Incredible mac n' cheese, one of the best I've ever had.  A mix of different types of cheese and ham hocks.
- Mini s'mores (3/5)
author: Simon L.

description: My entire experience was terrible. Actually got dressing splashed all over me by the staff. It was all over my clothes and table and face. The waiter just brings me a wet towel and walks away. No apology. I wrote a letter to management and they never responded. Not worth it for a soggy salad and a lunch spent cleaning myself.
author: Anthony D.

description:
I had a big team meeting and at the end of day 2 - we broke into smaller groups for dinner at different restaurants. The leader of our group picked this place. I was intrigued since I had seen it on Check Please and it was universally loved.

We ordered a few apps to split, the chicken pot pies, the Brussels sprouts salad, the deviled eggs, all solid.  

My waiter recommended the Fried Chicken parmesan with parpadelle and asparagus. quite crispy with a fresh tomato sauce.

We spilt a bunch of desserts my favorite was the peanut butter and jelly one.

It was lovely to sit out on Belden lane with the heaters running.
author: Amy W.

description: Sauce is an upscale comfort food restaurant in Belden Alley with a nice ambience that caters to both locals and tourist alike. You'd think for a restaurant begging for customers on weekend nights, they'd have better service but not at Sauce. And actually even on weeknights, they have shitty service. I just like coming to Sauce because they serve decent comfort dishes, have a full bar and offer pretty good happy hour specials so everyone in my party is usually very satisfied with their selections just as they were tonight. I will continue to come here for their Steak, Mini Meatloaves, Portobello Mushroom Fries, and Deviled Eggs. Their Mac and Cheese is boring even with 6 types of cheeses but you have to get it since it's the ultimate definition of a comfort dish. It goes well with the yummy Mini Meatloaves served with Mashed Potatoes but it lacks flavor and breadcrumbs though it tastes better with some black pepper and Tabasco sauce. The Steak is prepared well and comes sliced up, drizzled with a sauce with a side Arugula Salad and Steak Fries served with baked potato fixin's. They have some good cocktails and a number of plain ol' Bourbons to wet your pallet while you wait for your Appetizers. You have to get at least one Appetizer or what they refer to as Social Plates to share. They have many great options but like I said their service sucks. They aren't very social for serving up Social Plates. The servers are not attentive and you don't get service with much of a smile. When we left tonight, we each said "Thank you" and our server ignored us while clearing our table so tipping well doesn't help. Seriously my husband often over tips and I hate when he does for shitty service.
author: Jen L.

description: I took my team here for a welcome lunch and it was great. It was a raining day, but they were able to accommodate us inside. The waiter was friendly and made us feel welcome. The macaroni and cheese was definitely one of the better ones I've ordered with just the right amount of crunchiness to it and the right amount of cheese.
author: Thomas C.

description:
I was quite satisfied with Sauce. The appetizer, main course, and dessert were all quite tasty. 

I almost gave it a 5 but the smores dessert wasn't quite my cup of tea. 

The location is a bit nondescript and I like that. I would definitely recommend this spot.
author: Lucky B.

description:
I've had the original Sauce bookmarked for a lifetime and thanks to the half-off ScoutMob deal, my girlfriends and I decided to finally give it a shot. Located in a cute little alley of restaurants that seems to be foreign of San Francisco, Sauce to me is just another mediocre contemporary American restaurant. Our party opted to sit in the heated out door seating for hopes to people watch and I have to say, this is the single impressive aspect of the place. 

We ordered everything that everyone recommended on Yelp.

- Mini pot pies -  served lukewarm with borderline cold gravy. Cute but unimpressed. 
- Mac and cheese - ok I lied, besides the out door seating area, I also enjoyed the mac and cheese quite a bit
- Lobster rolls (x3) - our waiter had to do a double take when the three of us ordered three lobster rolls plus all of the above. We may look like little Asian girls but we can grub. While I can't really complain about the lobster roll, I didn't like it more than Woodhouse. Sure there were chunky pieces of lobster but it wasn't as tasty as I would like a $24 lobster roll to be. 
- Raisin oatmeal bon bon
- Mini donuts

I won't go into details about the desserts as there is not much to say. I liked the mini donuts more than the bon bons but probably won't be back for either. 

To say that I was disappointed by Sauce is an understatement but I'm glad at least we were able to use the ScoutMob deal!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
Date & Time:  Tuesday April 3, 2012 @ 1:30pm
Location:  Former Trademark
Dining Companions:  Mommy & Husband
Scene:  FiDi Guys in Open-Collar Shirts & Girls in Black & White Print Minidresses w/ Boots
Music:  Jimmy Hendrix
Decor:  Fun & Contemporary.  Sleek Bar, Cocktail Tables in Rich Woods & Leather + Tightly-Packed Banquettes & Dining Al Fresco on Belden Place
Service:  Fetching Young Ladies
Imbibe:  Full Bar
Devour:  Mini Pot Pies, Mac n' Cheese, Lobster Rolls & Mini Donuts w/ Vanilla Bourbon Sauce
Total:  $84. 23
author: Genevieve Y.

description: Loud because the tech kooks working downtown are drinking and want to hear themselves talk. Service was good.  Food was really good and served very hot.  Chowder with clam and ham hock, tater tots filled with ham hock and braised short rib stroganoff with extravagant mushroom selection, egg noodles, asparagus and a puréed mushroom sauce.  Great take on a classic. My dad is vegan and GF.  He had grilled asparagus, tomato bisque and quinoa salad w chard.  Open til 2am.
author: James M.

description: Stopped by here for dinner.  The food was delicious!  We had the bacon wrapped meatballs, bacon wrapped scallops (we love bacon), and the lobster bisque.  The service was fast and friendly- Derrick was a terrific!  Later that night we even came back to chill at the bar and meet more friends for drinks.  Perfect atmosphere for drinking.  Will definitely dine here again soon!
author: Kathleen S.

description: Had the SF Restaurant Week meal of pork appetizer and Kobe beef entree. Life changing. Manhattans were great too, especially the Manhattan Whistle (with 10 year Whistle Pig).
author: Jared O.

description: This place is amazing!!!! I am a celiac and my parent's are visiting me from SC and they always want to go out to eat a lot. In search of a new place I could eat at and make my parents both happy at I found this place. The food is amazing the staff is great and the restaurant is so neat with cool outdoor and indoor seating. This place is a must try! This will be a new regular place for me.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Stopped in for drinks but, unfortunately, it was a little too cold to stay for a meal, so my fiancé and I had a few rounds then left.  As such, Sauce was just A-OK... Though I will say the service was friendly & quite attentive, and there were many other people dining there at the time.
author: Michelle R.

description:
The fried chicken was bland - no crunch, no salt, no taste.
The shrimp cocktail salad - the shrimp was grilled and was okay, but the iceberg lettuce "salad" was mixed in with too much cocktail salad and was basically inedible.
The mac and cheese was also just okay...the pasta noodles were a bit too al dente so it was kind of hard to chew.
author: Annie K.

description:
Went to Sauce for the first time last night at 10:30pm - recommended to me by my concierge at Omni SF, as they open until 2pm.

Initially, I thought it would just be a food spot, hole in the wall that served whatever. I was wrong. This place was not only a hidden gem that serves an exotic list of spirits, the food was the SHIZZNITTLESHIPSNIPSNAP!

Everything on the menu looked bomb, from the Maine Lobster Roll, to the LambChops, and beef filet. 

I went with the Fried Chicken, corn, and mashed potatoes. Destroyed the plate in less than 10 minutes! Id eat the same thing a week in a row. 

For those in the area, EAT HERE! DRINK HERE! 

Service is on 100 and the food is amazing.

Cheers to the chef!
author: Duy P.

description:
Sauce is awesome!

+ : great cocktails, very nice and efficient staff, big space so you can go as a group (girls night!) and not wait the usual hour, social plates are tasty and easy to share.

My favorites:
- Beef Tenderloin Carpaccio 
- Portobello Mushroom Fries
- Tomato Bisque with truffle cheese sticks

Only downside is it's a bit pricey for the quantities you get and if you're really hungry, you will pay for it...
author: Laura G.

description:
Awesome place to catch up with a friend! Cute little secret with great service.
Ordered:

-sample platter (holy crap! it was seriously dope. each item was delicious!)
-mac 'n cheese (loved the right amount of cheese and ham, but missing some salt)
-mini chicken pot pies (the chicken was perrrrrfect)

Definitely taking more people here!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
This would be a run of the mill 3 star place except for the fact the food disagreed with me the next day. 

I came with a friend for dinner. The lobster bisque had the flavor of "burnt" but no real flavor beyond that. The garlic bread had the texture of soft but no real unique or outstanding flavor (beyond a hint of burnt cheese).

Now mind you, my friend enjoyed her shrimp salad and I think had a better experience than me.

Some other upsides - the place is open quite late, especially for a restaurant/bar in fi-di and has a decent beer selection.
author: Art W.

description: Sampler platter is awesome especially portobello fries- best to order a separate order of those. Stroganoff is seriously selfish. Great service
author: Dana N.

description:
Yummmmmmmmmmm I came here with my coworkers and we got three appetizers: deviled eggs, chicken pot pie, and tater tots. All three were really good. For my entree, I got the lobster roll ($27 o_o). It was pretty good. The bread was soft, sauce was great, and lobster was good... but not worth $27... I prefer the lobster roll at woodhouse (sorry!!!)... but the service here was great!!! We were sitting outside while it was raining, and because some of us got slightly rained on, they gave us dessert on the house (some pb&j dessert that was good)!! Whooooooo.
I like the alley this place is located in--especially the lights hanging above.
author: Annie S.

description:
This restaurant is located in a small alley on Belden Pl. It's not too hard to find but it can be sometimes hard to get to especially since you have to pass a few restaurants in a narrow crowded alley to get there. 

Ambiance: Super cute- almost has a European feel with the strung light bulbs out on the patio and the tight seating
. 
Drinks: Moscow mules here are amazing. They're served in awesome cooper mugs with a fresh slice of lime. Just the right punch of lime takes this drink out of this world (it goes down easy!) 

Food: We ordered the Portobello Mushroom Fries, the Mac & Cheese, the Vegetarian Strudel and the Salmon entrée. My favorite had to be the PM fries- they were perfectly crispy on the outside and super tender on the inside and it has a cool ranch dipping sauce. So yummy! I also enjoy the Vegetarian Strudel. Because I was sharing with my 2 girl friends it went fast! It has sautéed vegetables wrapped in phyllo dough over a creamy tomato sauce. I found myself scraping the bottom of the dish for the remainder of the sauce after the strudel was gone. 

For desert we got the s'mores bites. This desert I thought was okay- honestly, it was bit on the sweet side for me, but that is my own personal preference, but it was a solid dish. 
The service was alright. It was very busy (even on a Tuesday night) and he took a while to deliver waters and the dessert took a little while to come out as well, but overall not a bad experience. 

I would for sure recommend this place for happy hour because of their yummy drinks and great selection of small bites.
author: Sam L.

description:
I came here yesterday with someone around 11:00 PM, at first it was pretty hard to find because it was in an alley way on what looked like an empty street. In about the middle of the block you'll see the alley way, but once you walk down it you'll find the restaurant. The ambiance of the place was nice and for a Saturday night it wasn't as loud as I thought it might be. The waitress was very attentive, was very good about any questions and was pretty informative about our selections.

Since it was pretty late we ordered from the social portion of the menu:

First we ordered The Portobello Mushroom Fries those were very tasty, which is the first thing that the person I was with said when she tried them. I wish they'd give you a bit more though, seeing as to how it was $11 Dollars for the equivalent of One large mushroom cut into strips. Nonetheless, it was very tasteful with a light crispy crust as I imagined it would be.

Second we ordered the Bacon Wrapped Meatloaf with Mashed potatoes and Gravey. We were initially concerned that it might be too dry, but when we asked the waitress about it she assured us that it would come out juicy and tender. Thankfully her suggestion was spot on. The dish, came out in about 4 bites, good for a tasting and the bacon complimented the meatloaf well as I think all bacon should.

Finally we ordered the Mac and Cheese, Not exactly the best I've ever had, but definitely not the worst. They added what seemed to be bits of pork in the Mac and Cheese, which helped add flavor. If I had the option I would have ordered another of the Portobello fries instead of this. The cheese was fairly mild and the pasta was on the soft side (maybe it was just my dish specifically) and the dish wasn't as tasty as somewhere like Homeroom in Oakland.

We also ordered 2 drinks (a cocktail and a cider) I didn't get to try the cocktail, but my cider (Crispen Hard Cider) was a bit too mild and seemed to be somewhat on the flatter side to me. Maybe next time I should just stick with the IPAs. Our total came out to be around 60 dollars for the meal. This is probably one of the better late night establishments I've been to in the city. If I am ever back here it will most likely be for the Portobello Mushroom Fries.
author: Bobby L.

description:
Too Saucy or Not Saucy Enough

4 starving girls go to Sauce for dinner..one of them takes out a cliff bar after her meal..


We were all very hungry after a day of sightseeing and wanted to grab a bite to eat before heading out for drinks in the city. Even though we were all very hungry we did not want to eat too much, so we decided to go for appetizers and salads. SF is known for being pricier than other cities and looking at the appetizer prices we knew a chunk of our wallet was going to be left at Sauce. However, we didn't mind paying for quality comfort food.

My friend and I both got the grilled shrimp salad and shared mushroom fries. The other two ordered the mini chicken pot pies and tater tots. We were very excited for our food and we weren't disappointed with the taste, rather the portion size. Our salad was more like 2 ounces of shredded lettuces with 3 pieces of shrimp. We ended up joking about the whole thing, especially when my friend pulled out a cliff bar from her bag and started eating it at the restaurant. I hope they understood we were still hungry.
author: Gladys L.

description:
Located in a small alley within the FiDi of San Francisco the ambiance is perfect for a lunch date or dinner with friends.

Back to the review... 3 friends and I stumble in on a Friday night of bar hopping looking for late night drunchies. With 30 minutes until closing the chef comes out and lets us know that he would not be able to make some of entrees due to what ingredients were available in the kitchen. He was still able to offer a selection that could possibly prevent a hangover the next day. Thanks for accommodating chef!

Food:
With the limited menu selection we were able to decide on Ham Hock Tater Tots, Mac N Cheese, and the Golden Gate Burger.

Tater Tots: Flavorful kick with a creamy inside.
Mac N Cheese: Rich flavor and texture with the mix of cheeses, bacon, and bread crumbs
GG Burger: Basic bacon cheese burger with a very tasty side salad and fries.

Overall great late night food. I will definitely try and come back at a more reasonable time of day!
author: Kevin O.

description:
Service. Outstanding. Ambiance. Warm and welcoming. Food? Uh, wow. Off-the-hook-creative-paleo-fusion genius.
Get the bacon-wrapped meatloaf, mini (topless) chicken pot pies and stuffed tater tots. Jowl of bacon doesn't hurt.
author: Trent M.

description: This was strange... The food was great however. I found on yelp, searching for "Organic". The pics of the food, and menu made me think this was a nice sit down place. When I found it in the alley, and went in i thought I must be at the wrong place. The girl at the door was obviously not happy to be there, but past her everyone was nice and kind. The place was pretty empty. The atmosphere is much more of a bar/tavern than a restaurant. However, the food was excellent! Well presented and good.
author: Koti D.

description:
Came here for dinner with a group of friends. Tried the mushroom fries which were pretty good. I ordered one of the only vegetarian options on the menu - the vegetarian strudel which absolutely was delicious. It's all a bit on the pricey side though.

The service is ok. Food came out at a reasonable pace, but our waitress wasn't very friendly and forgot to bring a couple of us waters we requested.
author: Umeet S.

description:
I have visited Sauce several times - it's a nice, but not life-changing spot. Situated in an alley downtown, it's easy to miss. The menu offers an array of pricey small plates, cocktails, and a few soups and entrees. The portions are small and the prices are a little disproportionate.

Noise level is low and the atmosphere is pleasant. Good date spot.
author: Irina P.

description: Delicious. Had the bacon wrapped meatloaf and bacon and eggs.... Omg.... So good. Took truffles and strawberries home for dessert and couldn't have been more happy! Yelp hasn't failed us yet.
author: Ashley D.

description:
I don't think I've ever been to a restaurant where I would, and almost, ordered everything off the menu. Their social plates are small because they're for sharing, but are super creative, wholesome, and so good. 

I've been to the Sauce on Gough, but ate at this location for convenience last week to meet family from the East Bay and came from work in Marin, plus Beldan Place is the cutest, so why not try their new location. 

Fun fact, you can order a bowl of bacon, so do with that what you will. There were four of us we had: the ham hock tater tots, mini bacon-wrapped meatloaves, mini chicken pot pies (mini means you can order many different things from the menu and not feel badly it), macaroni and cheese, side of spinach/kale and two entrees-fried chicken and short rib stroganoff.  Everything was absolutely divine, though the tots were not as yum as I was expecting. 

We also almost ordered the dessert sampler (yes there's a dessert sampler, yes we almost ate it), but stuck with the Guinness shake and mini (this time, I wish they weren't so mini) s'mores. The s'mores came with two and are the best thing I've eaten in recent memory. 

It's been four days so I think it's time for another visit to try the other half of the menu.
author: Erica S.

description: Well I must admit, my first time here and I really enjoyed my glass of Cab for happy hour.  Full fruit forward, full bodied and very tasty.  My friend and I shared the mac-n-cheese and the fried portobello mushrooms.  It was all so delish.
author: Liz D.

description:
It is always a dilemma to decide on a restaurant for our date-nights in the city with the plethora tasty options on every block...But with a quick google search, and the help of trusty Yelp, the bf and I decided to take our chances on trying out Sauce. And boy, did we luck out! 

First off, Belden Place is charming nook and cranny of SF with dangling alley lights, and open patio seating of various restaurants that makes it so inviting. The space is small, so our hostess had to cram us in between two parties, so having a one-on-one conversation can sometimes turn out to be a screaming match! Our server was absolutely fantastic! She was gracious, warm, and a great sport. We came in time for happy hour and it was a great deal. A cocktail of the week (I got the refreshing gin fizz) and a plate of two sliders + chips was only $11! We started that off as our appetizer.

With our bellies aching for more, we opted for the clam chowder which was hearty and rich with seafood. Since I was eyeing the the entrees of the table next to me, we decided to order the short rib stroganoff with a side of their cheesy, flakey, pull-apart garlic bread. Best garlic bread I've ever had...and I'm a tough critic! Their stroganoff is fit to share for two and the beef was tender and flavorful. 

My final verdict? Fantastic place to meet with friends, co-workers, and overall socializing. A little loud, crammed for a romantic one-on-one date, but the food, drinks, service, and ambiance makes it worth it!
author: Kimly N.

description: After spending over $50 per person (6 of us), I was disappointed they didn't do anything for my friend's 30th birthday. My friend said he didn't want dessert (he didn't know I told the waiter about his birthday) but you would think the staff would bring out something just as courtesy. We spent enough Money and 30 is a special birthday. Food was decent but it's my pet peave when things like this happen, it sticks with you and there is less motivation to write a great review.
author: Mel D.

description: This is the best restaurant ever. The food is on point we just walked in and asked for a seat outside and they turned on the heaters and when we said we were still cold they got us blankets. They gave me a hamburger even though it wasn't on the menu as that's what I was craving.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
I ordered the steak, which came with an arugula salad and a side of french fries. The fries were a little salty for my taste but the steak was great. All of the food and drinks were brought out quickly and in a timely manner and everything was delicious! 

The food itself is four stars but the fifth star is for the amazing service at Sauce. 

We came here on a Saturday night with reservation for a huge birthday group. I had called ahead and asked if the restaurant had a "cake cutting fee" and they said they did not and would be happy to store the cake. The staff offered to cut and plate the cake AND added a side of whipped cream for everyone. 
EDIT: I called and they said there wasn't a fee but I guess there was miscommunication with who I spoke to and it was a $2.25 per person.
I know many places do this as well, but I was so incredibly blown away by the amazing service provided by every single waiter/waitress at this restaurant - very funny, kind and professional. In addition, they didn't add an 18+% gratuity to the tip for a party of 16 (not sure if this was an accident or on purpose) but I was pleasantly surprised.
author: Christy T.

description: Came with a party of 10.  I started off with a mojito as I love mojito.  Was very disappointed.  Generally it's rum based, I assumed they used tequila as I see a brownish color as mojito is supposed to be clear.  We ordered a variety of appetizers I was hoping to love their mushroom fries but their batter was to hard and thick.  Appetizers were just ok, nothing outstanding. Entree I ordered the crab roll.  The crab was dry, the bread did not have a nice soft fluffy crisp to it. It felt dense and semi stale. The tortilla chips it came with was extremely salty just like what other people's comments. The pickled salad was interesting in a good way.  Dessert was decent. Had the mini cinnamon sugar doughnuts and pb & j.
author: Aria R.

description:
I was staying at the Omni and after a busy day (and an Epsom salt bath with a glass of champagne), didn't make it out of my room until almost 10 PM. I called ahead on a Sunday night to make sure their kitchen was still open. They close at 1.

I found it because I'd read the reviews that it was in an alleyway. One look over the menu and I was really happy. I was traveling by myself but choose to try the shared plates instead of an entree. The bacon wrapped scallops hit the spot and the mini meatloaf plate was just right. The Ginger Cosmo is a refreshing take on one of my favorite cocktails. And the snores dessert was phenomenal and just the right size. 

My waitress was super sweet and had some great opinions on the menu. The prices were great, after dropping about $75 for dinner at Waterbar last night. Couldn't be happier with my experience and will definitely be back here the next time I'm in the city.
author: Lauren J.

description: Stopped during happy hour after work and had chicken pot pie and Pinot Grigio! Delish!
author: Ann G.

description:
A fun place to unwind and catch-up with friends after work. Their Social Plates are great - I'd recommend the Bacon Wrapped Mini Meatloaf and Portabello Mushroom Fries. Yum.

I'm a sucker for Moscow Mules that come in copper cups.
author: Linda X.

description:
If you want a nice bar, nice service, nice ambience, very clean and not crummy in crummy neighborhoods like bars in the Mission or SoMa or wherever people usually go, come here. 

This does not feel like a San Francisco bar. I've taken multiple people here and they were surprised this kind of place exists.

Decent selection of beers, solid cocktails, wine not so much. 

Food favorites:
Fried protobello mushrooms (top choice, must try)
Crab rangoon (with real crab)
Deviled eggs
A Bowl of Bacon (what? right? but it's good)
author: Nop J.

description: Everything was exceptionally delicious. From the French fries to the bacon wrapped oysters to the all-natural burger. Food was top notch! Highly recommended.
author: Josh R.

description:
Ham Hock Tater Tots? Why and how are you a thing?  I would go back 11/10 times just to eat those bad boys. 

Moving on to "more important" things. I had the Beef Stroganoff which was a decent price and I practically licked my plate clean, granted I hadn't had lunch, but still. You get the point.  They offer a variety of salads that can be upgraded to have shrimp or salmon among other things. 

Ambiance was good, got a bit chilly because the windows and doors were open, but on a nice night they have plenty of patio seating if that is your thing. 

Tips: 
-Make sure you and your friends are showing up to the SAME location, they have another one on Gough 
-Try the Moscow Mule, they make it a bit different, which is actually the original way MMs were meant to be made - with the authentic brand of Ginger Beer. 
-get the Ham Hock Tots. Even if you don't need them, just do it. For me.
author: Katie K.

description:
12/7/13  Dinner

Second time around is much better than the previous experience. First weekend of December Union Square had been packed to the gun wales. We came here for dinner after shopping. Another good thing is easy parking at Sutter Garage. We were promptly seated for the 7pm reservation, but the restaurant seemed to be understaffed that evening. Two wait-staff and one bartender. Drinks took a while.

*Moscow Mule ($9): cocktail made with vodka, ginger beer, and lime served in a copper cup. Tasted like a gingery martini with lime.

*Braised Beef Short Rib Wellington ($25): transported me back to my childhood in British Hong Kong. In a puffy pastry enevlop are braised beef and portobello. It was not as heavy as I had anticipated. The beef managed to stay inside the puff pastry. Wine reduction is tasty. Creamy kale was a bit heavy.

*Maine Lobster Roll ($27): very fresh lobster on an New England bun with fries aplenty. We both thought the price is a bit steeped for this dish despite the great taste. 

Overall he food is fairly decent. It's comfort food and some items on the menu are very heavy. Sauce is strong in the soup department. On cold nights you might want to consider their diverse soup menus including clam chowder, lobster bisque, and boar chili. We were tempted by our neighbor's dessert:

*Bite-size Donut Balls ($9): with blueberries and vanilla bean dip. Crunchy and warm. Heavenly! This is what makes the review a 4 Star!

Sauce is not a bad choice if you're in the Union Square. Hearty comfort food with a slight twist.
author: Matt Y.

description: Omg! This place is amazing and the food is delicious. You must stop by if you're in SF. The service was great. We got seated right away and our food came shortly after we ordered. They were on top of it. And to top it off they have really cool purse hangers on each table. Love it here.
author: Cecylia P.

description: This is by far one of my favorite restaurants. The service is always great. They change their menu often so it's fun to go back and check out the new stuff!
author: Samira A.

description:
The whole alleyway (filled with cute restaurants with outdoor seating) reminds me of a European city. It's really cute. Also, there are HUGE heat lamps to ward off the San Francisco chill. 

I honestly might have given this a 5 star review but it ended up being pricey ($110) and it took a while before our server showed up (but once he did, he was very prompt and excellent).

What to get:
* Vegetarian strudel: DELICIOUS. Asked the server if he would recommend the pot pies or the strudel and he said definitely the strudel. Very glad we ended up with this option. The dark mushroom (pate-consistency?) thing inside was really nice - it ended up tasting a bit meaty. And I ended up spooning up all the spicy tomato sauce that surrounded it. Kinda similar to a very fancy calzone.
* Mushroom fries: A nice (relatively small) stack of delicious fried mushrooms with a creamy dipping sauce. Came out really fast, which I appreciated because I was famished.
* Croissant donut dessert: Tasted as good as it sounds. Delivered.

Other stuff of note:
* Sauteed spinach and kale: Didn't expect anything brilliant and didn't get anything brilliant. Got it because I figured we should get a "healthy" option.
* 209-groni: Strong, bitter, and excellent. I'm turning into a negroni person. That being said, I wish it was served straight rather than on small ice. The ice melting and diluting the drink really bothers me and forces me to drink faster than I would like. They probably do it to make it look more voluminous than it really is (but it was still a pretty small glass)
* Bourbon -... smash? Husband got this. Sweet and sour. Also on small ice. :(.
author: Sylvia L.

description:
Well, can't win them all. In San Fran for business and have had a great experience with so many wonderful restaurants but this was not one of them.
Where should I start? How about with bartender that literally did not say two words to us except to get our order.  We ordered a couple of beers and one was flat. The deviled egg plate was actually very good, however the rest of our food was way below par and bordered on bad.
The worst was the shrimp salad. Over done shrimp, some strange cocktail sauce dressing that wasn't even mentioned on the menu and loaded with soggy, wilted lettuce. We couldn't even eat it. 
So there you go. In a city with so many great restaurants, don't bother with this one.
author: B S.

description:
This review is only about the appetizers and desserts.

I first heard about this place through Dine About Town, but didn't get a chance to go during DAT. I decided to come here for dinner for Friday date night with my boyfriend. The staff is very welcoming and friendly. We had outdoor seating, surprisingly it wasn't even cold outside. Anyway, on to the food review. 

Bacon Wrapped Mini Meatloaf: this was the main reason why I wanted to come here. It was pretty good, but definitely could've tasted better. The meatloaf wasn't salty enough for me. The mash potatoes it came with was deliciously though! 

Mini Chicken Pot Pie: I was most disappointed in this. The shell of the pot pie was too hard and the inside was kind of bland. I would not recommend getting this. If it wasn't for the smallness of it, I wouldn't have ordered it. (I love mini things, btw) 

Bacon & Eggs: The bacon on this was delicious! The deviled egg itself was like any other devil egg. Definitely better than other places I've tried. 

PB&J: This was the best part of the meal! It tasted just like a PB&J but with ice cream! So yummy!

Cinnamon Sugar Cronuts: I wasn't a fan of this. I'm not sure what cronuts are supposed to tastes like, but these tasted undercooked, like the dough inside was still raw. 

Overall, it was a good experience.
author: Lina C.

description: Came here with my man for a happy hour/early dinner experience. I made a 5:30pm reservation but my bf came earlier and he got seated right away. (We also got the heated seats near the door so it was perfect! SF can be chilly at night so we had the shade and the heater too) We started with several items on the menu: They were out of the pork sliders so we opted for the Kobe Beef. It was alright - nothing too special about it. We had the bowl of fried chicken - this was served in a small basket and no bones so it was easier to eat. The crispiness was perfect and also wasn't too salty. We ordered the bruschetta - served on a soft bread which I liked. When you bite into it, it's less messy. We got the short rib sandwich - lots of cream but I enjoyed it. Cocktails were yum too! Though I forgot what we had. Oops! We also had dessert - their Panna Cotta. This was delicious. Not as good as Lupa's but very good. This is a great spot for people who want to have some nice cocktails and fast service especially after work. The Manager also is very funny - he talks to everyone and ensures that everyone is having a good time. One thing though - be careful with ordering from the happy hour menu. We got apps and the total was $130 for the 2 of us. (Not dinner) Overall, I enjoyed my experience. ;)
author: Anna Y.

description:
Came here for drinks after work. 

I loved the outdoor seating. We sat right below the heater so it wasn't cold at all and actually quite comfortable and refreshing.

They have happy hour specials every day for  $7.50, and decent beer and wine specials for $4.50 and $6.50.

I highly recommend the portobello mushroom fries!! They are delicious!!

Our server Nicole was also very friendly and responsive.

I'd definitely come back here again!
author: Ena Y.

description: Food tasted great - we had the portobello mushroom fries ($10.99). We also ordered the sea food chowder ($12.99) and lobster bisque ($14.99). The fries came 15 mins after ordering but the chowder and bisque took ages... We waited about 40 mins... For soup that I assume comes from a pot :( we ordered before 1030pm, there's not a crowd here, I'm not sure why it took so long. I think the waitress forgot to put our order in, or the kitchen forgot, either way the waitress forgot about us. We still tipped 15% (what's this 4% to cover wages thing?) Hence the 3 star rating, the food was great but it is disappointing to wait so long for SOUP at 11pm when it's not busy! Not going back.
author: May L.

description:
Literally fell onto this place by accident.

Perfectly romantic and lovely for date night. My fiance and I were actually out and about starting in with our Christmas shopping in Union Square last night. I've been having a serious craving for ramen but have yet to find the right spot for it. So of course we ask Google for a ramen restaurant nearby and somehow we end up walking into the financial and through the little ally way that Sauce is on, along with so many other cute little restaurants. We fell in love with the atmosphere of the place. After checking out the ramen spot around the corner, we preferred to eat outside under the lights on a perfect evening. Plus we love tapas. 
Lobster roll was delish. Mac n cheese, bacon wrapped scallops and the mini meatloaf were soooooo great!
author: Sofia F.

description: The New York steak dish that I ordered here was very well put together :) The combination of steak, fig salad, & potato wedges was perfect. The steak was yummy, the fig salad had a reallyy delicious taste, and the potato wedges was good & it came with an awesome dipping sauce of sour cream, bacon bits, cheese, green onions so that you can make yourself a deconstructed baked potato :D The mushroom fries & sauce is also really good! The restaurant is also very cute & the staff is nice, but the food takes a while to make the food & for them to tend to you to get your order.
author: Alice H.

description: Horrible food and service. I downloaded yelp to write just this review. I couldn't eat my meal (shrimp caesar salad) due to the fact that the dressing and lettuce tasted awful. The waiter didn't check on us the entire time, or ask if we wanted anything more to drink. The restaurant was not crowded and had maybe 10 people dining there at the time. The waiter also didn't ask why all my food was still on my plate when he cleared it. Please think twice before eating here. It was distasteful. I would give it 0 stars if I could.
author: Molly M.

description:
great cocktail selection. specifically their Mules. Moscow, Mexican, etc.

mini smores dessert was delicious only i wished it was bigger. fancy little graham cracker cup filled with ghiradelli chocolate sauce and a dollop of home made marshmallow fluff. mmm. 

brown sugar bacon appetizer was good. how can it not be?

chicken parmesan was just alright.

points for being located in one of the cutest restaurant alley ways in the city.
author: Renalen C.

description: The service was awesome and very accommodating. My manhattan we perfect and mad to order. The bowl of bacon was exactly what you'd expect. The real stand out was dinner.y steak was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The greens were some of the best I've had and a great foil to the meat. And the potatoes were insane. My only complaint was it was a bar and had that bar smell. But everything else made it worth it. I'll be back.
author: Tom S.

description: They have more than one location, and this is the second location I have been to. I went here for a belated birthday dinner for me. We ordered their mac & cheese, mini pot pies, and a brussels sprout salad. I was pretty pleased with everything, especially our service. Our waitress was super friendly and always had a smile on her face! I liked that the brussels sprout salad had nuts and seeds to go with it, and they were cooked well so it didn't have the bitter taste. The mac & cheese wasn't bland, had lots of flavor and tasted better than most mac & cheese I have had so far - especially since I am not normally into mac & cheese. The mini pot pies were also very flavorful and cooked well! I liked every part of our mini meal and ended up paying $35 for two people - not bad for quality food and service. Will definitely order those again when I return :)
author: Amanda C.

description: Amazing ambiance!!!! Steak was great and service was friendly. Mushroom fries are soooooooo good. You won't regret it.
author: Sheena P.

description: Came here for my birthday dinner and all 12 of us loved it! The apps were great...good for sharing- bowl of bacon & mini pot pies were delicious! The steak and the sauce it came with was amazing. House Burger was great and all cocktails were perfect! Thank you guys for making my birthday so special! Will be back soon late night!
author: Sfgal S.

description:
Came for our 2 year anniversary. We sat out in the patio with heaters on which was nice. Let me just say, if ur looking for just snacks and drinks then this place is well worth it. Nothing more. Portobello fries, sauteed spinach and kale and their tomato bisque was amazing! We also had their Kobe steak and their baked lobster for our main course and we were disappointed......so flavorless. 

This place accepts OpenTable pay and it's very convenient!
author: Ella A.

description:
My experience can largely be summed up by "meh." 

This location has a very cute ambiance, tucked into a little alley with lots of restaurant choices nearby; next time I will try the same location but a different restaurant. 

The service was pretty good. It was a slow night and our waiter was attentive. He did try to take my plate before I was finished, but my lady friend was finished so it was understandable. Waiter also spilled a bit of red wine while pouring into my glass and told me I'd "distracted him" as I had asked for a glass of water while he was pouring. Maybe he was joking? I'm giving him the benefit of the doubt and assuming he was joking. 

Cocktails were delicious with an interesting variety. I opted for the wine on tap. There weren't a lot of choices for wine and I wasn't very pleased with mine, especially at $12 / glass. Should have gone with a cocktail. 

We order the cheese plate, I got the kobe steak dish, and my friend got the (only) vegetarian option, a veggie pastry in tomato sauce. She enjoyed her choice. I found the cheese selection to be fine, but with very small slivers of cheese (probably 1 ounce each, 3 cheeses) which was a bit underwhelming at $15 / plate. The waiter who brought out our cheese plate also didn't remember one of the three options and I had to ask him to go find out. My steak dish was okay. The sauce was delicious, but the potatoes were dry and flavorless and the steak was very tough (i had ordered it rare, too). We skipped dessert and went around the corner to Rickshaw for a delicious round of post dinner drinks instead - the right decision. 

With the total check coming in at just under $100, not including tip, I expected more for the cost of the dinner. Maybe this location is really best for happy hour; I would not recommend it as a dinner choice.
author: Beckie M.

description:
My girlfriends and I went here for a night out on the town. We pulled up and wasn't too sure about it since it's on a small side street but once you walk in the location is adorable! (loved the hanging lights) 

We ordered just about every appetizer on the menu and they we're all delicious. Must try: Garlic Bread, Tater tots, bacon wrapped meatloaf , scallops and lobster bisque! 

Will come back again next time in the city!
author: Michelle G.

description:
Sauce is located on a street that will tickle any girls fancy. Located on Belden, Sauce is one of many restaurants lighting up this little alleyway. Tons of fairy lights, color and outdoor seating. Each restaurant plays their part in adding into the whole experience. With a whimsical feel, I'm sure any joint on this street would make a great date spot. 

My gf and I decided to have a double date this past Friday, the night before Valentine's, with her friend and bf. Unfortunately it was pretty last minute. With only a few days before we were set to meetup, our options were pretty limited. I called a dozen other restaurants and they were all booked. No joke, Sauce was probably like my 15th choice. So I took an 8pm reservation for Friday, the 13th... eek!

SAMPLER SOCIAL PLATE ~ 3 stars: This plate was topped with 4 deviled eggs, portobello mushroom fries, mini chicken pot pies and a bowl of bacon. The deviled eggs were creamy, light and delicious. The mushroom fries and mini pot pies were just ok. But the star of the show was the bowl of bacon. Man! Seasoned with black pepper and brown sugar, these things were a blast! They weren't crispy but instead slow cooked to a very tender texture. Excellent to much on and heavenly to eat. If I would have known, I would have just ordered a few of these as our starter. 

FRIED ORGANIC ROSIE's CHICKEN ~ 4 stars: The chicken was crispy and prepped beautifully. I didn't have to work too hard to get a big bite of meat each time. The whipped yukon potatoes were excellent. The gravy brought everything together while the sauteed kale added a bit of greens. An excellent dish. The only thing it was missing, in my opinion, was a little acidity. I probably should have requested a lemon wedge but it really wasn't a deal breaker. Great dish and I would order it again. 

BRAISED BEEF SHORT RIBS STROGANOFF ~ 4 stars: Tender bites of short ribs sitting on top of parpadelle. Sounds amazing. But they takes it up another notch with their awesome cream sauce, buttered mushrooms and asparagus. This was a complete meal made for a king. The short ribs were tender, moist and completely to die for. The parpadelle was cooked perfectly and went beautifully with the cream sauce. Everything worked on this plate. I also like that it's a HUGE portion. My gf got this and luckily for me, she couldn't finish it. So I went to town on her leftovers. 

The other couple ordered the PEPPERED HANGER STEAK and the short ribs stroganoff. I didn't try the hanger steak but judging by how quickly they cleaned the plate, it was probably pretty damn good. 

Sauce also offers a pretty healthy list of premium cocktails. I tried their Moscow Mule and it was poured perfectly - tart and refreshing. I then followed that with 2 gin & tonics. Those were also poured beautifully. 

All in all, Sauce was a hit. It's funny how it wasn't even close to our first choice for dinner but it turned out being a winner.
author: Bruce C.

description:
Great quality food with a cool menu. Came here for my one year with my gf and we were very satisfied with the food! The location is a bit strange, it is literally in an alley which made it a bit weird but nonetheless once you get past that you will be in a quirky restaurant alley. The alley is well lit once inside, there are about 2-3 other restaurants located in the alley as well. There is plenty of outdoor seating and indoor as well.
The menu is not too big but offers an array of options that can satisfy any appetite. We decided to start with the portobello mushroom fries, ham tater tots and the crab cakes that were the night special. All were exceptional! By far the appetizers were my favorite part of my meal, I would recommend ordering a bunch of appetizers and sharing them for your full meal.
I got the cut steak with salad as my entree, it was made very well at a good medium, however the portion is small. The fries that came with it were damn good as well.
Lastly we decided to have the smores as dessert, 2 of them that were perfect to end our meal. Overall had a very good experience and the food was good, I'll be back to try more appetizers! Highly recommended
author: Josue V.

description:
I work at FiDi, and thus, I indulge myself with the French Quarter. Squeezed in between two restaurants that are much bigger than itself is Sauce - and let me just tell you, it has the BEST appetizers you would ever have in the whole strip, and probably within that proximity.

My usual includes Portabella mushroom fries (if you don't eat anything else, eat this!), a bowl of bacon (it's not just bacon, it's finely chopped bacon pieces with light syrup and a mysterious char-taste), garlic bread (they actually  make their own bread!), and kale and spinach (nicely sateed, even people who hates that roughness of the kale liked it!). That is actually more than enough to feed two people with explosive, intense flavors. I also ordered the chicken off main entree menu once, it was tender and flavorful but didn't blow my mind. So appetizers here we go. 

This is perfect for a date or double date or a girls night out, AND the outdoor seating has heaters. So put down your coats, and give your tongue a treat.
author: Lizi F.

description: Best chili  in the hood. . Delicious American food.  Fried chicken awesome!  Meatloaf is a must try! Love it. Open late till at least 1 am.
author: Xela H.

description:
Such a beautiful dining experience. We ordered the appetizer plate with portobello mushroom fries, deviled eggs, and bacon. We also got the ham hock tater tots. 

+ ambiance was amazing 
+ deviled eggs were yummy 
+ tatertots. seriously good!
+ portobello mushroom fries are life changing. 
+ whatever sauce they have with them was really good as well. 
+ prompt and friendly service. 

Thank you!
author: Laura L.

description: Sitting here at the bar. 6 min. No acknowledgement   Bald guy with a beer.  I asked for a beer. He told me hold on. Waited 8 more min.  Finally came to me and said I'm busy. I'll be back.   Walked out. San Fran fail
author: Jon C.

description:
I came to Sauce with a large party and I had a very good experience. There were still groups of happy hour dwellers chilling inside the restaurant, and it help to create a fun environment. 

We got the sampler, but it was a bit of a disappointment. Nothing really stood out other than the bowl of bacon. Each of the appetizer made for good Instagram pictures, but they were just alright in terms of taste. For my entree, I got the Lobster Roll, and it was great. They fit chunky pieces of lobsters into a perfectly toasted roll, and each bite was filled with crispy-lobsterly goodness. The distinct taste of lobster explodes in your mouth, making you secretly wish you had an extra $27 so you can encore your order. Big bonus is that they serve some really good fries with your order, too.

I gotta give a shout out to our awesome waiter, Victor/Richard (i think that's his name). Funny guy who really paid attention to us despite having to serve a busy restaurant. He brought a lemon for my girlfriend's hot water and asked twice if she needed a refill. Nice guy, nice guy.

The only reason Sauce is not  a 4 star in my book is because their price is pretty up there. For that price, a restaurant must be pretty outstanding for me to throw out the 4star. But if you're on a spending spree, I think you'll find Sauce to be a great place : )
author: Ringo M.

description:
OMG this place is SO darn cute. First of all, it's in an alley way, like a little gem hiding from me! Parking was a bit difficult because there is a GIANT hill, and the busy streets of Fin Dis didn't help that parallel park at a 45 degree angle..

Anyways, the boo and I decided to share plates. We split:

Mini Chicken Pot Pies: SO DARN CUTE. Little pastry cups (think mini fruit tarts) with chicken pot pie filling and sprouts. The filling has the consistency of chicken salad maybe, but it's also an open-faced dish so it would be messy if it was too gravy-ish.

Peppered Hanger Steak: a little pricey for a few pieces of steak. Albeit, the steak was SO tender and SO tasty. but between my man and I, we each had 4 slices and it was gone :-/ The steak came with a salad on the plate too which was super yum

Side of Mac N Cheese: Yummy. Yummy. Yummy. Not too cheesy, but there is a lot of good flavors. Also has a nice bread crumb topping and bacon mixed in.

PB&J Dessert: yes yes yes. My boo and I still talk about this dessert to date. It is an amazing lightly pan fried short bread cake with strawberry ice cream and peanut butter inside. Served with a spread of jam on the side, and it was great. My boo thought there should've been more jam and PB, but I was just so amazed with the pan fried short bread. 

I will definitely be returning here in the future!
author: Lauren F.

description:
I can't give many stars for a menu that has a lot of fat. I had the tomato bisque. Though it was delicious, the cream stuck to the sides of my esophagus even after rinsing with a honeyless hot toddy.

But appreciated the kitchen being open until 1a.m. Perfect for an after-evening-Giants-game bite and warming up.

The bartender was energetic. Like lots of caffeine energetic. 

The bar stools didn't have backs, but the stadium seats did, so it was okay.

When I've gone a week or two without eating grease -- or maybe for a hangover cure -- I'll go back and try those Ham Hock Tater Tots.
author: Kiai K.

description:
This was a great late nite find on a Saturday nite. Patio seating but we opted to go inside. We ordered the tater tots filled with ham hocks. Could not see or taste the ham hocks so overprices taters. 

The dessert sampler rocked. Flourless cake, a take on bonbons, a PBJ ice cream sandwich ( YUMMY!) , and they reminded me of mini bienets. It was pretty good. I'd go again- for sure.
author: Anne Marie S.

description:
Ordered tater tots and scallops wrapped in bacon. The pink summer cocktail was great and so was the sauce for the scallops.

The service was disappointing. We just wanted to have some appetizers with drinks and have dinner somewhere else with friends. The waiter seemed to so occupied that i had to get up ask for the bill and a refill for water.
author: Navjeet S.

description: The atmosphere is nice but the delivery was lacking. Should have gotten the overpriced lobster roll. Unfortunately their only seared fish was salmon.
author: Garrett N.

description: So much yes. Lobster roll is rich and perfect and you get a sizable amount of meat unlike a lot of places.
author: Taylor O.

description: Came to this place on a Thursday for some late night eats and a cocktail after work.  Had the Mini chicken pot pies and the Texas wild boar chili.  Both were yummy and hit the spot.  Also had the cucumber & basil gimlet and it was good.  Always a good spot to drop in after a long work night.
author: John B.

description: Went for a work lunch. It was fine. Nothing really knocked my socks off. The pbj dessert was great. Burger is a double patty and it doesn't mention that anywhere! Just alright in my opinion.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
On a rainy day, my boyfriend and I were looking for somewhere new to have a late night dinner. When we arrived, the kind woman who seated us ended up also being our server. It was a small space and quite cramped, but the decor was great. Yes, Sauce is mainly a bar, and there was no forgetting that fact with how loud other people were being. Eating at bars can be awkward when we both don't drink, and I have noticed that people who are buying many drinks (and spending more money) usually are the servers' main focus, not at Sauce! Our own server was very attentive, and even though the level of service she provided on her own went beyond my own expectations, it only got better. A few other servers came to check up on us as well during our meal. Now onto the food! It was amazing! We had the mac and cheese, lobster bisque, shrimp cocktail salad and cheese bread. We have talked about going back just for the bread. Everything was delicious and promptly prepared. We didn't have to wait longer than 5 or 10 minutes for any one dish. 

I would say; I went to Sauce for the food, but I will be returning simply for the amazing service and atmosphere.
author: Daija P.

description:
The ambiance was quite pleasing given the location requires you walking into a dark alley. We sat outside and it had a nice patio with heaters. 
I ordered the fried chicken dish and shared a mini pot pie appetizer. 
The pot pie was nice and hearty but the pie base itself was not flakey and very thick at the bottom. 
The chicken dish was well made with a very memorable corn concept. 
Overall I rate this place lowly since the service neglected our table and would not respond with requests for almost half an hour.
author: Martin F.

description: Went here over the weekend. SO.MUCH.BACON on the menu!!! Sadly, for me I don't eat meat and was very clear about this with the server. She mentioned the very few things which I could order. Ordered the seafood chowder which was filled with bacon. Tasted delicious but was frustrated when I saw the little pink bits of bacon. The server handled it gracefully and sent me home with some salad and soup on the house, but my dinner was pretty much ruined. Attention to detail is important!
author: Christine E.

description:
Solid 3 star dining experience. Visited for lunch recently as part of a "getting to know the new hood" for my office. I think locals go to Belden when they want to experience a bit of European ambiance at lunch or dinner time especially when it's nice out. Unfortunately the food at Sauce doesn't really live up to the part. 

The food is ordinary at best in taste and presentation. The menu is focused on American standards and has a few vegetarian options. It's definitely on the pricy side for lunch. $13.50 for a grilled chicken sandwich. The positive is that they offer smaller portions of fries and salad so you don't need to feel as guilty. Although I  have been here a few times for cocktails and they are always stand out. 

Service was good and she kept up with the lunch hustle. 

Needless to say, not my first choice for lunch in the hood for a meal but I would recommend early evening cocktails.
author: Amy Z.

description:
It was date night out in the city.  My partner texted me the address and we met there.  It's a fun, open outdoor seating with a bar like interior.

Hostess:
Very attentive even after seating, knowledgeable and helpful.

Server:
Friendly and attentive.

Food:
Bacon wrapped mini-meatloaf on mashed potatoes & light gravy - 
Unique and quite tasty mini-meatloaves served atop a dollop of mashed potatoes lightly covered in gravy.  The gravy itself was a bit salty for my taste yet not really detracting from the dish.  My partner had a contrasting view and thought it was not too salty.

Chicken pot pie - pretty good

Chicken sliders w/havarti and thousand island - Favorite of the 3 dinner dishes, will get this one again!

Ice cream smash - vanilla ice cream with raspberry liquor, dried cherries, and bits of toffee and a side of freshly made whipped cream.  Ours was the first order of the evening therefore the best :)

Cinnamon donuts w/blueberries, whipped cream, vanilla bourbon dipping sauce - hot mini-donuts with fresh blue berries, whipped cream and a vanilla bourbon dipping sauce.  The only thing that might make it better is if the blue berries placed in the center of the donuts.

We'll be back!
author: Rick E.

description:
Belden Place is pretty much never a good idea unless you're a tourist. At least Sauce doesn't have a host out in front trying to wave people into the restaurant. This place does fill up a bit during lunch hour, so it can't hurt to make a reservation (but definitely not required).

Portions are small, which makes this quite a pricey lunch. There's a confusing footnote about splitting entrees on the menu. The social plates are free to share, but if you explicitly say you are splitting an entree, you pay $2 extra for an extra plate. They say they give you more food as a result of splitting, but I don't know about that. My friend and I ordered the below items and did not say anything about splitting, and we were not charged the extra $2.

- Lobster Bisque ($14.50): Very creamy and comes with a very small island of crostini and a wee bit of lobster meat. I'm glad we shared this because the richness gets a bit sickening after half of the portion.

- Mini Chicken Pot Pies ($10.50): This comes with 4 "open-faced" chicken pot pies, so it's an easy shared plate. Chicken was very tender and the whole thing is not too salty, which usually seems to be my problem with chicken pot pies.

The wait staff here were so sweet! The interior is relatively trendy with high top tables. The food isn't bad, but this was a light meal that added up to $16 each after tax/tip, so I wouldn't say it's a bang for your buck either.
author: Jessica F.

description: Really good cocktails and strong. Cheap happy hour menu ($10 for sliders and a cocktail of the day). Above average bar food (we had the tatter tots, the deviled eggs, fish & chips). It's a fun atmosphere with attentive staff. Definitely worth revisiting.
author: Alice W.

description: Great food at a decent price. Super fun atmosphere with half-in, half-out (in the alley way) eating. My family tried much of the menu, albeit half way prepared kid-friendly (which was awesome, considering it's almost impossible to find a kid-friendly and quality restaurant in the city). My wife and I split the wedge salad, mini bacon-wrapped meat loafs and the braised short rib stroganoff. All of the food was great, but the stroganoff with forest hen mushrooms was a smash! The bacon in the bacon wrapped meatloaf overpowered the dish, but he taste was still fine. Overall, great place with awesome wait staff! Loved it.
author: Shaun M.

description:
The food, drinks, atmosphere!!! All great. Had the:
-Sampler
-Clam chowder
-Lobster roll 

Must try all!
author: Justin O.

description: Food was alright,  coke tasted off, very metallic.  Lackluster menu-happy hour looks much better than the dinner that was waaaay over priced.
author: Irene S.

description:
The New England Clam Chowder was probably one of the best i've had. It also had a lot of extra ingredients (calamari, salmon, etc), that gave it a little extra texture. I would be careful with eating too much of it though because it might be a little bit on the heavy side. Washing down that grease with a nice chilled drink is definitely a must.

For my entree I ordered the pepper steak and everything about the dish was on point, except the salad. I guess I expected it to taste more on the vinaigrette side, but it just tasted like a huge blob of bleu cheese.
author: T K.

description: Fantastic little location.. Perfect proximity to everything! And the Bacon bowl was everything I hoped it would be!!!
author: Mal M.

description:
Atmosphere... 3/5... Sat in the back and we asked them to close the door and they brought a blanket.

Food... 3/5... Nothing amazing but adequate for 9 pm

Service... 1:5... They fed vegetarians bacon... And then charged us for it.
author: Anil N.

description: This place amazing!  I would come her every night if I lived her.  Portabella mushrooms fries unbelievable!  Clam chowder with the clam shells in the soup it's ok because their fresh!  Everything fresh. Lobster roll was good too. I forgot Moscow Mule a drink that I love very much!
author: Shannon C.

description:
This is one of the places where my company often takes interview candidates for lunch. It's pretty conveniently located next to the financial district, has a pretty good atmosphere, and friendly staff.

Unfortunately on my visit here, I thought the food was a little bit lacking. Some people who I went with (who had been before) highly recommended the mushroom fries, so we got two orders for four people. They were pretty decent, slices of mushroom that were battered and fried, and came with a nice sauce.

For an entree I got the veggie burger, which was a little softer than I'd like and didn't have all that much flavor to it either. I also asked the waiter if I could sub out my salad for the tomato bisque instead, and he was really helpful and got that done for me. The soup itself was a little too creamy and didn't have enough tomato flavor, and the truffle grilled cheese piece that came with it didn't taste that great either. I know truffles taste amazing, but you can't just throw them into an otherwise mediocre grilled cheese and expect it to come out great.

Perhaps the place is just a little less vegetarian friendly. I'm sure I'll be back for more interview lunches, and hopefully I'll try a better entree next time!
author: Amaresh S.

description:
Tips:

$25 for Maine Lobster Roll
$22 for salmon entree
Mushroom fries are mushroom slices shaped like fries and deep fried (very juicy)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I went here with my cousins to celebrate my lovely cousin's birthday. We decided to go with Sauce in the financial district. Belden Lane is a tiny "seafood lane" that is tucked away between two large buildings. I was surprised that they could fit so many restaurants into such a small little alley. I really loved the feel of Belden Lane.

At first I noticed that this place is a HOT spot for business people having a small beer or dinner after work. Everyone was dressed in business wear except for a small few. I'm guessing the happy hour is pretty sweet from 5-7pm, but unfortunately I missed it because my reservation was at 8pm.

The Dine About Town menu (~$37) was pretty limited other than the entree portion of the meal. 
- "Bacon and Eggs" (deviled eggs topped with a honey bacon and mushroom fries). (I liked the deviled eggs) That appetizer seemed to be a lot better than the brussel sprout salad. 
- Sadly there was only one choice for the dessert a pumpkin bread dessert which tasted really good. (very spiced pumpkin for all those pumpkin lovers)

- I got the "Maine Lobster Roll" thanks to some Yelper reviews and overall I thought it was a good dish. It's definitely "chewy" as some reviews have noted. I was expecting a much creamer consistency, but it's literally chunks of lobster pieces on 2 slices of biscotti shaped pieces of bread. I enjoyed the roll though I can imagine that there are better places to get a lobster dish.

- My boyfriend got the salmon entree also off the DAT menu and it was cooked slightly more than I'd like. The dish is a pretty standard salmon dish.

Overall, I was a bit disappointed with my experience I'd say it's a bit pricy for standard dishes.
author: Alice H.

description: The hostess was rude & yelled at us for wanting to sit at 4 top table when nobody was there. She then refused to give us menus. Food was mediocre & I don't plan on returning.
author: Jami M.

description:
The lobster roll was soooo good!! Buttery toasted roll. Pickled onion salad and crispy fries. Mmmm...

My fiancé had the steak and wasn't impressed.

The service was quick and staff was friendly.
author: Jenn R.

description:
I came here with a friend for dinner on a weeknight. We decided to split three items between us. We ordered the portobello mushroom fries, the baked mac & cheese, and the brussels sprout salad. The portobello mushroom fries came out first and we really enjoyed them. The batter was quite flavorful and went well with the dipping sauce. We were really hopeful for the next two items. However, they didn't quite match up in flavor and execution. The macaroni seemed to be overcooked and was too mushy. The brussels sprout salad had a somewhat sweet taste to it which I didn't care too much for. 

Overall, this place didn't blow us away and with all of the other food options in the city, I doubt we'll be back.
author: Simrun D.

description: We ordered the clam chowder and shrimp Ceasars salad. Our server double charged us for the clam chowder.
author: larry c.

description: Holy cow I have been missing out all my life!  This food is absolutely amazing!   The waitstaff make you feel like you walked in to your home.  The ambience of the restaurant is definitely a date atmosphere or even dinner with close friends.  Is set up sort of an alley with overhead lights and close tables.  There's nothing on the menu that would disappoint you.  The portions or delicately put together.
author: Grey H.

description: Well well well, honestly the taste is really good BUT it's overly expensive for what it is. I paid the same price for appetizers here and entrees in another restaurant!!
author: Amélie O.

description: Portions were pretty small for the price. The food was good, but nothing overly amazing. Drinks were great though! The servers were very friendly as well.
author: Angela G.

description: Service was good. Burger was fine. Ambience was great!
author: hd r.

description: I liked the location on Belden alley and the outdoor seating area. I went there with a group of friends and shared a few plates of different appetizers. Everything tasted great, especially the portabella mushroom fries. We got there a little early right before 11:30am and had to wait for a few minutes to get seated. Service was prompt although it could have been a tad bit more friendly. I'd certainly like to come back during a happy hour and try some of their cocktails
author: Andy W.

description:
Cool little place to have a quality meal. I ordered the Steak and when it came out, i thought it was a little small but the taste was absolutely amazing. Im not even a huge salad fan and that tasted amazing as well. If i had the time in SF, i would definitely revisit this place.

Only gave it 4 stars as i prefer pilsner on tap and there was only one (yet delicious) to choose from.
author: Michael B.

description:
Wow, I can't believe it's been almost exactly a year later and I'm back.  I had a friend in town visiting SF for the first time.  She wanted to do something touristy for dinner and I told her no, (haha), since the food will be bad.  

I chose Sauce because of how cute Belden Ln. is and also the proximity to her hotel in Union Square.  I mentioned in the past how yummy the french fries were and yes, again, they are amazing!  We also ordered the mushroom fries even though I came to find out later she doesn't like mushrooms.  She ended up LOVING it and I gave up my portion so she could have more.  We split the veggie strudel and that was a hit too.  If you're interested in getting the tomato bisque it comes in the bowl with the strudel.  

We sat at the bar and chatted with the friendly bartenders and they gave her ideas on what to do over the weekend.  Based on her rave reviews of dinner I'm bumping up my review to 5 stars.  Thanks for a lovely evening!
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Came here with my long lost old friend that I haven't seen for awhile. 
Ambiance: Laid back and casual, not too loud and not too crowded. There's TV for those who want to watch the games!
Service: It was good. The staff kept coming by just to make sure things were okay with us, but it wasn't overbearing at all.
Food: Yum...we got the Ham hock tater tots, Portobello mushroom fries, beef short rib stroganoff, and the PB&J dessert.  You can skip the tater tots, but you should try the others for sure!! Nothing was dry or overcooked. And the PB&J was not too sweet and it was a good choice to end the night. We also go the Kentucky Mule and Moscow Mule - you can never go wrong with a drink for dinner!

I would come here again just for fun!
author: Hey Y.

description: This is a cute little spot that was hard to find on maps. I ordered the deviled eggs and bacon but it needed a little bit more of flavor. The waitress told me that the garlic bread was good , but I did not enjoy it because it was too dry of a bread.
author: May M.

description:
Sauce is located on fun Belden Place, a cute, European looking little alley turned into a row of restaurants with no cars allowed anymore. Convenient locale is smack in middle of Financial District.  Yet the interior is SO VERY DARK and gloomy (not cool and sexy dark) that it was a turn off.  We were seated near kitchen and there was a dank smell I didn't like.  Staff is friendly.  Fare is gourmet-healthy New American cuisine, which is fine.  I ordered an artisan tomato bisque soup which was perfect but accompanying cheese sandwich with truffle oil was on white bread. White Bread! Here in San Francisco, a restaurant cannot get away with boring white bread.  ///  I also ordered a kale/spinach side for that pretty pop of green, but it was fairly flavorless.

Bottom line: Ok place. I would not go again.
author: Marianne F.

description: Love the location of this restaurant as it is tucked away in Belden alley. We were seated outside and ordered the kale/spinach, mini chicken pot pies, and the hanger steak. The veggies and chicken pot pies were good, but the hangar steak was wayyyyy oversalted - I was going to send it back but I was on a time crunch and decided to just bear with it. The salad that came with the steak was delicious though, had some crunch in it as well as figs that gave it texture. Overall I was a little disappointed by the food here as I had higher expectations.
author: Angela K.

description:
I absolutely love chili, and the wild boar chili is the best I've ever had. Thank goodness it's served everyday, because sometimes this addiction has to be fed!

Belden Alley has a lot to offer, and this is one more tasty temptation.
author: X. D.

description:
This place is tucked away in Belden Place. It seems to be a hot after work spot especially since it's conveniently located in FiDi. That said, the entrees are a bit on the pricey side. My friend ordered the cobb salad and we split portabello mushroom fries. I ended up getting a tomoto bisque soup with cheesy breadsticks. Overall, the mushroom fries were pretty tasty and my bowl of soup seemed endless.

It's not super crowded and the noise level is manageable so if you're looking for a place to take a date and/or a colleague, this is definitely a good spot to do so. 

They also have sharing plates which seems like a good idea. The only thing we shared were the fries and they were presented quite nicely.

I've heard the Hayes Valley location is a little bit better so I'll have to check that one out sometime.
author: Amy J.

description: The grilled shrimp & crab louie salad is TO DIE! They serve a very generous portion that's plated beautifully, is fresh, flavorful, and even somewhat healthy. I'd order it again in a heartbeat.
author: Lauren R.

description:
The owner (I only know because he wouldn't stop saying it) went from passive aggressive and disrespectful to beligerent during our brief visit to Sauce. He was out of line to our group and in a totally uncalled for way. At one point he literally leaned in to a group conversation and pointed in my face, telling me to shut up. Bad. 

A shame because the staff was cool. But I have no sympathy for a business owner who chooses to get beligerent in a place they represent. Do that nonsense elsewhere. Or don't. It doesn't matter to us, we won't ever be back. Horrible, abusive, disrespectful. Not to mention my guests were visiting from out of town.
author: Frankie S.

description: Awesome experience. The food was classy and the environment was great for everyone. Delicious food no matter what kind of food you're in the mood for.
author: Jonny B.

description:
The quality of the food alone would make Sauce one of our favorite restaurants in San Francisco, but adding in the comfortable atmosphere, friendly staff and extensive wine list makes this place hard to beat. Rather than featuring the newest trendy dishes or some sort of culinary fusion, Sauce's menu features pot roast, steak and eggs, Mac 'n Cheese and other items you would expect from a home cooked meal. Chef Ben Paula has taken some very basic dishes and made them absolutely amazing.

What to Eat:

1. SAUCE'S FRIED CHICKEN PARMESAN
Breast & Wing with Pomodoro Tomato Sauce & Provolone Crust Butter & Asiago Parpadelle, Peeled Asparagus

This dish consists of perfectly fried chicken w/ pasta sauce, Noodles with a light, buttery sauce and asparagus. The noodles with this dish are hands down the best we have ever tasted.

2. PORTOBELLO MUSHROOM FRIES
Huge portobello mushrooms cut into strips and fried, served with their house made "Fat Boy" sour cream ranch dipping sauce.

3. SAUSAGE CHEESE BREAD
Bread with Acme Ale Cheese and Bacon Fondue

4. POUTINE
Russet Potato Skin Mozzarella Cheese Curds, Pan Gravy

We absolutely love poutine and Sauce's take on this classic Canadian dish is absolutely perfect.

EXTRA CREDIT: SAUCE IS OPEN UNTIL 2AM SO THIS IS THE PERFECT SPOT TO SATISFY YOUR LATE NIGHT CRAVINGS.
TIP: THE HOUSE ZINFANDEL IS A PERFECT ACCOMPANIMENT TO ANY MEAL
author: Matt S.

description:
I came here during happy hour and they had this deal where you pay $10 for a small plate of sliders and a drink. I think the meal varies by the day of the week. My boyfriend didn't want the drink so it was only $4 for 2 sliders of fish and chips with cole slaw. The fish and chip sliders weren't all the great because the bun they used were so thick that when you take a bite all you really taste is .. bread. 


HOWEVER~!!! I ordered the Texas Wild Boar Chili (Slow-Braised Spicy Chili with Sour Cream, Green Onion and Cheddar), and it was DELICIOUSSSSSS! They added a lot of ground beef in it which i really like! The chili was topped with some cilantro which gave it a nice fresh taste. 

The restaurant is very cute. I actually love the fact that it's in a little ally lol. 
I think this is a good place for a casual dinner with your significant other or happy hour with your co-workers.
author: Nguyet T.

description: Magical location, delicious food. Excellent staff. Perfect experience. Must try this. Felt like I was in another country. So much fun. Seems like a locals secret spot!
author: Kate C.

description:
3..5 stars
had drinks and appetizers here before a concert.
located in a cute french inspired alley
we ordered a bunch of tapas style dishes
