flavor was descent and typical choices ie. Scallops Wrapped in Bacon,  Carpaccio, Mushroom Fries, Tater Tots - more of a bar food scene here.
service was nice but a bit slow
author: Marie r.

description: Can't say enough awesome things about this place. Went for the first time a few months ago with six friends and had a delicious dining experience. Started with a yummy martini at the bar and selected the Stroganoff for dinner--best decision ever. Our server, Mark, was absolutely fantastic. He was very accommodating and attentive, and even brought out a cute birthday dessert for me! We liked everything so much that we went back the next evening for dessert and got him again! One of the best places I've ever dined in the city. A+++
author: Janna L.

description: I got the chicken Parmesan lunch. I killed it and it was delicious. Highly recommend. Noodles and salad sides on the same plate complimented the dish well. I like it when they leave the water carafe at the table. I'll be back!
author: Dan E.

description:
Very cute place located in a charming alley/side street. Open until late- most restaurants on the main strip might be closing when Sauce is still serving dinner.

Ordered:
Deviled eggs
Mushroom fries
Pear & pecan salad
Lobster bisque
Mac & cheese.

We were going to have the short beef but we were stuffed.

This was more then plenty for 2 people. All was wonderful- I'd like to try their burger next time- it wasn't on the menu but people were ordering it.

Service? On point! Better then any other restaurant of this caliber. Our waiter- Deon? He timed everything perfectly and was very attentive- you can tell he had high level service experience. I usually have to pay a lot more for this type of service.

Great job Sauce staff, keep up the great work!
author: Azizi A.

description: Definitely a lively atmosphere!! Server was awesome and it's located right in the center of all action but it was too crowded. The outside seating is uncomfortable and you can hear everyone's conversation (including everyone hearing your conversation) so that was a downside. Good thing is that it's packed because they have great food, drinks and service. Definitely try their Moscal Mule!
author: Kevin V.

description: Omg... deviled eggs with pieces of thick cut brown sugar bacon.  Nuff said
author: Michelle R.

description:
We only ordered small plates so we can try almost everything since there's so many options and they all look good. 

We ordered the sampler which has a bowl of bacon, deviled eggs, shrimp and artichoke wontons, and portobello mushroom fries (covered 3 items on the menu we wanted to try already) and it's pretty good. The kale and spinach doesn't look too good since it's just all green in a little bowl but surprisingly, it turned out really good. The mini chicken pot pies are so cute that we almost didn't want to eat them; it's actually not bad. The tater tots were really soft and yummy and the sea salt goes perfectly well with it. The must try dish is the bacon wrapped meatloaf on top of gravy mashed potatoes. I have no other word to describe it besides "delicious!!" The meatloaf itself was soft and the bacon didn't overpowered the meatloaf. The mashed potato was really creamy and the gravy goes perfectly well with it (not too salty). I would definitely order this again. Last but not least we ordered the Mac and cheese. They used shells instead of the original macaroni. It's not bad, but a bit dry (maybe baked for a little too long). 

We ordered almost all their specialty cocktails and I took a few recommendations from our server and it was really good. We had a very friendly server and she's really funny. We had no room for desserts since all those small plates were filling so we just have more drinks instead. Great environment and it's great for parties. Last but not least, they also have free wifi!! I will definitely come back to this place.
author: Cindy W.

description: Oh yea! I'll be back for sure! Someone recommended and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I had the "secret burger" salad & fries. I know, I know! But it came highly recommended! It was awesome. Next time, I'll try some of the cooler stuff, but I had to get the burger. When I get the burger again, I'll nix the fries because it was a lot of food! Waitstaff rec'd the fried portobello mushrooms. Next time bayyybay! It's gonna be on like Donkey Kong! Give Sauce a try!
author: JIM B.

description:
The little alley is nice, and it's fun to be tucked away with all the other restaurants in the middle of the city.

The food is just OK. I had grilled salmon that was on some kind of weird salad with horseradish dressing I think - the fish was generous and tasty, but I wasn't really feeling that salad. Mini meatloaf wrapped in bacon was good. Nothing really stands out , so I wouldn't come here just for the food.  If it were just a little better, I'd give it four stars for being a great combination of food, drinks and atmosphere. 

I've been here twice and I don't remember what I had the first time, but I remember having the same feeling - great spot, food was ok.
author: Jacqueline O.

description: Great food, great cocktails, open late. After a comedy show, my friend and I went to grab late night food. I had a quinoa and kale salad that was terrific! Friend had sirloin steak. Both great, will come again.
author: Andrew L.

description: Recommend by the staff at The Omni hotel.  Didn't disappoint.  We had the hamburger plate (which isn't on the menu).  The double patties, with bacon, cheese, lettuce, tomato, and chipotle sauce, were prepared just right.  The plate comes with fries and a salad.  Both also very good.  Meal was pricey when you add in drinks, but comparable with other restaurants in this area of the city.  We had a great waiter who also encouraged us to try the hamburger.
author: Ron H.

description:
Liana L. knows how notoriously picky and fickle I am, so she let me choose the dinner spot. And wasn't fed up with me. Woot! I sent a list of contenders (and felt proudly diplomatic about it) and she "picked" Sauce. Technically. :D

I had a Scoutmob deal that expired a day or two before our dinner, but Dine About Town 2012 was happening. Score!

Most DAT menus serve you cheaper dishes (ingredients that don't cost as much) and end up introducing first-time customers to some mediocre offerings. I was pleasantly surprised to find myself looking forward to my picks for each course. 

The deviled eggs and portobello mushrooms fries small plate was really good. I've had better deviled eggs but the fries were a welcome change from its potato counterpart. I actually loved that these came together. A bite of hot and cold. 

The butterfish with Brussels sprouts and risotto cake was really good. All the favors just came together. If dessert wasn't coming I would've cleaned the plate! It was good the next day, too. The Brussels sprouts were served as separate leaves...made it a lot tastier than when they're served whole or in half. Butterfish was well-seasoned and tender. 

Oatmeal cookie bon bons were good. I liked the flavors. 

The whole meal, like the restaurant, was understated and unpretentious. Everything was just tasty.
author: Erika C.

description:
I recently had a lovely dinner here - food and service both really nice. But I was really bothered by how they did the bill, and feel a need to vent on the subject. 
This establishment is not alone in pissing me off by calling out the Healthy San Francisco surcharge, which is simply a cost of doing business in this great foodie city where the employees that make the money for their employers need and deserve health coverage. 
But Sauce took it a step too far for me by not sub-totaling the bill before adding on the surcharge (or the tax, which should also be excluded when figuring the tip, BTW). 
Clearly the intention of presenting the bill like this is to have patrons figure the tip WITH the surcharge included, increasing the total to be tipped on --and to make us resent the mandate at the same time.
Since I don't see restaurants pointing out that I am paying a portion of their electric bill, or the rent, or the fees they pay to the restaurant association and such like, I very much resent any restaurant pointing the surcharge out to me, as if to signal that I should be pissed off that the City requires it, when in fact I fully approve of this mandate. 
But adding it into the bill as Sauce does make me think even worse of this place, and any others doing the same.
It makes me suspect that their business model doesn't allow for proper total compensation for their employees, so they have come up with a way to dupe customers into making up for what the business is not providing to their staff.
As someone who's waited tables, I'm very happy to tip well-- but this practice is simply sleazy, and insulting to both server and customer.
author: Cat F.

description:
Yummy food, great prices, love the ambiance!

Loved the:
- fried calamari & stuffed chorizo (big portion for appetizer!)
- tomato bisque
- portobello mushroom fries (try dipping in the tomato bisque!)
author: Sherry L.

description: My girlfriend and I ordered three appetizers for dinner... The mini pot-pies, the shrimp and artichoke wonton and the tatter-tots. I'd definitely recommend ordering a bunch of their "social bites" and don't miss out on the tots!
author: Jason P.

description: Came for lunch yesterday. Place was so-so. The service was terrible. It took forever for the server to come to us the entire lunch service. Flagging him down was a pain and he seemed like he didn't want to be there. Beers were served warm and food was just alright. Nothing to be wow'ed about. I wouldn't come back.
author: Evelyn Q.

description: I had the Grilled Kobe Sirloin Steak and it was the best steak I've had in a long time. Also the Mac n Cheese was the best! Then finished it off with the Mini Smores, which was awesome also! Everything was so good!
author: Gretchen W.

description:
Solid dinner spot for drinks and eats. Tucked away down Belden Place, I loved the hidden feel. Our waiter was really attentive and patient with us, as we were too busy catching up with our dining companions to focus on food selections. I think others at the table were happier with their entrees than I was. I ordered the salmon, and it was really under-seasoned, and completely raw in the middle. Pretty disappointed, although my fiancees steak was quite tasty. Also tried the tater tots which were on point. 

I'd give Sauce another try, perhaps sticking with something a little heartier next time?
author: Brianna M.

description:
We decided to come here for dinner as it was on Scoutmob.

We ordered two entrees:
     - Maine lobster roll ($25). The lobster was perfectly cooked as it was delicate and buttery on a good quality bread roll.  The lobster roll came with a good portion of seasoned shoestring fries and some mixed greens in a vinaigrette. 
     - Niman Ranch hanger steak ($24). The steak was cooked medium-rare as ordered and a topped with a tasty sauce. The entree included a couple of wedges of lightly fried potatoes and a couple of asparagus spears topped with some chipotle hollandaise, and two poached egg yolks in a small cup.  Couldn't figure how the poached eggs complemented the dish. Was I supposed to dip my steak into the eggs?

Overall, the food was delicious but the portions were on the small side.  I've had lobster rolls in the East Coast that were large.  The hanger steak entree had about 5-6 slices of steak (see my pic), not 9 slices as on the website.  Without the Scoutmob deal, this meal would have been considered pricey.  But I will rate it 4 stars for the quality and for the Scoutmob deal.  Otherwise, I would rate it 3 1/2 stars.
author: Al L.

description: We had an amazing dining experience at Sauce! We had great service and the food was outstanding! We had to try the "bowl of bacon," which doesn't sound like much, but was actually very tasty. I had the Peppered Hanger Steak which came with loaded fries and an arugula salad. It was quite simply awesome! We finished with Mini S'mores, which were SO good! We loved everything about our meal!!
author: Andrea G.

description: Awesome location in the financial district, off a Main Street and down a cute little alley. There's some great outside seating and the staff is attentive and quick. The food was overall very solid, but a little short of spectacular. The tater tots are definitely worth a try, the soups are skippable, and the main courses are pretty good. I got the Kobe steak which was delicious, the accompanying salad was ok and the fries that came with it seemed a little out of place but were tasty. My friend got the salmon and liked it quite a bit. There wasn't a lot on the menu that I was dying to try, so hard to say if I'll be back, but an overall good experience
author: Anthony D.

description:
I let fellow Yelper Erika C. choose the place for our catch-up dinner (because I know what's good for me heh) and Sauce ended up being the game plan.

We were both pleasantly surprised by how good everything tasted on the Dine About Town 2012 menu. Might've been because we were so buzzed off the cocktail (read, ONE, not plural) we downed on an empty stomach at the Rickhouse down the block but all three dishes were solid without trying too hard to be creative. Flavors were not overpowering, overly salty or bland.

Started off with Deviled Eggs & Portobello Fries- simple, nothing special (Erika's had better) but it was fine for not being rich or greasy.

The Hawaiian butterfish with risotto croquette and brussel sprout salad: the fish cut like butter - delicious. I liked the croquette the least - risotto was a little underdone and gave the croquette a pebbly texture that was off-putting with the smooth fish.

For dessert, the Oatmeal Cookie Bon Bons were perfectly creamy and gave the impression of cheesecake. Even though the rum soaked raisins were just a bit too strong on their own and had to be paired with the bons bons with each bite, topped off with one whole strawberry, brown sugar and cream, the meal ended satisfyingly.... sweet.

I couldn't decide between 3.5 or 4 stars for this place, but I would definitely come back again.
author: Liana L.

description: Should have been really cool but just wasn't. 'Large' portion of soup was definitely not, felt harassed by the server who asked us about 5 times in ten minutes whether we'd decided yet, and everyone in the place was sitting there in their coats because it wasn't warm enough.
author: Sarah H.

description: Very nice place ! But don't go there if you are hungry, very small plates ... Medium/high prices for the plates !!! Good but NOT enough for the prices & for have a great dinner !!
author: Fabio L.

description:
The staff at Sauce was very accommodating for our dinner party of ten, especially considering everyone in our group was late getting to the restaurant. Food selection is decent, and everyone loved their appetizers and desserts. In my opinion, the standouts were the tater tots for appetizers and the warm chocolate cake for dessert. Our waitress was amazing, as she had the arduous task of keeping everyone's bar tabs separate. 

The next time I come back for dinner, I would like to sit in their patio in the alleyway. It looks so romantic and cozy.
author: Maggie L.

description: I hate brussel sprouts but damn SAUCE 's brussel sprout salad was delicious!!!! Apparently there is candied bacon in it, that's why it's so good!..Got the same nice waiter as last time I was here. This time I got steak and potato skins it was delicious perfectly looked medium rare. Tator tots ok tomato bisque delicious with grilled cheese bread!
author: Karen T.

description:
The original Hayes Valley Sauce was bookmarked for awhile but decided to try the Beldan Lane location the other day.

The Hayes Valley location's menu seemed more expansive than this location's (maybe its just me) but I didn't want a HEAVY dinner and I didn't have much of a selection so I opted for my childhood favorite: grilled cheese and tomato soup. Sauce's version of grilled cheese had truffle which was hardly noticeable and the portion was teeny tiny. I found the soup to be a bit bland. Hubs had the tri-tip sandwich and didn't really think much of it. 

Our server was likable. She seated us outdoors as it was still nice out on this particular Sunday 70 degree evening. Despite the fact that we wanted to like Sauce we weren't too impressed with their menu offerings or their food. To be fair I'll give them another shot at a later time.
author: Esther A.

description: Beware: the location is in an alley and if you're not from SF, it can be hard to find.  Plus---- one of few restaurants opened after 11PM and when we found it-- it delivered. I ordered the bowl of bacon (sweet and peppery like jerky), deviled eggs (think regular deli style), and beef carpaccio (meh- Hops & Hominy was better). But I actually fell in love with the mushroom fries (oddly enough).
author: Cen'Cere C.

description: Honestly this was the best meal me and my wife had on our trip in San Fran. The service was great, the food was great, the drinks were great, and the prices were reasonable. I will be coming back!
author: Thomas J.

description:
server was sweet.
mac and cheese yummmmmm

drink sucked though.

will be back, maybe just grab something on tap or bottled next time.
author: Whitne Y.

description:
I came here twice. First time was with 3 other people to have a quick happy hour session before a concert. The second time was to start here and then bar hop in the area. It's located in the back end of this alley.

We had the mini chicken pot pies, mac n cheese, fried mushrooms, tots with ham hock, maple bacon(?), and drinks. The first time I came everything was over seasoned. The second time, the tots were good, but the chicken pot pies were extremely dry. I wanted a whole gravy boat to pour over the pies. Drinks were decent. First time they were a good strong. Second time they seemed watered down.

Overall it was a nice place. It wasnt spectacular. I probably wouldnt be coming back because there are more places to try.
author: Christina L.

description: This place is hidden off the main street. I missed the entire 7 games of the hockey playoffs but they had the game on. Game On! Go Sharks! Eric the bartender is the B-O-M-B!!! Service like the Ritz but on a wooden shelf! Sweet Spot! Coming back.
author: Christopher M.

description:
Went here for what I thought was a private happy hour event.  The hostess told me it was "in the back"... not sectioned off in any way.  It was way overbooked, way too crowded, they were definitely over their capacity.  It's one thing if someone suggests a bar for a happy hour event and too many people show up.  This event had a drink sponsor however, so, this was planned in advance.  They should have capped off the RSVPs or suggested to the event organizers to find another location.

If I ever go back, I will definitely call first to see if they are having an event.
author: Chloe M.

description:
I like Sauce very much and I recommend this place.  I do, however, have one complaint: they have one of the yummiest sounding menus in the city.  The descriptions are phenomenal.  The problem with this is that the food can't possibly live up to the descriptions.  All told, this is a good problem to have, because it's hard to review the menu and not see things that sound delicious.  But having set expectations at "11," it's hard to receive food that is a "9" and not be slightly disappointed.  

Whoever writes the menus as Sauce should contract out to other restaurants.  He/She/They would make a killing.  Other restaurants could learn a lot from the menu descriptions at Sauce.
author: A A.

description:
There are so many words for this place. Amazing. Spectacular. To die for. Here's the thing. Do NOT be deceive by the menu. When you first look at it you think "kind of dull". Wrong! Once you see it, and then eat it, you'll want to come here for your anniversary, date/double date, or your divorce celebration. 

Ambience: there's inside and outside seating. It was a some what chilly 60 degree Sunday night. Don't worry there are heaters. You'll see the dark wooden tables and chairs, no candle light, flower center pieces. The inside is lighted well, and there is a full bar with I think one tv. Relaxing and chill atmosphere.

Service: Dion (chocolate thunder waiter) was very nice and pleasant. The hostess Laurel (Asian spice with edge) came by and spoke to us. She also recommended going to the other Sauce location in Hayes Valley. 

Food: okay again, do not let the menu take you back. It's incredible! We first started with the portobello fries with crack (it's not crack but tastes AWESOME). Then we had their 5-6 inch garlic bread. That was good. I had their fried chicken with kale salad (btw I don't normally like kale. It's actually the bottom of the list when it comes to my greens. But I love this one), and mash potatoes. The fried chicken was made perfectly, and the biggest plus was little to no grease and it's healthy! I couldn't believe how light the crust was. My partner had the shrimp and crab salad. Very tasty. The shrimp was done just right too. Finally, dessert. Chef Ben, whatever you did to make this your own, you just owned this. We had the peanut butter and jelly sandwich with vanilla ice cream. This was a modern twist to it. It's not even a sandwich, it's four small pieces of cake. So if you had to get something from the dessert menu, don't be stupid. Listen to me and get this! 

Kudos again to Laurel, Dion, and Chef Ben! You guys made our experience here fantastic! Is there a 10 star rating?!!
author: Vinson H.

description: Open late!  After walking all over Chinatown we found this place on a weeknight.  Small but tasteful. Open till 2 am and the seafood chowder was great, service excellent. Shared plates are no extra charge.  Great place for late night hungries!
author: Stephanie F.

description: Yummy comfort food. Amazing appetizers. Cinnamon sugar mini donuts for dessert! Fun and friendly service, will return!
author: Gayle S.

description: This is a hidden gem down in an alley. I had the lobster roll and a Moscow Mule and both were phenomenal. It is a little pricey but well worth it. Would definitely go back.
author: Tim H.

description:
What a heavy meal! My friend and I came here tonight because we had a Scoutmob 50% off deal.  That deal makes this place worth it - if you don't have the deal, then I think this place is overpriced and not worth it.  

We got:
+ Portobello mushroom fries: unique! Crispy! Delicious!
+ Fried clams: Tasted mostly like calamari to me, but a little more chewy.  Tasty because it's fried, otherwise it wasn't anything special. 
+ Mini pot pies: By mini, they mean MINI. Tiny baby pies! You can eat one in two or three bites. Savory, yummy.  Not out-of-this-world, but enjoyable. 
+ Maine lobster roll: That lobster was good.  The bread that they used was even better because it was insanely buttery.  A good combo.  This plate also comes with these fries that were shaped like normal fries but had the same texture as potato wedges.  There was also some mixed greens.  A good plate of food.

All of this came out to only $27 before tip, thanks to Scoutmob!  It was a very hearty meal, and I left the place feeling pretty damn stuffed but happy.  I'm not sure if I would come here if I didn't have that coupon but if I had another one, then yes it's definitely worth it.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Service:  A+
Food:  A+

Husband, Son, and I dined here on a Saturday evening. Son is a concierge at a nearby hotel, is familiar with the restaurant, and recommended we have dinner here. Husband and I were suitably impressed. The hostess was welcoming, the server was charming, funny, and helpful. The food...how should I say? *Nothing* was off. Everything was perfect. We shared several social plates, one entree (the Lobster Roll), and several desserts. I can't think of one less-than-gushing thing to say about all the dishes we had. Or about the service. 

There are so many wonderful restaurants yet to try, but we will return to Sauce.
author: Karen K.

description: I wish I could give them more than 5 stars. This food is delicious! The service is superb! I highly recommend.
author: Maya W.

description:
Overview: 
Great appetizers, sides, and drinks. Mediocre entrees. Decent dessert. Come here for apps and cocktails before a meal elsewhere. 

APPS:
We ordered the sampler platter which included the crab rangoons, portobello fries, deviled eggs, and bowl of bacon. 
- Rangoons were nicely fried and the crab tasted fresh. 
- Fries were crunchy, meaty, and juicy with the right amount of seasoning. 
- deviled eggs were standard, nothing special but yummy none the less (would have been better if it had a little kick of cayenne or something). 
- the bowl of bacon was simple but awesome--candied but salty and smokey, almost with a grilled aroma. 
Great yummy plate to start.
(4/5 stars) 

ENTREES:
Amongst 6 of us, we ordered 2 braised short rib stroganoffs, 2 medium rare New York pepper steaks, and 1 seared salmon. 

Stroganoff - the noodles weren't tossed very well and were in dire need of seasoning. the braised short ribs were tender and seasoned well (and served without rib). the hen of the woods mushrooms were a great textural touch in the dish, but overall nothing spectacular in flavor for this plate.
(3/5 stars)

NY Steak - I was most excited for this one because it's a cute play on steak and potatoes, but unfortunately was very let down. Firstly, the fig and blue cheese salad that the meat was served on was severely overdressed and over salted. The arugula was soaked beyond recognition in a dressing that was already so so so salty to begin with. The addition of the blue cheese did not help with the sodium :( the steak itself was cooked to a nice medium rare, but by the time it got to us, it was already a little cold-- likely because they wanted to serve everything at once and the cooking time varied for each item. It lacked the "fresh off the fire" look and taste, and became a little tough to chew. There was a big pool of demi glace around the steak (and salad) that was also heavily over salted. Half the amount of liquid over a fresh steak would have done the job. Sadly, the most enjoyable thing on the plate were the fried potato skins that came in a cute little brown paper bag and served with a side of sour cream, bacon bits, and cheddar cheese. This plate has so much potential to be delicious but the execution was lacking heavily and I just got mouthfuls of salt salt and more salt. Hopefully it was just an off night?
(2/5 stars) 

Seared salmon - salmon was probably the best executed protein of the night. It was perfectly cooked, tender, and flakey. There was a nice sear and it had just the right amount of seasoning. Unfortunately the salad it was sitting on was also overdressed. IMHO salad should be a nice light crunch to compliment the dish-- maybe this restaurant believes it should be a vehicle for the protein's sauce? 
(3.5/5 stars) 

DESSERT: 

PB&J ice cream cake - brought my back to childhood! Nice and moist cake sandwiching delicious and creamy ice cream. Served with a berry sauce. Would try again. 
(4/5 stars) 

cinnamon sugar doughnuts - a lot denser than expected, wanted something more light and airy inside but just my personal preference for doughnuts. Also a bit over fried. But vanilla bourbon sauce was awesome. (3/5 stars)

Strawberries and cream - the most simple and surprisingly the BEST of all the desserts. 5 strawberries served on a bed of fresh whipped cream with a pile of fine brown sugar on top. swirl the berry into the cream and roll it into the sugar-- wowowowowow. 
(5/5 stars) 

ETC: 
- Belden place is a cute alleyway with other upscale places. Outdoor seating is nice if its not too chilly since they have heaters. 
- Service was nice. 
- The outdoor tables have plates set up before guests arrive, but they sometimes collect dust and ash from the surrounding restaurants so you may have to change them before actually eating.
author: Erin N.

description: Stopped here with my lady for a Saturday afternoon meal.  This place is tucked away in an alley in downtown SF.  It was a bit annoying because there is 5 restaurants next to each other and every host is trying to get you to go to their spot.  We settled on sauce the lobster bisque was great because it came with a BIG chunk of lobster...however the bisque was just average.  The steak and salmon was good...I'm not sure if I will rush back but the meal was good.
author: Cory F.

description:
I was taken to lunch yesterday and while I had been to the Gough street location once before I had only had the tomato bisque just because it was suggested after a friend of mine and I had several beers. That was pretty good, but I was at this location mainly to eat and had the bacon cheeseburger that was awesome.

I'm picky about my burgers. If you're going to charge me $15.50 for a bacon cheeseburger it better be a damn good cheeseburger. First the bacon was on the burger not hanging off it and outside the bun. The burger was huge at least a half pound and I could taste cheddar and blue cheese which I think the burger was stuffed with blue cheese and then had cheddar on top. It was a good combo. Sides were season fries and a small salad with a sweet dressing that worked well with the burger because with that much meat you definitely need a break every once in awhile.

We had inside seating which actually gave us more room as the outdoor seating on Belden always seems a bit cramped to me.

Service was top of the line as well.
author: Eric K.

description: Bacon Bacon Bacon. Get the Bacon. Bartender knows what's up so trust him with your drink. I don't remember any other part of my meal besides the Bacon. So get the Bacon. Bacon.
author: Rob T.

description: Food was good, there clam chowder was delicious the sampler dessert was very good the garlic bread was WOW the service could have been better; I asked for water and it took to the end of the meal for them to bring it, that place was packed but you know if you're making money hire more people give better service.
author: Hector E.

description: Great small plates like Lobster Rangoon and devilled eggs make this a fun place to visit. Moscow Mule was a solid choice on a hot day and the garlic cheese bread made me really happy.
author: Troy B.

description: Went to Sauce for a late bite on satarday night. I was pleased to find a well rounded menu. We ordered the bacon wrapped scallops and garlic bread as appetizers both were good.  For our  entrees we ordered the steak and the fried chicken. Both were delectable.  The steak was done perfectly and was served over a bed of sauted arugula with blue cheese crumbles absolutely devine.  The fried chicken was also wonderful. The mashed potatoes were a hit and the corn off the cob was truly fantastic. Along with exceptional service we will definitely be back.
author: Anthony A.

description:
Really quiet - I'd worry about their sustainability. The pork sandwich was better in theory than practice. Ketchupy. The crab wontons were overpriced - $3 for a small little thing. No way!

I liked that they offered fries and a small salad. Always wanted that.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Even though I've never been to the original Sauce, I can't really compare the tastings between the two.  With my Scout Mob deal, I figured why not give this place a try since my gf and I were hungry from shopping and this place was nearby.  

Ordered the mini chicken pot pies (eh, warm but nothing too tasty...gravy was light), cilantro wings (regular bbq wings with a lime-cilantro sauce on the side, but was too watery and not my ideal cilantro sauce), and the corned beef sandwich (which we never got to taste because the server took down a burger as our order).  I was a bit disappointed because where does corned beef sandwich ever sounded like a burger?? 

Food took a really long time.  I understand they knew we were sharing and wanted us to finish all the appetizers before bringing out the entree.   Besides the wait, our order came out wrong.  We didn't even bother complaining because we didn't want to wait another hour.  The burger LOOKED medium rare, but it was pretty much well done and it was a little burnt.  It was nice of them to have separated each half of the burger on a plate for us, served along with fries and salad.  Salad had a unique taste to it...it had salt!  It wasn't bad, but something new.  Fries were good, but I couldn't finish it.  

Busted out my Scout Mob deal and the bill came to $4.  I think they gave us the whole $25 off, so with tips, $10 out the door for a 2 people lunch.  Not bad at all, just not sure if I would want to wait 1.5 hours for a burger lunch again.
author: Nancy S.

description: Good was excellent, we opted for 4 different apps because they all sounded excellent and it worked out perfectly. Only 4 stars because service was awful.
author: Brent F.

description:
Oh wow!

I just loved it! What a lively ambience!!

We had only appetizers - Scallops Wrapped in Bacon, Lobster Rangoon, Beef Tenderloin Carpaccio, Ham Hock Stuffed Tater Tots. The Beef Tenderloin Carpaccio was just orgasmic!!! The scallops were very vey tasty as well!

I don't enjoy drinking much. Hence, I am very choosy with cocktails, but I liked their Moscow Mule.
author: Suchismita D.

description: Called a day ahead and came here with a group of 10. We sat in the ally which was cute. The service was nice and the drinks were good. However, half the table was too far from the heat lamps and so we were freezing. The "share" plates were barely shareable and the entrée plates were equally undersized portions. The food/cuisine was nothing special enough to be worthy of pretentiousness, and yet we got charged way too much for the teeny bland foods we received. Service was horrendous. The hostess didn't want to be there and the server was barely at the table. Only half our orders game out (2 cold plates), and the rest took another 30 minutes. If we're dining together, you would think the food should come out together. Utterly disappointed. Train your staff properly please. Not coming back.
author: Zara S.

description: Amazing food, drinks and fantastic service!!! Great for a large group of 8-10 friends to a small 2 top if you are looking for nice restaurant not over the top on price or atmosphere ...comfortable, can hear each other talk, relaxing, good ambiance...this is a place to go!  They also have tables outside along the street w several other restaurants...w heaters!  Again all of our dishes were spectacular...to the point we all commented on how delicious everything was! Going back for sure!!!
author: Heidi H.

description:
AMAZING!!! First off, they have Old Rasputin stout! (Nuff said) and everything we had was great! 
We started with the Portobello mushroom fries, deviled eggs, & brussel sprout salad and continued with the Grilled, Garlic Shrimp & Crab Louie salad and the Peppered Hangar Steak! Everything was delicious - the mushroom fries and hangar steak are a MUST have! They cooked the steak exactly as ordered and the mushroom fries are crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside. We've tried other places nearby before and this is our new spot! Definitely coming back to try the rest of their tasty looking menu!
author: Linda L.

description:
When the sun is out in the city, Belden alley is a great spot to kick it at for lunch.  Scoutmob offered a deal on this place so my coworker and I decided to try it out.  We ordered the following:

Portobello mushroom french fries 
Beet and Goat Cheese salad
Lobster sandwich

The mushrooms were probably my favorite out of the three.  Totally different; nicely seasoned.  It was a delicious surprise!  The salad was pretty satisfying.  Good portion with a decent amount of fresh beets.  The added touch was the deep fried goat cheese balls. YUM!  The lobster was my least favorite - not that it wasn't good, it was ok. I personally thought it was a bit on the chewy end and not as warm but then again, we were too busy eating the salad and the mushrooms, the sandwich must have cooled off.

Server was friendly and attentive.  If it weren't for the scoutmob deal, I would say that this place was a bit on the pricey end for an overall "OK" meal.  But I came back again, only this time time around, my brother paid for my full price meal! Thanks Bro!
author: Diana M.

description: Had lunch outside at Sauce on a prefect sunny but breezy day in San Francisco. I had the lobster roll and my lunch date had the fried chicken. Both were delicious and had us screaming for more. We were so full from our dishes that we didn't have room for anything else (sad) but I will definitely come back soon! Service was great and the food tasted exactly how I pictured it would.
author: Nicole H.

description:
This place is a gem. Everything is suffused with that delicious ham hock flavor. The tots and mini-chicken pot pies are awesome but the true standout for me are the bacon wrapped mini meatloaves. The mac n' cheese was decent and a good portion to share for two. It can get crowded but we somehow always manage to snag two bar seats. The best thing is that they have Cali' Creamin' vanilla ale on draft.

I can't wait to come back for the bowl of bacon, but it's hard to justify ordering when just about everything else has bacon or ham hock in it.
author: Kelly A.

description: So so good. I love that it's open late. The scallops wrapped in bacon, the chilli and the shrimp salad were all so great. I loved how friendly the staff was. Would definitely come back!
author: Annie J.

description:
Other patrons have noted dishes to avoid, too; in general they have a good burger, but most of the food is just "meh," which isn't even overcome by the excellence of ordering a bowl of bacon as a side dish. 

Service is also average, and sometimes they are understaffed; given the wealth of other better options along Belden, it's not worth it.
author: Melissa B.

description: Everything that I put in my mouth was amazing. Great appetizers. I highly recommend the seafood chowder. So good.
author: Charlie K.

description: Went here for their restaurant week menu. The steak was very over cooked. Service is bad, the server was nowhere to be found once she took our order. I had to walk up to her to get some more water and my check. WILL NOT COME BACK, not worth the money and time.
author: Siri L.

description: Fantastic menu for full dinner or late night snack. After a full day of traveling this was the perfect place. Good service as well.
author: Michael C.

description: Great service, cocktails and location. I had the chicken pot pies and a wedge salad and my husband had the chili. For dessert he had the PB&J which was not exceptional but the s'mores were great!
author: Lee A.

description:
Favorites:

-fun and tasty apps like deviled eggs and tator tots
-decent portions
-being able to get a seat on a Saturday night
-location

Beware the cocktails. They are just as tasty as the food so its easy to down 2 or 3 in a heartbeat.
author: Ashley W.

description:
It's pretty loud so if you're looking for a quiet dinner this isn't the place to go. Space was nice and moderately busy. We came on a Wednesday night a little before 7 and the hostess was very attentive. We had to wait a little for a table but figured we could get drinks in the meantime. 

It took about 10 minutes for the bartender to even acknowledge us, and when he did he asked for our IDs and as we were getting them out he went back to helping other people at the bar for another 10 minutes. We ended up getting our table before we could even order a drink. 

Food gets the job done. A little overpriced for what it was. Portions are decent and selection from the bar boosts it a bit. You won't be missing anything if you skip it. 

Giving a 3... mostly because of the rude bartender with the long hair.
author: Cat A.

description: This place takes forever to bring your food out. Waiters are very rude when asking them about the status. We waited over an hour for our food on a non-busy night. I recommend not coming here and food is not very good
author: David L.

description: Worst place I've ever been to .....short stocky manager on sat night was sexist and drunk while trying to help customers .....this place is horrible ....literally  40$ for wontons and a box of bacon ...stay clear also there is mad roaches crawling in front of the place its in a shady alley .....
author: Shannon B.

description:
Happy hour buddy & I were on this side of town due to a meeting, (un)fortunately this meeting got cancelled so we decided to go for happy hour.

We were hungry, thirsty and tired when we got to this little cute alley. Unfortunately the restaurant we were interested in was still closed for another 20 minutes, so we decided to go to Sauce in the meanwhile.

We both ordered one drink off their happy hour menu, I ordered the mojito and she ordered the margarita. Since we were hungry, we also ordered two appetizers, the bruschetta and the portobello fries. 
The bruschetta was not a real bruschetta, since it had some sort of cream cheese on it (??? Why???), other than that it was just ok, the tomatoes were rather flavorless, but there's only so much you can mess up on a bruschetta, it still is bread and tomatoes.
The Portobello fries look great at first sight, but when we tasted it is kind of tasted like a bad batch of oddly breaded portobello mushrooms. 

Other than that, our server was a bit too eager and seemed a bit too excited to finally have customers (not in a good way). 

We decided to pay and go to the restaurant next door, then when we got the bill it was a total of $45, for 2 appetizers and 2 drinks during happy hour?! 

Next time, I'll just wait the 20 min and stand outside until a better restaurant opens up.
author: Helen D.

description: Came across this gem after leaving Superbowl City, hungry, thirsty, and tired. They gave us a table on 5 minutes notice, and then brought out the best lobster roll I've ever had, along with some excellent fries and a fine dark and stormy. For dessert, look no further than the smores... This place is awesome.
author: Carson M.

description: Amazing! Food is pretty much comfort food done with a twist. It is something I would feel guilty eating every day tho. I would recommend to anyone I know. Try the bowl of bacon. It will have you coming back just for that.
author: Mercy W.

description: Went with hubby for dinner.  Food was ok - ambience was very nice.  I love This little alley.  My salmon was cold for some reason but hubby had a great steak.   Drinks were perfect.  The service was superb.  Would return for sure but maybe order something else.
author: Pemberly s.

description: Some friends from out of town came and treated us to this place and I just say the food was amazing! Our server Nicole was so attentive and accommodating. We ordered the mushroom fries (10/10), the lobster roll entre (10/10), and the chicken entre. I will definitely be back, highly recommend!
author: Mrs. S.

description: I found this restaurant on Yelp, so I thought I should give it my review. The food was excellent, the ambiance was nice, and the service was great!
author: Lucas P.

description: Amazing food!! A must try!! Everything we ordered was delish! But the braised short ribs stroganoff was exceptional!!! We would have gave it 5 stars if it was just based on the food but the service was disappointing!
author: Lena P.

description: Friendly service and relaxing atmosphere...however I won't rave about the food much..at best mediocre. Luke-warm clam chowder in a surprising shallow bowl for $12.95 (I think)...honestly, I find Cambell's Chunky from a can to be more satisfying. Also ordered the mac 'n cheese....luke-warm (a pattern?), smallish, al dente without much taste, could've made far better at home. My friend ordered the lobster bisque which I tasted (not so exciting) and a glass of wine....The damage was $72 something plus tip - I won't be back.
author: John D.

description: Took some yelpers' advice and got the tomato soup and grilled cheese. It was so good on a cold day. I would definitely come here again.
author: Ada L.

description: The portobello fries were so so, but we had the short rib stroganoff. It was delish! This is our second visit, although I do have to say I liked the first location better. It was down an ally. It had a more relaxed vibe.
author: Hollie P.

description: This was our first time at Sauce and I already know it will be the first of many. I'm not sure that I would call Sauce a gastro pub only because it seems less pretentious than what we've come to expect from establishments that bill themselves as such. Our waiter, Dion, was friendly, knowledgable, and very helpful. We went with friends (two couples) and ordered a selection of the Social Plates, which were amazing. The Mini Chicken Pot Pies and the Mac and Cheese were particularly noteworthy. They shared the Lobster Bisque while we shared the Tomato Bisque and they were both delicious--although I preferred the Tomato Bisque since it was accompanied by focaccia bread with melted gruyere and truffle oil. OMFG. The mains were Lobster Rolls that exploded with epic goodness. We were almost too full after that, but somehow found room for Vanilla Ice Cream with chocolate sauce and the most amazing Cinnamon Sugar Doughnuts with Vanilla Bourbon Dipping Sauce. A must try. The entire meal, beginning to end, was a home run.
author: Nilo R.

description:
I eat at Sauce all the time!   It's right by my office and is one of my favorite places. 

Love the portobello mushroom fries--the batter has a great flavor, and reminds me of fried food in NOLA. 

I also love the peach/prosciutto salad.  

The wedge salad is beautiful to look at, and huge! 

I recently tried the butterfish sandwich--first time trying butterfish--I would definitely order it again and again!  (Check my twitter for a pic @katiecolomb)

The ambiance here is great--the only american food on the little European strip on Belden Lane. 

Staff is friendly, and can recommend the best stuff.
author: Katie C.

description: The good food was flavorful and artistically presented, but overshadowed by the deplorable service and environment. Was relegated to the alley with an unleveled table, rain leaking through, and construction workers walking by. We had to chase down our servers several times while dealing with the hostess with an attitude and problems with attending to her hair in a compulsive manner, rather than letting her waiter know they were seated.
author: Alan C.

description:
Loved this place. Staff is friendly. Decor is fun. Menu had so many delicious options, I was torn making a decision. We got the social plates sampler with a bowl of sugared bacon (surprisingly tasty and nicely crispy), deviled eggs, mini chicken pot pies, and portabella mushroom fries (fabulous). We LOVED it all. 

The Tomato Bisque was great as a sauce for dipping the white truffle grilled cheese toasts. Once the toasts were gone, it was kind of thick and "sauce-like."  Not good enough to slurp up as soup/ bisque.

The mini bacon-wrapped meatloaves were adorable --kind of like meatballs -- each on its own little bed of mashed potato. Pretty good.

The steak was divine.

I'd go back again, except there are so many other tempting options on the street to try before we leave town!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
WOW!!   Nothing to complain about here!

Rolls are served with salted butter and are perfectly warm.
Drinks are delicious and fresh - not heavy-handed.

The chili does have a little bit of a bite, but just enough to make you want more.

The lobster roll stole the show!   Moist lobster in a buttery bun, with a bit of seedy mustard dressing.....so delicious!  Along with a salad and fries - it was perfect!
author: Nicole V.

description: The mushroom fries were a standout. The wild boar chili was also quite good, and was actually spicy enough for me! A few of the other appetizers were very bland though, and the drinks were small and weak for the prices they charge. Overall, the ambiance was nice and some of the food was good, but I don't think this place is memorable enough that I'd make a special effort to come back.
author: Anita P.

description:
Stay away from the mini pot pies! 

Their burger is the best I've ever had, hands down. The doughnut and pb&j desserts are fantastic as well! 

Setting is okay, there was cigar smoke at the time (late at night around 11 pm) and service could be better. It is a block away from the Omni, huge plus!
author: Travis W.

description: We ate here for our last night in San Francisco. There are so many great restaurants in the city - choosing wasn't easy. At some point you just pick one and go for it. We couldn't be happier with our choice! The atmosphere was great - we sat outside in the perfect September night weather. I really liked the house chardonnay. We had a bunch of the shared plates - deviled eggs, mini pot pies, scallops, spinach and kale, Mac n cheese. For dessert we had the donuts and coffee. Everything was great but the real star of the meal was Nicole, our server. This is one of those meals that I feel like I will remember for a long time and was the perfect ending to a wonderful weekend in SF.
author: Michele S.

description: Absolutely delicious lobster bisque.  The bacon wrapped scallops were to die for...  Steak....yummy.  After 7 days in San Fran I can honestly say this has been my best meal all week.
author: Mary S.

description:
Really enjoyed this place on a Sunday night with co-workers, traveling in for a conference...we did a lot of small plates because it was late and it is a helluva trip from NC to San Fran.

Portabello fries ROCK!  Bowl of Bacon (sounds weird but I get it now) is a must have.  Mini chicken pot pies, great idea with potential but the sauce was kind of cold and gloppy.  Mac`n` cheese, really, really awesome and decadent. Deviled eggs, good but nothing to write home about. Sausage bread - oh yeah - everyone loved it!  Service was good and so was the wine...

Loved the location of this (and several other small restaurants) tucked away in a little alley near the Financial District and Chinatown. Would come back here again for sure...
author: Sally H.

description:
The food is tasty, it's just not worth it. "American new" these days is a sign to me that a restaurant his just given up, and this place exemplifies the phenomenon. The predominant impression I got from dinner was 'cream,' and I'm sure that most of my meal--especially by calories--was just that.

Needs more sauce....
author: Chris J.

description: Well, the service was slow. We had to wait forever between ordering our apps and the actual meal. The ginger beer was a little too sweet, the tots and mini pot pies were awesome, the salmon was overwhelming with horse radish... I had to send it back. I ordered the chicken and it was the saltiest dish I've ever had. Almost inedible. The bread was amazing.
author: Jaymee S.

description:
Comfort food + great service = 4 stars. While I wasn't blown away by my meal at Sauce, I had a great time, and my dinner companions loved the food too. We shared everything, and got mini pot pies (so cute), corn and tomato salad (ok, and I love corn), butterfish (tasty), fried chicken (ok), lobster roll (didn't try cause I live in boston), veggie strudel (nice, but rich), and Mac and cheese (ok). 

The coolest part of the meal was the pb&j cake we had for dessert. With an ice cream center!

Service was fast, responsive and helpful, making the experience better than expected.
author: Parul L.

description: I go here at least once a week if not more. One of the Best burgers in the city and they'll even make it at night if you ask since it's only on the lunch menu. Lobster sandwich is bomb as well as the beef stroganoff.
author: Ben S.

description: This is a wonderful place!! Stumbled upon this place two years ago, glad it's still going well!!! Great food and service!!! Great atmosphere!!! Love the food, seasoned very well!!!
author: Lia P.

description: I love this place! The food is amazing every single time I come here. The portions are perfect, the staff is super nice, and the place it self is really cute. I came here with a group of friends during lunch time so it was pretty crowded but we had a reservation so we didn't have any issues waiting to be seated. It is a little on the pricey side compared to other places around but I would say it is worth it!
author: Karen C.

description:
Dined here on valentine's day with another couple. We were presented a prix fixe menu, for $60, with a a few optional upgrades, for an additional cost, such as foie gras for an additional $10. There was also a vegetarian prix fixe. I had looked at the website earlier, and was looking to order some of the menu items that were well reviewed, so I was disappointed with this menu.

Our dinner started around 9:30pm and we had very long gaps between courses. After 10pm, a couple was seated next to us, and proceeded to have their entire meal, of three courses including dessert, prior to us being served our main course. That's one reason why we noticed they were not being served the prix fixe menu, they apparently were allowed to order off of the regular menu. This increased our disappointment because they were served a couple of the dishes I wanted to order originally. We did in the end actually order an additional dessert to share at our table.

The total bill was too high for the overall quantity and quality of the food. Our neighbor table's salmon for $22.50 looked like a substantial dinner entree. On the other hand, every one of our four courses in the prix fixe appeared to be miniaturized. One good point was the 500ml carafe of wine served at a fairly reasonable price. Unlikely to return unless I call and verify there is no mandatory prix fixe.
author: Eric L.

description:
Very expensive burger, fries, salad and Mac and cheese for lunch in the financial district.  For that price, I'd go somewhere else next time.
Belden place (e.g. The alley) has a nice atmosphere.
author: Sunny S.

description: A tiny little chill spot in the financial district. It wasn't very crowded when I tried it for the first time. Service was great and this restaurant closes late! If you are looking for a place for good steak, ribs, and late night wine this is the place to go!
author: Camille N.

description: Delicious. It's almost become my go to lunch place when I need to take people out. I love the outdoor seating along Belden Place - feels very European. Service has always been fantastic. The food. The food is amazing. Start with the Portobello Mushroom fries, get the Tater Tots, and the mini Chicken Pot Pies. Then if you have any room left, order the burger. The burger, oh my, so delicious! My one complaint is they recently stopped serving fries with the burger and now do their version of dorritos. Burgers and fries go together, burger and chips - not so much.
author: jason m.

description: I'm vegan and there weren't many/any of vegan options, though they did what they could to accommodate me. The service was also quite slow. I think it took upward of 25+ minutes just to get a server to stop by our table.
author: Aryn Y.

description: Delicious food, friendly waiters and great atmosphere.   We stumbled upon this place by accident and I'm so glad we did.  I will definitely be back.
author: Tracy h.

description:
Impeccable service. My boyfriend really loves their mushroom fries, so he took me here to try them. They were decent, but nothing beats fries potatoes for me. 

The food had good flavor, but portions were skimpy, and plates were somewhat pricey. 

I had a couple good martinis, and I would be back, but I would order something else and share it next time. 

I suggest this place if you are in the area and want to try a fresh twist on cuisine and want to be in a lively, friendly, trendy environment.
author: Alanna R.

description:
Man, I wish the presentation was better or had a little bit more something to it. But still, its ok. Located in Belden Place, my girlfriend and I went in because I was starving and a I needed a drink. The outdoor seating I love and the service is very good. 
Our waiter, I think his name was Derrick, is terrific with his timing and friendliness.
The Poutine Skins were great. Drenched in gravy , mozzarella, and herbs, it was perfect, The presentation wasn't that great though. 
The burger is double pattied. Very big! I had to take one slab out because it was too much. Very good medium rare served with a side salad and fries, wow that was enough.
The Pinot Noir served was a perfect pairing. 
Will be back again. Just make the presentation better and the food a litttttttle bit more with care.
author: Jacqueline L.

description:
It's a restaurant in an alley in SF. It has some of that SF feeling about it, while at the same time I wasn't able to escape that "tourist trap" feeling as well. The people out front are fairly aggressive in trying to get you to sit down and pick up a menu, but that goes for all of the places in Belden alley.

On the food side, it was actually pretty good, but also fairly expensive. The food was good sized and they had an interesting menu and good drinks. The mini meatloaf, the minipot pies and the steak were all pretty good. The only thing they got me was the price, it's a tad too much for what it is and where it's at, but I guess that's the price for being in SF.

If you're in Belden alley, of all the places there this one is probably the best of them. At least IMHO :)
author: Erik B.

description:
Went to sauce for the second time last night, and my fandom is definitely growing with each trip! I went with two friends so we decided to get a bunch of dishes and share.

We got: the Bacon wrapped mini meatloaf, roasted cauliflower salad, Maine lobster bisque, a grilled pork chop, and a braised beef short rib Wellington. In short, the three of us wouldn't shut-up with each bite exclaiming how fantastic everything was, with the exception of the cauliflower salad (it was definitely good, but not as fantastic as everything else).

I could go on and on about each of these dishes, but in the interest of time I'll give the short version :)

Highlights:
- The bacon wrapped meat loaf was perfectly cooked and beautifully seasoned - the meat loaf was out of this world. It comes with mashed potatoes, which were good but nothing to write home about. 

- The lobster bisque was perfect! The consistency was perfect, it was beautifully creamy and lobstery. It comes with a nicely sized and beautifully cooked piece of lobster on top.

- The pork chop was amazing - cooked perfectly - so well that it would be easy to cut with a bread knife. The flavors were fantastic: at first you get the beautiful cherry and wine flavors of the sauce then a slight smokiness from the meat, then a tinny bite on the backend of the flavor profile of chili pepper. The sides are candied sweet potatoes, which we all practically were fighting over, and broccoli.

- The Wellington...oh the Wellington! I'm going to leave this guy a secret for you to figure out....(I promise it's phenomenal)
author: Vincent B.

description: Very good food but inattentive and indifferent service.  The patio looked lovely but only for those who made a reservation.  Same for good service I guess.
author: George I.

description: Good but meh.  The food was okay and I don't have specific criticisms but I don't think I'd go out of my way to go there.  It was good though.
author: Danielle B.

description:
This restaurant was wonderful! You wouldn't expect to find such a gem in an alley, but there it is! Don't be fooled by the outside...the food is terrific. We four adults and two kids tried the chicken parm...best I've ever had..my daughter had the short ribs Wellington. The meat was tender and super flavorful..the sauce made it even better. 
The men just tried hamburgers..which were also great! Homemade sesame rolls and super crispy hot fries.
Then we topped it off with the cronuts and sauce..yummy!
Aaron was a great server..friendly and efficient!
All and all, so worth taking a step off the beaten path to Belden alley!
author: Mary H.

description:
I think I liked it a little more than the rest of the family.  Most of the comments were that the flavor could use a little more umph.  I liked the variety and ended up ordering one of every appetizer for the table.  

Not sure we will be going back, as it isn't near my work and there are so many other SF restaurants to try.  Would be a cool place for a HH after work if it were closer.
author: Jeff N.

description:
Love this place...and Michael H :)
Everything on the menu is amazing, especially the Fried Chicken. Since I lived down the street I made this my home away from home, never having a bad meal!
author: Liz H.

description:
My experience with Sauce was great. I had a really great waiter. I let him know I was in a hurry and he made sure my boyfriend and I got our food quickly. 

I had the "tomato bisque." It came with white truffle grilled cheese toast sticks. Heavy dinner but really delicious. 

My boyfriend had the "chicken parmesan." It was also great. The chicken was tender and juicy. The asparagus was cooked perfectly and the side of pasta was just enough to make the plate complete.

I was a little worried about sitting outside on a cold day but the outdoor heaters work great and I wasn't cold at all. (Even with my jacket off.)

Overall a great dining experience. I would highly recommend having the tomato bisque. Can't wait to go back to try something else.
author: Joyce H.

description: Food was okay. Not bad but not good either. It did not excite me. I would not take the initiative to go back there again and rather try out new places. Had the chicken pies, portobello fries which were not very crispy, brussels sprouts salad and hangar steak.
author: Zici L.

description:
I like their location. Nice place to go out for a date or sneak out after working in the city.

The soup I ordered was the lobster bisque... Salty, I swear. When the waitress asked how was it, I was just being honest to tell the truth that it was salty according to my taste. She offered though if I wanted to try something else, but I refused. Maybe when we went here, I don't have any appetite. The appetizer though was really good. It was the first time I had a deep fried mushroom fries, very tasty.

Next time I'll come here hungry so I'll appreciate the taste of their food. Or maybe I'll try something else.
author: Jem G.

description: Atmosphere, staff, and the good was top notch. We sat at the bat and received incredible, personal service. Enjoyed seafood chowder...BESt chowder I have ever had...with crispy clams on top! Try before you buy wine selections. Pinot was amazing. For dessert, PB&J and mini doughnuts. Bomb dignity! Highly recommended.
author: Susan N.

description: Nice location in Belden alley. Feel a little bad giving it 3 stars because our server was super nice. I got the fried chicken and it was honestly a little bland. It came with some kinda corn deal that I really dug, but the chicken itself and the mashed potatoes just didn't taste like all that much. There was a gravy on the chicken which was good, but the chicken alone had very little taste, which is weird considering it was fried. The mashed potatoes were just alright.
author: Russ F.

description: A bit pricy but I like the outdoor seating that they have. The food is good. I especially like the grilled cheese that comes with the Tomato Bisque soup. They use focaccia bread which makes it very fluffy. Fried portabella mushrooms is ok. the Bacon wrapped meatloaf and tots are very flavorful. Server was wonderful. Food cam out quick and hot.
author: Angelina N.

description: This is my favorite restaurant on Belden Place, I find the others too touristy.  This one is casual chic and has a nice vibe. I was there at happy hour and tried a few of their beers and appetizers. The chicken slides and portobello fries were good. The meatball wrapped in bacon with mashed potatoes was meh. The PBJ for dessert was unique and excellent.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Lovely little place with really great food and great service.
We ordered the social plate sampler which came with bacon, lobster Rangoon, portobello fries and deviled eggs and then ordered Mac and cheese and a lobster roll.
First off the lobster roll was absolutely delicious! The roll was toasted with butter just perfectly. The lobster was fresh and it was as good as the ones I've had in Maine. The roll came with some tortilla chips, dip and a salad. The salad was very good; the chips were meh. I wouldn't have paired salty spicy chips with a lobster roll. The bacon was unbelievably good, possibly the best I've ever tasted. They add honey and pepper to theirs while grilling it. Delicious!
The service was really great. They have a variety of alcohol and a separate menu for single malt if you're into that sort of thing.
Cocktails and drinks were all good. It's the food that really stood out and that's saying something.
The staff at the place were very nice. We hung out way past 1 AM without realizing it and they never tried to hurry us. We left at about 1:30 AM!
author: Archana M.

description:
We tried this on a Sunday evening, while looking for a place in the Financial District which is low key - not easy in this town.  A good find.  

Salads, sliders, burgers, mini chicken pot pies - all quite good.  Full bar.  Decent wine.  Professional service.  A nice option and a good spot to visit on a Sunday night.  Fun way to wrap up a weekend or visit when you've just arrived in town from afar and looking for a welcoming spot for dinner.
author: William T.

description:
I loved this place!  There were 3 in our party and we wanted a quiet, intimate meal.  We sure got it.  Happiest waiter I have ever met-attentive and helpful and yet not annoying.  

The bowl of bacon was on the sweet side but a great appetizer. Two of us had the chicken parm and it was the best ever.  I had the chili and salad, also just spot on.  We also had dessert-flour less chocolate cake and the PBJ sponge cake.  

Everything was good, would absolutely return!
author: Leigh B.

description: I love the location and the ambiance. The food and service were decent. My boyfriend got the steak and loved it. My New England seafood chowder was just alright, so maybe I just chose the wrong entree.  The ham hock tater tots and portobello mushroom fries were pretty delicious, though, and I definitely recommend them
author: Daphne W.

description:
We chose to have dinner here tonight based on a recent re-air of KQED's "Check Please"..... 
OMG!!!! Sooo good!!!!! Nicole, our wait person was fabulous!!!, We will definitely come here again. Really enjoy Hayes Valley... The great coffee and food locations!!!!
author: RICHARD W.

description: Was just here last week from out of town.  The place was just what we wanted.  Smaller plates with the perfect amount of food to satisfy our appetites.  The mini chicken pot pies were a favorite of ours. Perfect bite size pieces that gave us a reminder of a  homemade thanksgiving dinner.  I went with a main course of the Maine Lobster roll, which was an excellent choice the Dijon aioli was especially tasty.  My girlfriend went with the chicken parm which was fried perfectly and had a delicious red tomato sauce.  I also highly recommend the Hibiscus El Diablo, it had the perfect amount of "pop" to make it a very savory drink.
author: Carl H.

description:
Went to sauce for lunch and was very pleased.  The Portobello Mushroom Fries were awesome.  The deviled eggs and bacon were good as well.  The roast beef sandwich was a bit of a let down after the social plates.  

The 209 Groni was spot on as well.
author: Dylan G.

description: Had an early dinner on a Friday night with the husband and kid. We orders the following dishes: mac n cheese, "happy hour" roast beef slider with a Moscow mule for $10, garden salad and the pot pies. The Mac n cheese was absolutely delicious! Probably some of the best I have ever had. The rest of the items were ok. We sat outside under the heat lamps and enjoyed the ambiance. Staff was overall friendly.
author: Gabby D.

description: Wow what a great place... If you don't mind the noisy frat house vibe, you will be fine. I had the pot pies, meat loaf and the chili... all amazing. I also had several cocktails, mixology is nice!
author: Aman S.

description:
3 1/2 stars. I like their outdoor seating

I ordered a butterfish sandwich, but I got the grilled butterfish by itself intead. It was cooked perfectly and tastey.

The hanger steak looked good and they give you alot. 

Food is good, but nothing wow.
author: Karen H.

description:
Cute little place in Belden Lane.. not too pretentious yet modern enough for a business lunch or casual date. I've been here for lunch a few times and there is never a wait - which is seldom in SF these days, especially if the restaurant serves good food.

My colleagues and I always order the portebello mushroom fries. There's something about the crispy fried batter outer layer paired with the inner thick cut juicy mushroom that makes it oh-so decadent. And with just a few pieces to share, it's the perfect portion.

Last time I tried the fried chicken w/ mashed potatoes plate which wasn't anything to run home about. Today I had the grilled chicken sandwich which comes with a side of fries and salad and I devoured it! A grilled chicken sandwich can be bland sometimes, but Sauce's melted cheese and grilled onions paired so well with the grilled chicken.
author: Nancie T.

description:
This one came my way via a happy hour with co-workers that started at 2:30pm.

Go ahead and take this entire review with a grain of salt or a shot of whiskey. Guess which one I took before I wrote it. 

Sauce is right in the middle of Belden Alley, where some of the best restaurants in FiDi reside, so why wasn't I impressed? The drink menu is restricted, the appetizers try to impress (the onion rings were spot-on, the chicken was boring), but truth be told, I couldn't help feeling like we could have done better.

If you're looking for an early happy hour, this is your spot if you're not picky with drink selection. That said, with all the other options available to you in the same block, you could do better.
author: Kevin B.

description: Cheeseburger here tastes like a big mac. The app share platter with a bowl of bacon, bacon topped deviled egg, mushroom fries, and mini pot pies were cray cray dericious. Nom nom nom
author: Pickle R.

description: Talk about service... Timing was continuously bad. The waitress took forever to come greet us. And when she did we were in the middle of our toast when she asked if we were ready to order... Rude! Our appetizers took a while to come, but the food was pretty good. A little pricey for the portions but worth a try. Won't be back anytime soon.
author: Justin B.

description: We got the macaroni, tater tots, and pb&j dessert. Everything was good. Needed to ask for salt, but a good place to get small bites.
author: Heather B.

description:
I'm a big fan of the Moscow mule, and while theirs were tasty they seemed a tad watered down for my taste. They serve them in a copper cup, and for that, I love them. 

We had a little bit of every appetizer, and my favorite was the fried portobello mushrooms. The deviled eggs and bowl of bacon were also tasty. I was looking forward to the mini chicken pot-pies, but without the gravy inside the shell (you pour it on top) it was a little lacking for me. 

I also had the hanger steak and it was DELICIOUS. Highly recommend!!!

Lobster bisque was too creamy for me, not enough lobster taste - but that's probably because I'm a New-England snob about lobster. 

Overall it was a fun experience, great ambiance, awesome wait staff, I'd go again with friends.
author: Krista R.

description:
Been here before to the restaurant on gough, today we went to the one on beldon.

Lobster roll was over salted and the lobster wasn't super fresh.
Beet salad was good but didn't blow my mind.
Solid Mac and cheese, but nothing to write home about.

Overall it was $100 for two people and we only purchased one entree, sort of expensive....
author: Nicole S.

description: Delicious!!!! It was 11pm, we were starving.., the barman in Marriott hotel offered this place. We were greeted the second we walked in, the food was spectacular!!! Carpaccio- AMAZING! ( we ordered 4!) Heritage salad, Veggie strudel, Salmon with mash potatoes and I'm still here waiting for the dessert so peace and come here as soon as you can. By the way the music is awesome!!!!!!! Didn't give 5 stars cause nothing is perfect..:)
author: Bar B.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for dinner during dine about town. I love the location and atmosphere of this place. It was a little cramped and loud, but it's in such a cute little alleyway with cool city views! This is what we ate- 

Starters:
Clam chowder - kinda cold, but full of big chunks of clam. I would skip it next time.
Mushroom fries- delicious! I could have eaten a whole plate!

Dinner- 
Chicken parm- my boyfriend said it's the best chicken parm he's ever had, and chicken parm is his favorite food...
Braised beef short rib Wellington- melt in your mouth good. The gravy sauce was incredible!

Dessert- 
S'mores and peanut butter ice cream- perfect portion after a big dinner. I wanted to lick the plate clean but exercised control.

Definitely recommend! Thanks Sauce!
author: Heather S.

description: Their wild boar chili is incredible! It was on the cold side today, and the warmth of that dish just hit the spot. This is a high recommendation.
author: Adam F.

description: Fantastic food. Great service. We really enjoyed the food here and the chef and Owner Ben comes out to speak with the customers, a lost art in the city. In NYC everyone does it. In SF it's rare. Ben is a magician in the kitchen.
author: Boris P.

description:
Had the ham hock tater tots, brussels sprouts salad, and donuts with vanilla sauce. Everything was tasty but nothing to write home about. The wait staff was very friendly.

I do recommend sitting outside if possible. The patio is heated for chilly evenings
author: Sarah S.

description:
The food is excellent - the kind that leaves you saying, "I'm going to learn how to cook so I can eat like this every day."

That said, the service was inexcusably slow. The restaurant was busy but not even remotely hectic, yet every single little thing took ages. First we had to wait for a table, which was fine. Then we waited 20 minutes for water. And then another 15 minutes to order (which was totally unnecessary since we'd already decided what we wanted while waiting to be seated.) My friend and I ran out of water, waited 10+ minutes and finally asked for more. (We also had to ask for our second refills, which made me feel like the waiter/staff was oblivious to what was going on at my table.) The wait for food was substantial - I'm really glad I snuck in a snack earlier or it would have been unbearable. But the delicious food was worth every second of waiting. When it came time to figure out the time, I felt torn: I'd just enjoyed one of the tastiest meals I'd come across all year, but I felt  overlooked by the staff and resistant to leaving a stellar tip. 

To be honest, I don't give a hoot if I get ho-hum service again. I will definitely be going back because the food is THAT good. 

My friend and I had:
* Portobello mushroom fries (I didn't want to tell my friend but I despise mushrooms... Even still, I had no problem eating most of my portion bc they're darn good.)
* Lobster bisque 
* Vegetarian strudel with tomato bisque (BLEW MY MIND. Best chilly evening dinner ever.)
author: Christine K.

description: This place was amazing. After getting in from a late flight we wanted some food and ventured to sauce. We had fried chicken sliders that came with the most delicious sauce. It was a little bit of spice and oh so good. Then we had short rib stroganoff... This was to die for. The cream sauce was perfect and there were large pieces of short rib that just feel apart when you touched them... So tender. I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Tish R.

description: Really liked this place! Visited on a Monday evening, right after work, and it ended up being one of the only places I have tried in the city that wasn't completely crowded. Their main menu is drinks, so be prepared for that. Their secondary menu is food. I had the bacon wrapped meatballs with mashed potatoes, so good! Also, Mondays are Margarita special, $7. Service was friendly, too. Can't wait to try it again.
author: Tiffany M.

description: It's like upscale comfort food. Had the ham hock tater tots (I would have liked more texture), Texas wild boar chili with bread that was made to order (soooo good!), And the meatloaf entree. I planned on having left over but it was so good I just could not stop eating! Also the house spiced dark and stormy cocktail is so smooth! It goes down like soda.
author: Lauren L.

description:
The Dish: I ordered the Maine Lobster Roll, along with both of my friends. The lobster was pretty good, but overall, I didn't think it was that special. The sauce was very delicious, but it wasn't worth the price. When you pay $35 for dinner, you're holding your dinner to a higher standard. Or at least, somewhat of a higher standard. Sauce didn't quite meet it. For a lower price, I'm sure I would have thought the dish worthy. 

Ambiance: We chose to sit outside and they had heater lamps so that was nice. Great service and great overall setting of the place. Belden Alley in general is nice - you can browse through the menus of all the restaurants and choose one!
author: Gina T.

description:
I went to Sauce for the first time last night for a friend's 30th birthday celebration. It was a large group and a few platters of appetizers came out which were a delight. 

We had: the Portobella mushroom fries (really amazing), deviled eggs, chicken pot pie, ahi sliders and fries. They were all awesome choices. (If I was ordering again, I would have skipped the chicken pot pie, it wasn't in the same league as the other items imo)

The Chef knew the birthday girl and came out to say hello, and to present her with an amazing desert, maple donut carmel deliciousness with fresh blueberries and whipped cream. This was a perfect dessert to share with so many people. Additionally, our waitress was friendly, prompt and great with a large group. 

I will be back to try the dinner menu, or for a happy hour during the week on a hot summer day. Belden lane is such a cute little street. It makes me miss the days where I lunched there often because of the geographic location of my office. 

Five stars for a great all around experience.
author: Danielle V.

description: love the meatballs and mashed potato starters. Tasty food.
author: Joe F.

description: Sirloin steak, fried chicken, and short rib strogranoff are all must haves. We got the social plate sampler too, which came a decent amount of food to feed 5 of us. The entree portions themselves aren't huge, but the quality is very good and is filling. Great atmosphere as well.
author: Chris H.

description:
