On separate occasions, I've tried their Braised Boneless Beef Short Ribs, Fried Rosie's Organic Chicken, and the Hanger Steak. Initially, I didn't have any expectations for this place (as I had a bit of a bias towards the others older restaurants in Belden Lane) so I was impressed with all the dishes. I thought they were all really flavorful and the proportions are large.

The Short Ribs were tender, the Fried Chicken was juicy, and the Hanger Steak was really well seasoned. All the sides that accompanied the entrees were also delicious on their own. On all occasions my plate was clean.

I also tried their fresh Cinnamon Sugar Doughnuts; light and fluffy and the vanilla bourbon dipping sauce was a good compliment.

Overall thoughts : Impressed. Will return again to try the other dishes.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Came here for a work lunch. I ordered the burger and replaced the tortillas for fries ($2 extra).

Food was delicious. Burger was cooked correctly. Also came w a side of salad. Only 4 stars because I requested to sit outside and the table was slanted down so the whole time it felt like my plate was going to slip down.
author: R W.

description:
Sauce on the whole is just average; there is nothing stand out about this restaurant or compelling enough to make me want to come back for more. I enjoyed the truffle fries, however I found my main course (the salmon) extremely underwhelming. Not only was my salmon frozen, thawed, and then overcooked, it was served on a bed of overdressed greens with bacon chunks. I have no idea who thought this would be a tasty meal but it was a complete miss. Everyone else's meal looked quite appetizing, though. I tried some mac & cheese, tomato bisque, and deep fried cheese balls and found these items pretty decent.

I didn't really like how my table and chair were slanted; I felt like I was falling out of my seat the whole time. I also didn't care for the dirty plates and silverware, not sure why restaurants can't seem to get that down. 

Next.
author: Tommy C.

description: Amazing place to eat.  Great small, sharable plates and drinks. Loved it!
author: Mindy '.

description: Stopped in here for an early dinner. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. The bar area had a small crowd gathered in the middle for happy hour which the adjacent restaurants did not. This was one of the main reasons I chose this place. I sat outside and ordered the kobi steak entree and strawberries for desert. Steak was cooked perfect, had great texture, but the sauce was lacking any flavor. I don't like steak sauce to over power the flavor of a good steak but the sauce was bland. The spinach was decent and the fries were different but good. Server was great and very polite. The strawberry desert was presented very nice and was very delicious.
author: Sean H.

description:
We were looking for a last minute reservation for a group of 10 on a Sat close to BART and with plenty of parking so Belden Place was what came to mind.  Since I've been to Sauce on Gough and liked it, we decided to give this a shot.  The food here was a hit or miss based on what I ordered or sampled from someone else. 

1.  Portabella fries - one I liked before and one I still like
2.  Ipswich clams - was expected whole clams but instead got battered clam strips so didn't really matter if they were Ipswich or regular clams
3.  Poutine - not quite like the poutine in Canada since it's impossible to have fresh cheese curds but it's hard to go wrong with gravy and cheese over fries
4.  Brussell sprout salad - surprisingly I really liked this as it was sweet and savory
5.  Tomato bisque - very thick and rich so perfect for sharing - might be a bit much for 1 person.  Someone commented that it was reminiscent of vodka pasta sauce but hey, I like vodka sauce.
6.  Mini chicken pot pies - personally didn't try this one but am commenting on the size - 4 that were shu mai sized 
7.  Lobster bisque - disappointed that it wasn't as thick as the tomato bisque and was way to briny for our taste with a small piece of lobster so definitely not worth the $14.  Go for the lobster roll instead if you're in the mood for lobster.  
8.  PB&J - can't quite explain it - didn't hate it but didn't love it either
9.  Flourless chocolate cake - Nice ending to the meal - just wish we weren't so full
author: Joyce Z.

description: A solid place to grab a quick dinner with friends, especially if you're already in the city. The little alleyway reminded me of Little Italy in NYC. The food was pretty good (ordered the zucchini fries and salmon), and service wasn't bad... but I probably wouldn't return as there was nothing standout about the meal. Food came out super quick, so we were in and out within an hour.
author: Diana K.

description: Yes! It took me far too long to visit this location. I'm already a fan of the Gough location. The fried chicken was delicate and well prepared, very moist inside and crispy outside. Maybe too much kale, but that's not a bad thing. The 1/2 lobster was also very well served, cooked perfectly, coming from New England, I'm rather critical about my lobster. The beef carpaccio was thin, tender and well accompanied, but personally I prefer a bit more salt. Way over due to get here, but surely next visit will be sooner. Oh, the ginger Cosmo, is all that!
author: Carl P.

description: Had the braised beef stroganoff which was great. My friend loved his burger, and my other friend said the vegie strudel was good. The Moscow Mule came in a copper mug which was #winning. We also loved the wood tables. I would eat here again.
author: Nick P.

description: Sauce was absolutely delicious for both me (a vegetarian) and my carnivore husband.  It was perfect for our last night in the city, and the outdoor seating was lovely.  We ordered the mushroom fries, sirloin steak, and vegetarian strudel.  We also got a couple of great beers and wine.  We will definitely return next time we are in San Francisco!
author: Laura R.

description:
nice place in a alley with several other restaurant/ bars.

Food was good. beef shortribs, appetizer platter and that was good enough.

Wine was good.
author: g s.

description: Wednesday night about 10pm, not much open in the financial district and needed to eat. Found Sauce - their kitchen closes at 1am. Had the mushroom fries, ham hock tots a cheese plate and the lobster bisque - all were quite good. Topped off with a couple of cocktails which were well prepared. I would like to go back and try earlier in the evening. Deserts were well done too - chocolate bites were supper chocolaty, donuts were pillowy. Well done.
author: Colin C.

description:
I've tried a bit of everything and my favorites are:

- Portobello mushroom fries
- Fried chicken
- PB&J (if with a big group, get the sampler)

Excellent attentive staff, great food and great drinks. I've eaten at the one on Gough and the food and staff are equally as good, but I prefer the location and ambiance of the Beldin Place. It's like a taste of America in Europe.
author: Tiny K.

description:
Tasty! I went here with a group of coworkers after a long day. A long set of tables had been held for us. The folks sitting near me shared the mini chicken pot pies, the bacon-wrapped mini meatloaves, and the sausage bread. All of them were awesome, but I think I liked the sausage bread and meatloaf the most. 
I also had the brussels sprouts salad, added chicken, which was tasty, and contained "bacon candy" which added a sweet crunch. For drinks, I had the barrel-aged root herb Manhattan, which was good but not great, and a drunk grandma or something like that, which had ginger, mint, and whiskey, and was very tasty. The mini doughnuts dipped in caramel sauce was dessert, and they were very addictive. I ate more than I needed to. Definitely a good place, and worth returning to.
author: Adam C.

description:
Light sauce.

Hayes Valley location dinner was great (http://goo.gl/Cg2p4). Belden Lane location lunch was just A-OK.

To be fair dinner at the new space downtown might be as good as the original location. I went for lunch.

Homemade veggie burger drew me in and left me satisfied. Crunchy exterior. Full of flavor.

Would rave had it been ten bucks. Fourteen was high even with a small side salad.

Warm service and outdoor seating for warm days earns them the third star.
author: Jason B.

description: One of my favorite places, especially for their happy hour meal deal! You can only get their sliders during happy hour(they're not on the regular menu).
author: Sasha N.

description:
This replaced Trademark which replaced Voda (a vodka bar, way back in the day).

We had the portobella mushrooms fries and horseradish shrimp for appetizers, then DH had the bacon and eggs (deviled eggs) and grilled butterfish and I had what seemed like to be the endless bowl of tomato bisque.  As daunting and deep as the bowl seemed, I couldn't believe I finished the whole thing!  It was so good, this is definitely a dish I'd like to have on those cold SF nights.  So good and comforting.

We hope to be back soon.
author: Jacki C.

description: Having arrived late at sfo and my hotel (11pm) I went in search of a warm uInviting friendly place that was open and still served food on a Tuesday night. Sauce in Belden alley was the answer to my hopes. The service was superb, the atmosphere warm and the food was absolutely excellent. I had the wild boar chili, just spicy enough to have a kick but not searing, plenty of beans and meat and I had the vegetarian strudel which was made to perfection. The dessert, a flourless platter of chocolate squares was done just right. Sooo for that late night or after theater (they serve til 1am) give them a try. And many thanks to my servers who also made it so special
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
My husband and I and two friends dined at Sauce for the first time. I wanted to love everything, but it didn't work out that way. Sadly, they were short staffed. Our server was very pleasant but because he had so many tables to cover, it was hard for him to bring out the orders in a timely manner. Even asking for salt and pepper took an unusually long time. Which brings me to my next comment. Pros: Mac and cheese was delicious. Tomato soup was fresh and delicious. Mojito was tasty. Wontons were crispy and tasty. Wedge salad was yummy and creatively presented. Cons: Chicken pot pies came out cold, so are they prepared in advance or were they frozen? I had to return them to be heated up. And they were my least favorite. They had a consistency of mashed up dark meat instead of a creamy texture as is typical of pot pies. They lacked seasoning, thus the salt and pepper request. Steak was undercooked and lacked seasoning. We asked for medium rare , not rare. Lobster roll had very little lobster. 

We did not order dessert. Next time, I hope to have more consistency in food seasoning and that the staff show up to their assigned shifts. Our waiter didn't deserve to be short handed.
author: ibby m.

description: I've gone to Sauce for a holiday meal on a couple of occasions and ordered their pre-fix and wine pairing each time, and each time I've been wowed. I am extremely pleased with their different creations, and will definitely be making another return visit for a holiday pre-fix.
author: Michael A.

description: Came here for lunch during the week and our party of 6 was say right away! The service was good--even though our server seemed to have a lot of tables. I loved everything I ordered! We started with the wontons which were delicious and I had the salmon as my entree. At first, when I saw the burger, I was a little jealous I didn't order that instead. But, once I tried my salmon I was completely satisfied with my order--it has bacon so of course I was won over! The burger was pretty big--two patties!-- so come hungry. :) My favorite part was you can order a home made cookie to go with your check!
author: Megan M.

description: Was looking for a late-night place to grab a snack over the holiday weekend. This was the only place we could find open within a mile of the Embarcadero. We were pleasantly surprised. The ambiance is great. It's a cute place tucked into an alley street. The food was very good and the service was great too. Prices were reasonable. I'd definitely go back when in SF again and looking for some tasty late-night grub.
author: Lisa M.

description: Came back here and sat inside, mistake. Atmosphere outside is way better. Also, I tried the "famous" mushroom fries....I don't really get it. I think the only reason to come here is the servers are nice, the food is fine, but really the atmosphere outside in the cobblestone lane is great. If you do come here, don't waste your time inside.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Incredible food. The lobster bisque comes with a huge piece of lobster. Also, cheese plate was fantastic. The short ribs were fall apart tender. Highly recommended!
author: Rachael R.

description: What a fantastic experience at this restaurant!  We were a party of 18 and were managed expertly by our server Nicole.  She was immeasurably helpful and ebullient serving us.  We must have had all of the appetizers and all were tremendously prepared and presented.  I had the lobster roll and was thrilled with the quality and flavor.  Sauce is worth every penny!
author: Robert W.

description:
Great service and even better food!  The Mac N Cheese is the best I've ever had and that is saying something because i am  a Mac N Cheese connoisseur.
This is a must go restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Cora H.

description:
I've been here twice, and love everything about this place. Great late night (or daytime) place for a really amazing and unique cocktail and some not your run-of-the-mill pub food. 

The restaurant was started by 3 brothers and their best friend, Ben, who was super nice.

The cocktails are some of the best I've had in San Francisco, more expensive than at a divey place, but well worth it, and STRONG. They have a signature cocktail which features pre-prohibition era root spirts. Also a very solid cosmopolitan. and I hella liked their American Sidecar.

The food is very creative, I was really impressed with their originality. There are so many pubs in SF that just feature potato skins, fried things, nachos, the same boring stuff. These guys changed it up with hella delicious bacon-wrapped mini-meatloafs, best crab rangoons ever, but nailed the classic brownie sundae dessert. 

And the kicker is, the kitchen and bar are open until 1:00am every day.

Best spot I've found on Belden!
author: Alexander W.

description:
Sassy tasty fresh I liked it

Try the salomon

Happy hour special is great
author: Nina T.

description:
We were looking for something quick after a concert downtown on a Sunday night late and the hotel we were staying at told us to go here it is open until 2am. A little hard to spot if you don't know the area well , it is located in a little alley in the financial district.

They have an outdoor patio and nice ambience. We were tired and hungry and they had just what we needed "comfort" food.

I had mini chicken pot pies and they are seriously mini 4 on a plate and perfect for late night dining. I also ordered a side of mac and cheese which was shared by my friends and piping hot, really cheesy and delicious.
My friends each had soup: one tomato bisque and one clam chowder both were well presented and the chowder had fried clams on top which was a nice touch and the bisque had small bread side.

They do have full bar , we had hot tea they had a good assortment.
Also they have a patio out front although they have glassed it in I wouldn't want to sit there because of the alley feel,they were shutting it down so it closes around midnight (I think).

The waiter and bartender both served us and both were extremely pleasant and service was good.
I would return if I was back in SF looking for something late at night.
author: Karen S.

description: Fairly average food and drink. Above average ambience on Belden; a little alley way that kinda looks European. Would go back for the mini chicken pot pies. Service was fine.
author: Cara O.

description: Awesome comfort food! Open late! Nicole was our server, very friendly and attentive. Had the mini meatloaf, Mac and cheese and Maine lobster roll. Food can be shared to enjoy more on the menu. Lobster roll could have had more lobster.
author: Kathy C.

description: We stopped here for a late night meal. It was great. Fun spot, good food. Of the social plates, I had the meatloaf w/ bacon- delicious. My husband had the chicken pot pie- also delicious.
author: L M.

description: Friday night - We looked at three restaurants next to them and came back here because the hostess said we could get veggie burgers.  After our drinks came we were told 'not so' on Fridays (later someone got a burger at the next table). We ordered fried mushrooms, roasted beet salad -were great.  Then we ordered tomato bisque and strudels and said we will share them. Our waiter split them but found that he charged for four soups - saying they charge by cups.  Food was great but communication was not. Place was a bit noisy but I guess it was a crowded area in the city.
author: David R.

description:
My friend and I are slowly making our way through the Belden Lane restaurants. Tried Sauce today and it was outstanding. The deviled eggs with just a bit of bacon on top and I"m guessing a touch of Cayenne in the filling where fantastic. Can a deviled egg be cooked Al Dente? These eggs were firmer than usual and presented beautifully. 
I had the grilled shrimp which came with green beans, small salad and 3 pieces of polenta. Everything was prepared just right and was delicious. 
My friend had the hanger steak and from what I could tell it was cooked to his order and he threatened to lick the plate. Very good. We're going to go back and try a lunch of "Social Plates" that all sounded appealing.
author: Dennis J.

description:
Spent $42 for 2 people during lunch.
This included an appetizer of Mushroom Fries.  Ohh and are they yummie.  They are like battered, fried mushrooms but sticks and not as greasy.  They use portobella mushrooms too.
I had a Wedge Salad with Point Reyes Blue Cheese.  Don't know where or what Point Reyes is but every time I have that Blue Cheese I'm in heaven. I also had the best Root Beer EVER. and it showed by the price of it ($5).
My friend had the Butterfish Sandwich which came from fries and a small house salad. I didn't taste his food but he said it was delish.
I give this place 4 stars for the yummieness, close proximity to work and friendly and attentive service. It would have been 5 but I'm a cheap ass and thought the Root Beer should have been $3.50 not $5.
author: Grace P.

description: We had a birthday dinner here the past weekend. It was pretty packed with indoor and outdoor seating on a Saturday night. We ordered the sampler appetizer that came with some bacon strips, devil's egg, portabello mushroom fries and some other things on it. For entree, we got the fried chicken, lobster roll, short ribs, salmon dish, and steak. I thought the food was just okay, but the price wasn't too expensive. The portions were okay too and easy parking outside on a Saturday night.
author: Elaine C.

description: Saturday night dinner with the family.  Food and service were excellent.  Shared a bunch of the small plates:  deviled eggs, mac/cheese, garlic bread, scallops.  All were outstanding.  Carafe of wine, local and out of the barrel, was also good.  Desserts were solid.  Will return next time in town.
author: Phil P.

description: While in lobster roll shock, high on roast beef sliders and dreaming in gravy-covered poutine, I was comforted by the truffle cheese bread surfing the edge of the bowl of tomato bisque before I met my match for the night: cinnamon-sugar cronettes with a vanilla bourbon dipping sauce. kill me now. I have nothing left to live for.
author: matt j.

description:
Belden Place is a little gem... and Sauce was the sparkle! ;P yea.. I'm kinda gushing. 
My friend and I sat at the bar, and met the some of the most interesting staff of a restaurant... It was our first time here, and you would think we were regulars.   
Aside from the ambience, the food was pretty awesome! We had the crab ragoons with this bomb sauce* dip, shrimp skewers, and the fried chicken.  We had a  little debate whether their chicken at Sauce was better than the one at Town Hall.. :) Compliments on the very generous servings of white Sauv.
author: Melanie D.

description:
I only come here for the happy hour after work!
They have a pretty good deal: a cocktail and 2 sliders for $10, in the Financial district that's a decent deal!
Happy hour is everyday till 7:30 pm so you have plenty of time , and they change the cocktail and the sliders daily.
Of course it's not very filling, i always end up getting 2 of the happy hour deal, 2 drinks and 4 sliders for $20!Love the chicago beef sliders and the crab cake sliders!!These are my favorites!

The only negative thing is the service, it's kind of slow, and the hostess and the servers always seem to be confused for some reason!
author: Catherine K.

description: The food was fine, but only if you are really hungry and can't get reservations anywhere else. It's akin to something as horrifyingly generic as the Cheesecake Factory, only with smaller and more overpriced portions. Again, it's perfectly edible but just not worth going to unless you're nearby and desperate (which was us this time). Really touristy as well, which is not surprising considering the location. We literally saw no fewer than five backpack-toting families come in during the dinner hour. Service was really good though!
author: Audrey G.

description:
Wow, where do I start. Our hotel concierge recommended this place. Got there around 830 pm and got a seat by the kitchen entrance. My kids and I could barely stand the overwhelming smell of toilet sewage that surrounded us. I'm not a picky sort of person but this was really smelly. We ordered mini meatloaves, tater tots, and mini chicken pot pies. I took one bite of the mini meatloaf and had to spit it out. It tasted like it was old rancid meat. My kids
 wouldn't touch it. Next on to mini chicken pot pies. Dry, hard, and tasted very microwaved. Ate one. Left the rest. Tater tots with ham hock and cheese...how can you go wrong right? Tasted better tots at any fast food joint. Kids wouldn't eat them either. Overall, left feeling ill. Seriously, go somewhere else to eat. This was nasty.
author: Joe T.

description: Really liked the place.  My best friend and I were visiting SF for the wkend and our hotel was less than a mile from the restaurant.  We ordered apps and drinks, they were all really delicious.  We ordered the bacon wrapped meatloaf, tater tots, and chicken pot pie.  As far as drinks, we had Sidecar and Ginger Cosmo, everything was so delicious.  Between the 2 of us, that was plenty of food and we were stuffed. Our server wasn't that attentive, otherwise I would've given them 5 stars. Definitely recommend!
author: Pammy P.

description:
Shared appetizers for lunch. 

5 stars for Mac & cheese. Was spot on. Nice crusted top w/ panko. Creamy, wet interior. Ham had nice saltiness. I would go back for one of these and a drink any day. 

Bacon-wrapped meatloaf w/ mashed potatoes was tasty due to the natural tastiness and saltiness of ingredients, but not any amazing flavor/seasoning or anything for the meat loaf.  Mashed potatoes were pureed consistency. 

Mini chicken pot pies were underwhelming & tiny. Small plates is fine. There was just nothing special about it. 

"Tater tots" are more like croquettes. They said "ham hock" tater tots, but couldn't discern any ham. And wet/sorta creamy interior like a croquette, rather than a tater tot.. 

I think the cost and size would have been spot on for what I'd expect for a place like this, especially in Belden, but the flavors weren't stand out enough to justify a higher rating, except for the mac and cheese. Considered 4 stars due to the nice European alleyway feel and nice server, but the flavors just didn't hold up to the presentation, price, and size.
author: J M.

description: Took my husband here for the hanger steak, in hopes it would be better than the steak he had at the place we visited the night before. So delighted to say it was amazing and we will definitely be back for sure. We often visit sf and now have another place to look forward to visiting. Thank you for the great food!!
author: Christie M.

description: A nice little spot we stumbled upon in Belden Place while exploring the streets of the Financial District. We had the portobello mushroom fries, mixed heritage greens salad, Rosie's organic fried chicken, braised beef short rib stroganoff, and cinnamon sugar cronuts. The food was good, especially the stroganoff which was excellent. Unfortunately, the service was slow, but it won't deter me from coming back. Definitely give this place a shot.
author: Jeffrey L.

description: This is one of those places where everything sounds good. Everything. The Maine Lobster Roll, bacon wrapped meatloaf bites, Mac and cheese, the deviled eggs...I got the double bacon cheese burger + deviled egg filling. It was amazing!!! Good seasoned fries and a full bar, only down fall is there were many loud know-it-all customers. But it's one of my favorite places in SF.  And don't even try going there Fri-Saturday night, it's packed. And when there is a sports event.
author: Courtney M.

description: I definitely feel this place should have better than 3.5 stars. We stopped in based on a recommendation, but were skeptical due to the yelp reviews. I thought it was fantastic. We were greeted right when we walked in and our waiter was wonderful. We ordered the poutine, portobello mushroom fries, and the Mac n cheese. All superb! I felt like it was a great value for small plates. Definitely a place I'd recommend to friends.
author: Bethany J.

description: We came here for Bastille Day for drinks and they have SMALL cocktail cups.  Other than that, this place is clean and the service was pretty good.  It's the only place I've been in Belden so I'll have to update when I have something to compare to.
author: Chris L.

description:
We had a terrible time at Sauce. My girlfriend is a lifelong vegetarian for religious reasons. She asked if the poutine was vegetarian and the waitress assured us that they could make it that way. However, halfway through the meal, the chef came out and snatched the dish away without any explanation. We finally flagged down a waiter, who had to go into the kitchen and check, and he told us that the kitchen had made it non-vegetarian. I've had a kitchen mess up my order before, but never this badly.

Even factoring out this screw-up, the restaurant wasn't good. The drinks were overpriced ($11 for well cocktails) and the food was mediocre. It seemed primarily patronized by tourists and business travelers who didn't know any better.

There's no way I would ever go back to this place. Just a really, really bad experience.
author: Matthew T.

description: My husband and I loved the food here. We ordered the salmon, fried chicken, and split the mac and cheese. The food really was worth a 5/5 rating. The ambiance is also great. Such a cute little area tucked in a back alley- we loved the lights and how surprisingly quiet it was on Belden. The only downfall of our dinner was the service- our waitress was not very good ( I would have given her 2/5 rating). My husband asked for double veggies instead of the mashed potatoes, and she did not get that right. She also never came back once to ask how our food was our even re-fill our waters. When she brought the check, my husband tried to give his card right away to pay and she could not be bothered... Just put the bill on the table and quickly walked away. It wasn't even that busy last night, but they did seem understaffed. If we would have had a better experience with our service, this would have been a 5/5 for us!
author: Laura N.

description: Not sure why this place gets good ratings. There was literally nothing on the menu that sounds appetizing, and when the food arrived it was even worse, unless you prefer your salad to be conspicuously lacking in anything green. I'm not a big service person, but we had a reservation for big group and they were definitely less than welcoming. We had a bunch of coats (big group), which we laid on the bench for lack of a better place to put them. When they wanted to seat someone at the next table, the waitress gave me the stink eye and said is her best impression of teenage ennui, can you move your coats? When I asked where she shrugged towards a corner, where their were hooks. The reaching of said hooks involved crawling over several stored tables and piles of miscellany. Needless to say, I'll spend our ~$500 somewhere else next time.
author: K B.

description: Wow where should i start, It was my girl friends  birthday dinner .I brought the whole family including are 12 week old dog to Belden alley for its outside seating.A nice waiter stopped to talk to us an answered all are inquiries.Sat down an ordered.About 5 mins later the hostess come out says hi, rubs the dog an leaves. I wish that was the end of her presents, every 2-5 mins she comes out an stands there looking at us like we were going to dash out . I felt real uncomfortable , My girl friend even looked at me an said whats up with this woman watching us while we ate? As she said that , i look over an she was at the bar glaring at us. At the end of are meal , i walk over paid the bill an told her, how uncomfortable we felt  about her watching us an told her i know we might not look like every one else, but that does not mean we cant pay. Her response was 'Im stationed there' Really Station there , get the hell out of here.I was there for 10 mins try to figure out where i was going to eat , i never seen her standing there ever, great lie but METHINKS NOT LOL . Oh an the food was so so , Fries were real good though.
author: Adam R.

description: The fake review from "WC" aka Andy from Groupon was just silly. Sauce really is a great place to get a drink, their staff deliver some of the best customer service, on top of all this, his fake review and comments and threats to Sauce have been made public, and that has only strengthened Sauce in my book as a place Id love to spend my hard earned cash after my night of long hours to sit, enjoy a drink, from some of the nicest bartenders in SF!
author: William D.

description:
This is a really cute place, with both indoor and outdoor seating in the alley that is Belden Place. The outdoor seating isn't so bad, as long as you're by the heat lamps. Some days it can be really bustling outside since it's in an alley along with a bunch of other restaurants that have outdoor seating. 

Items we ordered:
~ Maine Lobster Roll: be warned, the salad on this dish was extremely salty! I think it was a mistake and they accidentally washed it in saltwater. The lobster roll itself was delicious though, and tasted extremely fresh. The roll was toasted perfectly and there was no mayonnaise sauce to corrupt the flavor (or add unnecessary calories).
~ Portobello Mushroom Fries: this didn't quite meet my expectations based on all the rave reviews it was getting. It only came with 8 pieces, and a ranch-like dressing (although better than your standard ranch). Maybe it wasn't quite as crispy on the outside or as piping hot as I thought it could be on the inside.
~ Brussels Sprouts Salad: a sweet salad that was nice and refreshing.
~ Seared Butterfish: I felt like this was slightly overcooked, but still tasty. The brussels sprouts and carrots went well with this dish. 
~ Corned Beef & Cabbage: great dish! The cippolini onions were so sweet and tasty. I normally don't like onions too. 

We finished it all off with the PB&J sandwich, which came out much more frozen than the last time. It was so cold that the ice cream was quite firm -- you could pretty much bite into it, and the peanut butter was almost hard as a rock! This wasn't exactly what I remembered. Did they forget to let it thaw?! I hope they'll work on their consistency, but this is still a place that's worth a try.
author: Audrey L.

description: Eh. Very underwhelming. Came with a group of 8 people for a dinner party. Expected a better menu than it was - mostly interesting sides and fancy entrees. In my opinion, they should have a burger on the menu or something simpler if you're not looking for a mediocre 27 dollar entree. We had a wide variety of food ordered between everyone, and no one was raving. I had the mac & cheese which was tasteless, along with the kale and spinach side which was watery and too salty. Garlic bread was outstanding though, along with the drinks (I had champs and a Moscow mule). Service was not attentive and very slow. Won't be coming back, but may try their Hayes location.
author: Alexis T.

description: I frequent sf in search of good food, and this place didn't disappoint.  Quite possibly the best dinner I've had, kudos to the chef.
author: Brian M.

description: The deviled eggs, mushroom fries and poutines were good. The drinks were tasty. But the Mac n cheese and clam chowder was really salty. So much so it was hard to eat.
author: Yu C.

description: The bartender is masterful, the short rib stroganoff orgasmic!!! Topped off with Cronuts. Best meal in decades.
author: Aundrea G.

description: We saw this place on Check Please, Bay Area and gave it a try last night, a gorgeous, warm SF evening.  What was great was the ambiance on the patio, the service, the portobello mushroom fries, the wedge salad and the beet salad (I don't even like beets and it was delish!). What was just okay was the mac n cheese and the crab rangoons.  Mac was bland and the crab rangoons were also bland and a tad soggy.  I had a ginger cosmo, two of them actually, that was one of the best cocktails I've ever had and our friend had a couple of the rye cocktails with the candied sugar swizzle stick and said they were really good.  We will be back to try more of the fare, that's for sure.
author: Rachel H.

description: I really enjoy going out to "Sauce" for an occasional long lunch away from work. The burger is tasty, but my favorite is the seafood chowder with clam strips. I think it is a good value for your money and service is friendly and prompt.
author: Adrienne G.

description: Tough spot if you're a vegetarian/pescetarian- nearly all the 'social' (shared) dishes have ham or bacon.  Grilled butterfish sandwich and the side of spinach & kale were oily.  Not worth the $.
author: Sona P.

description: Typical hipster food place, lots of attitude, mediocre food. We had the mac & cheese - under-cooked, eggplant fries - meh, and tatter tots with ham or something - just bland, and chowder, just not good. If you are going to do comfort food, just make it good. Service was typical hipster, nice but slow and infrequent. There are many other choices in town, skip this one.
author: Ashton M.

description: Yummy...unusual drinks with some punch.  GF friendly dishes.  I had the hanger steak with polenta fries.  Gotta say...those polenta fries were my fav.  Could've eaten a dozen.  Comfort food to the max.  Creamed kale my hubby got with his wellington was amazing.  The fav?  Sausage Bread. ..omg!
author: Lisa R.

description: Loved the butter fish, hit the spot! My wife enjoyed the chili as well. Great vibe, great food.
author: Manwell R.

description: This was a last minute choice because we had to change reservations very quickly and we were pleasantly surprised.  My wife enjoyed her drink and the steak was delicious as were the oysters.  The mushroom fries that my wife ordered were different and interesting.  She enjoyed her mushroom soup, it was rich and filling.  Staff was pleasant and accommodating even in splitting the bill at the end of the meal.
author: Marvin P.

description: Cool lunch spot. Service is pretty good.  Get the burger cuz that ish is bomb.  Two patties! Bacon! Cheese! All come standard!
author: Peter M.

description:
Pleasantly surprised by this place.  We're on vacation and staying about 10min walking distance from Sauce.  The restaurant is off of an alley that it shares with maybe 3-5 other restaurants. It's cute with lots of patio dining.  We ordered the following:
-Eggs & bacon: pretty solid deviled eggs but the bacon made them.
-BOWL OF BACON: this was amazing. Being from Chicago, it seems like SF food/restaurants prices are a little more than Chicago on average. The bowl of bacon was amazingly delicious but I also considered the portion to be generous and based on the price, it's actually a pretty sweet deal. I'd pay more for this at home or in San Fran. It truly is thick cut bacon (awesome, places don't get this right). The brown sugar is perfect. Not too much. Not too breakfasty. So good.
-Sauteed Spinach & Kale: pretty light, good way to get your greens in. My boyfriend and I actually added bacon to our spinach & kale.
-Texas Wild Boar Chili: pretty solid. Also generous portion.
-American Honey Side Car: I don't love American Honey but my bf does. Regardless, this was so tasty.
-Bourbon Smashed Grand Ma: whooo boy this had a bit of a punch but it got better as I drank it. Kind of a bourbon mojito. Yum.
author: Emily M.

description:
After my recent experience on Saturday evening at this establishment, I will most likely not return.  

The mac and cheese was okay, not over the top delicious.  I have honestly had better.   The two drinks my friend and I had were okay.  

I ordered the burger- which I ordered Medium Well (I refuse to eat ground beef any more rare)- and well, after 30-40 minutes, my burger came out-  medium rare.   Maybe it was just the server didn't hear me correctly, or the chef decided he wanted to give me something I didn't order. 

Either way, when I told them that the burger was undercooked-  I was fine with just eating the fries and side salad-  as I rarely send food back and expect it to come back without any "added" toppings I didn't want.   That, and we had already been at the restaurant for about 45 minutes at this point.  

The waitress was adamant about taking the burger back and "re-plating" my salad and fries, after I said no it's fine.   The salad and fries came back, with either the manager or some guy that was the bartender for the evening- who had a complete attitude.  This is why they are getting such a low rating.  The food was okay, not excellent- but to get served a side dish of argument and attitude when I didn't even want the burger sent back, not okay.  

The customer is always right- and I was polite about my criticism.  The guy on the other hand took it upon himself to kind of "argue" with me and get an attitude, followed by sending out two drinks to hopefully compensate me and make me feel better about things.  

Given the horrible service, and attitude from management, I won't be back.  The waitstaff was great- management, yeah- you ruined it.
author: J B.

description: awesome service and great drinks. I highly suggest the bacon wrapped meatloaf and the fried mushrooms
author: Madie H.

description: Love this place and the atmosphere of the hidden alley. It's romantic and very fun! The food has always been yummy, try the bowl of bacon...amazing.
author: Aimee O.

description: The food was delicious! I had the salmon and it was so good. All my friends had to try it and they agreed! It was my birthday dinner, so I really wanted everyone to have a great time and for everything to go smoothly. The drinks were good, and everyone enjoyed their meals. The only thing was that when we were ready to go, it took us forever to get our payments processed. We were all using cards, and their system had to be restarted twice, so it took a long time. However, the staff was nice about it and apologized. They have outdoor seating like the rest of the restaurants on that street and it's really awesome!
author: Raizel G.

description: I love Sauce! I brought my sister, who is on a strict diet, here for lunch. The server helped her create her own dish to meet her diet restrictions. He was super nice about it, to boot. Food was delicious, as was the lemonade concoction the bartender created after he walked by as we were talking about non-alcoholic options. I'll keep coming back.
author: Mishka L.

description: This is my new favourite restaurant. It's very rare to eat a meal about which no one has a single complaint. To the contrary, everything we ordered managed to top what came just before it. Highly recommend the fried chicken, short rib stroganoff and bacon wrapped scallops. Excellent service too.
author: Nivy G.

description: Phenomenal food and great atmosphere! The stroganoff was amazing and the bacon wrapped scallops were to die for! Make sure that you eat the arugula underneath the scallops, the dressing was incredible!
author: John H.

description: Sauces food is medicore. Been here twice and I am wondering why I gave it a second chance. Over priced and underwhelming.  Portions are tiny and nothing special. Kept looking next door at the much bigger and more interesting food. Lost an additional star from medicare to sub par due from ordering the same cocktail twice but receiving a lime juice with no sugar or gin the second time. The waiter didn't apologize. He simply said that it is a different bartender. Never coming back. Beldon has so much better to offer
author: Val C.

description: Service and food was excellent. The only con of this restaurant is the smell of the restaurant. It was as if each of the cooks took an hour smoke break, the place reeks of cheap cigarettes. It really made my stomach turn through the entire meal.
author: Andanette C.

description: As an American, I much enjoy good old fashion mac&cheese. I think that Sauce nailed it! My one complaint is that the food is very greasy: grease drops out.
author: C B.

description: Went on a Saturday night.  We ordered an app, a side and an entree to share.  The entree came out first, followed by the side a few minutes later and then the appetizer.  Ummm, what?  The food was good, but I was so thrown off from everything coming out of order.  It felt like we were being hurried even though it was only 8:00 and the place was half empty.  If you go you need to be explicit about the pace in which you want your order to come out.
author: Adina L.

description: Really good food, nice venue, service is a bit slow but it is worth it.
author: Radoslaw D.

description: The food was delicious. Our waiter was good in the beginning and was friendly the entire time, but towards the end started to get really slow with our service. :-/ Either way, we had the Mac and cheese as an appetizer...and salmon and lobster roll as the main course and all I can say is yummy!
author: Sharifa S.

description: This place is so delicious! My husband and I started with the mini meatloaf appetizer, then shared the pluot salad and a cup of the chili, then shared the braised beef and mushroom stroganoff. Every single thing was yummy! We are now devouring the warm cinnamon donuts and orange dreamsicle smoothie for dessert! I'm in heaven!
author: Kari H.

description: the food is good and service is excellent.  i'm a fan of the chicken pot pies, port mushroom fries, and side potatoes.
author: Michelle L.

description: I had this bookmarked after seeing it on Check Please, so when there was an opportunity to meet up with a colleague and take BART into the city I suggested Sauce since it appeared to be very close to the Montgomery station. Turns out it is a rather small café, but enhanced by outdoor seating in the walking-only alley which is Belden Place. the alley has a lot of options, and seems very European as others noted. It was nice the patio sections were partitioned off with plastic sheeting, which cut down on the cold wind factor, as well as noise. First off the waitress was really friendly and helpful - I'd give the service 4 stars. She was present when needed, helped me by recommending a cup instead of bowl of chili which was spot on. and turns out the Check Please episode was from several years ago.I didn't have my notes with me, so we ordered just randomly.  The shrimp and artichoke wontons were "meh".  I had one (of the 4 on plate) and didn't like enough to have another...which is rare since I love artichokes and like shrimp.  the taste was just off.  the ham Hock Tater tots were more plentiful, but really couldn't tell where the ham Hock was.  seemed like lightly flavored potatoes balls covered in panko and baked.  sauces were tasty, but not super.  The Corn and tomato salad was really good, however I would recommend they add more heirloom tomato and in slices.  the Boar chili was sadly mostly beans.  I think they were pinto but they actually looked like black eyed peas.  I t was okay, but not fabulous.  My mate had the steak and potato which looked very good.  The waitress had described the potato as a deconstructed potato skins, but it was really fries with the fixins.  still they were fresh cut from potatoes so i'll give it that.  The bathrooms are unisex, and very dimly lit...which is a pet peeve for several reasons.  It is also hard to use your purse to do makeup touchup when there isn't counter space. Overall it's a nice atmosphere and I would go back...but next time try the PBJ dessert, the Short Ribs, the Meatloaf, and the mushroom fries.  Oh, I am also not a fan of the trendy Kale, Mac n cheese, and Fried Chicken options that seem to appear on every menu on the West coast since 2010...rarely do any of these meet my expectations, and I wish every restaurant wouldn't feel like they have to have them on the menu.   NOTE: I should have had a physical map, and/or walking directions - WAZE is horrible for walking directions.
author: Kai F.

description: Love coming here with friends for drinks and delicious tasty appetizers!
author: Double D.

description:
Delicious Burger! Our waiter recommended it and he was right, it is one of the best I have had in the city.

   We had cocktails that were so-so (for the price you can find much better cocktails in SF, but they are decent).

    The portobello mushroom fries were pretty tasty! I am not a mushroom fan generally, but these were battered well and a great snack while waiting for our entrees.
 
   Overall a good place to get an after-work dinner, we're happy to come back again soon. Service was attentive.
author: S M.

description: I've been her twice with two very different experiences. The first was great (4 stars) and the second just ho hum (2 stars). Had the bowl of bacon both times, loved it the first time, not so much the second (too peppery). Had the hanger steak the first time (fantastic) and the lobster roll the second (meh). Cocktails are good.
author: Matt T.

description: Took my fiancé out for a birthday smoke and dinner. He really wanted to check out Occidental (you can smoke inside?!? SOLD) After a few drinks we decided to go eat or it would have been a really early night. The bartender suggested some restaurants around the corner. Although we didn't realize that all of them are kinda out there fishing for you. We did a loop and decided on Sauce. The menu looked amazing for some simple American fare. We wanted to order it all. Aaron our waiter was easy going and fun. Gave some input that paid off! The mac & cheese is a MUST!  The potato string thingies with the gravy. Oh my gravy. Yum. I ordered Rosie's fried chicken... Heaven. Friends ordered the hamburger who rave it's one of the BEST! Future hubby had the lobster. Gone in like 2 bites! So yes, this place is a MUST!
author: Angela Z.

description: The restaurant was one of several tucked away in the busy financial district. Great outdoor seating and fun atmosphere. The food was above average; a little pricey for fried mushroom, bowl of bacon, devils egg and artichoke wontons. The sirloin was tender, but the big question of the night. Wheres the sauce? Nothing our table ordered was saucy. Im just saying.
author: Ryan C.

description: Great little restaurant in Belden Alley.  I sat outside on a cool-ish day but did not feel too cold.  I felt as though I escaped the financial district during my lunch time. Burgers come with two patties and can easily be shared.  The heirloom tomato and corn salad with grilled chicken was a nice dish that I would order again.
author: Lisse Q.

description: Good burger and mini pot pies! Word to the wise, they make stiff drinks... like my mixed drink was all alcohol and I had to water it down to consume. Great location and on a nice day, feels like your in Italy.
author: Elisa D.

description:
this is THE hotspot in the Belden alley in SF - I should know, I work in an office right upstairs.  Great food across the board & be sure to grab a Happy Meal sometime after 2pm - I highly recommend the Friday crab cakes & moscow mule.

excellent service and perfect place to bring clients & friends.

Cheers!
author: Mark B.

description: This is my new favorite gem.  Been there twice now in the last month, both times amazing.  We had the deviled eggs with bacon, chicken parmesan, cob salad, tomato bisque with grilled cheese, salmon, steak.  All amazing.  And all the staff are very friendly and willing to accommodate.  I've been to the Gough St. locations many times over the years, so glad they're still around.  Wonderful!
author: Mark T.

description: My wife and i went on the night of the 17th. Good place for comfort food... we had the sliders, wild boar chili, a pasta dish, and the hangar steak, and PBJ dessert... all good! Only negative was the service. Service was a little slow and not the most attentive.
author: Cory W.

description: The hostess, Sophia, right from the start set this place apart from all the other options on this adorable little block. The sign of a good restaurant is that a chef is willing to accommodate food allergies. Mark was knowledgable and gave us great recommendations based on our restrictions. Not only does this make for easier group meals but you know everything's made fresh. Plus dog accommodations make our list! Thanks for filling all our requirements! Now I'll actually order and try the food...
author: Hannah S.

description:
Pleasant atmosphere and friendly welcome.  Like that they leave you a carafe of water.  We had bad luck with our dishes ...

A) Brussel sprout salad: perfectly al dente brussel sprout leaves with one or two sand-sized bits of bacon; the odd dressing had curry and chili and was too sweet; the saccharine salad was drowned in dried cranberry; this salad tasted like aspirin; I prefer to make my own but will adopt the separated leaves instead of slicing the sprouts

B) Clam chowder: weird deep fried clam pieces adorn this soup; the oregano was overpowering - the pairing of oregano and chowder will live in infamy; left intact

C) Chicken pot pies: dry, bone dry, with separate congealed sauce; left intact

D) Osso bucco: dry, as if sitting under a heat lamp too long

This is the only restaurant I've ever been to that I have left most of the food on the plate.  We ate the salads because we were hungry but the rest of the food seemed as if was made offsite and microwaved.  Come for the atmosphere but eat elsewhere if you know how to cook.
author: Richard S.

description: We had a fabulous lunch here after having a very disappointing experience in Cafe Tiramisu in the same lane only a few days before. Nicole was our server and took great care of us. The portobello mushroom fries were delicious and crunchy. My steak was succulent and juicy and was incredibly tasty, specially with the figs i the salad on the side. The bill was quite reasonable too considering we all had a few drinks. Highly recommended!
author: Chetan G.

description: The food was very tasty but the general atmosphere and service was average. From the poor sound system to the large TV's and air-less dining room, inside is not where you want to be seated.
author: Ian G.

description: My husband and I were in town visiting friends and we found this restaurant on yelp. The service was amazing! Our waiter was extremely nice and helpful on menu questions! We ordered the hanger steak, chicken Parmesan and the mini s'mores for dessert. Everything was amazing! My husband and I ate the entire thing plus dessert! I highly recommend this restaurant for the great service, atmosphere, and food!
author: Megan R.

description:
Great place to share small plates.

My favorites: The portobello mushroom fries and the bowl of peppered, brown sugar bacon - it tastes like the edges of a honey-baked ham. 

Also tasty: The sausage cheese bread and the mac and cheese. 

Not bad: The deviled eggs and the bacon wrapped mini meatloaves.
author: Candy C.

description: Had the lobster roll. It was amazing but the 5 stars is for the amazing sides that came with it. Salad and cheddar tortilla trips were amazing.
author: Zach B.

description: Seriously delicious.  The little donuts with vanilla dipping sauce are like CRACK.  Great service.  Yum.
author: AMMBMJ T.

description: Love this place--everything about it is good from the food to the service to the atmosphere---highly recommend!
author: A.J. M.

description: Great for lunch and happy hour specials. Order the cobb salad!
author: Vicki L.

description: The cocktails are tasty and unique - every other joint in SF is doing the same thing at the same time. These guys aren't. Cheers for that. The food is fun and well executed and filling. Fresh salad, share plates with entrée sized portions instead of appetizer sized and reasonable prices for entrées. The burger and chicken are particularly good but try something new because the menu constantly changes. That's good too. Don't get to settled on one thing, try something new cause it is gonna be good. There is nothing near here that is nearly this good. A standout.
author: Jess M.

description: Today a group of 4 of us went to Sauce for lunch . We asked for a table and the hostess said "I think I can make 4 work" and then proceeded to give us a table out on the patio. After about 10 minutes of us being greeted someone whom Id presume to be the manager came over and stated "We have a fully reserved dining room, how did you get this table" to which we replied The hostess. He then (in a very gruff tone)  stated OH the one who just said that she didn't seat you?! and then Huffed and walked away. We then sat for 10 more minutes without being approached by the server. Our food came and it was great. However the manager stood in the door way with a scowl that read nothing hospitable and welcoming.  The hostess came over and let us know it was "all good" and walked away. Our food was great but the bitter experience leaves the strongest taste and for that we will never return or bring clients here again.
author: Erin E.

description: I liked the decor and they offer a nice patio area. It's good for happy hour as long as you don't have a big group. The portobello mushroom fries are surprisingly good, though the order doesn't come with that many. Loved the crispy breading with the ranch. I was unimpressed by the chicken pot pies as it was really doughy and the filling wasn't very flavorful. I didnt' like the deviled eggs either but the bowl of bacon was awesome. Yes you can order JUST bacon and it's candied and comes in little bite size pieces. If I could I'd give it a 2.5 but I think it's a 3 if you've been and stick to the things you like.
author: Alice J.

description:
The double bacon cheeseburger with deviled egg filling is simply the best!

I also like the vegetarian strudel with tomato bisque soup. Light and delicious!

The appetizers have all been good, including he sausage cheese bread and mini meatloaf.
author: Lindsay F.

description: Ok guys you deserve the 5 stars!!  Great food, great friendly staff. A home run for Beldon alley. Fired chicken is tasty and moist. hanger steak was (med-rare) done to perfection and really had incredible flavor. Decent menu with something for everyone. Big bar inside with a cool vibe and energy. Always greeted by the staff and bartenders. Give them a try!
author: Mark W.

description: Went to Sauce for lunch on a beautiful summer day.  Love the atmosphere of Belden place.  Feels a little like Europe.  Waitstaff was attentive and friendly.  Had the Wild Boar Chilli; quite tasty. Lobster in the Lobster Roll was tasty, but the bread was less good.  The Ham Hock Tater Tots were good, not great.  But the overall experience was very nice.  Would go back for lunch on a nice day.
author: Robert J.

description: delicious food. the four of us got different dishes and we were all extremely satisfied. down an adorable ally that looks European. they even whipped up some homemade teriyaki sauce on demand.
author: Vanessa S.

description: We did a DAT lunch. I got the portobello fries (excellent) and the seafood chowder (also excellent). Also got to try the devilled eggs (great) and the mini meatloaf appetizer (also great).
author: Maximillian M.

description:
A neat, quiet spot tucked away in Belden place.  I actually work across the street... never realized there was so much stuff in this alley!  Anyway....

Good option for happy hour since it doesn't appear to get crowded, and happy hour lasts until 7:00 (so annoying when places stop their h/h at 6:00).  The bartenders are friendly and since they are not overwhelmed by a crowd, they are great about inventing drinks for you, which they make with just enough kick.  

The "social plates" are definitely the way to go.  My buddy and I shared a few of these along with 3 drinks a piece.  The food had some hits, but some things that were just okay.  Here's the breakdown.

1. Bacon wrapped mini meatloaf on a bed of mashed potatoes = stellar.  This was a last minute item, that we ordered after eating everything else and were still hungry.  I was very impressed.  The meatloaf was flavorful and nicely complemented by a strip of crisp bacon (as opposed to soggy, which is usually how bacon wrapped stuff goes). 
2. Portabello fries = delicious.  These were interesting.  kind of like zucchini strips but with mushroom.  The serving size was appropriate (6 "fries") though the $10 price was a bit steep.
3. Lobster bisque = okay.  The soup itself was alright.  Had better lobster bisque.  I really liked the piece of lobster and the crouton on top of the bisque, but it was a small piece, and I only got to eat 1/2 of it since we were sharing everything.  
4. Corn and heirloom tomato salad = okay.  This was touted as being in a creamed corn emulsion or something, but it seemed more like plain corn off the cob without much seasoning to it. 
5. Deviled eggs = nothing to get excited about.  The texture of the filling was nice and creamy, but it lacked any kick, so overall the dish was bland.  

Overall, I can see myself coming back to this place to try out more of their stuff.  I really liked relaxed vibe.
author: Ash T.

description: Decent food for sure and very nice service. It's great to eat outside and of course Belden Lane is an awesome location.
author: Jessica H.

description: Lovely setting, outside, convivial atmosphere, unless you get seated by the door, and on top of a puddle which I've placed my purse in....ordered the Heirloom salad, I am expecting a bountiful plate of tomatoes and corn, there was less than 1/3 of one tomato on my plate, and they gave me the stem bit....I should have ordered something else, but no one asked how my meal was. Now I know for next time....very unlikely there will be a next time....
author: Zarina S.

description: Loved it! Went to belden Ln on a Saturday and surprisingly had no wait for Sauce. We each really really enjoyed our meals. Salmon was perfect. Tomato soup delish. Steak was unique and tasty and fried chicken looked delish. Best part of the night...donuts for dessert! I've been in SF for over a month and have been very disappointed in the food so I was thrilled after eating here.
author: Melisa P.

description:
Of the many things I miss about living in Hayes Valley, the Portobello Mushroom fries at Sauce are near the top of the list.  Getting the Mac and Cheese to go at 1am is a close second.

Go on with your bad self Tripp.
author: Jeff F.

description: Made a reservation for my birthday at a recommendation of my sister. She said it was fun, delicious food and great environment.  I was impressed with the phone call the day prior, confirming my reservation and also confirming that it was my birthday. Upon arrival we were greeted outside, I mentioned we had a reservation and were waiting for the rest of our party and would get a drink at the bar.  We ordered our drinks and immediately were told our table was ready. I liked that the staff was on top of things, but it felt pushy, especially since I had just mentioned that we were waiting for the rest of our party and just had ordered drinks. I again said we are waiting and would like to have our drinks at the bar.  The rest of our party arrived and we were seated.  The outside seating area is quaint and nice, European feel. We reviewed the menu which has quite a bit of what they call social plates ( small plates to share) and then entree's.  We decided to order some of the social plates. Portabello mushroom fries and the baked mac and cheese.   We mentioned to the waitress we would keep the menus so we could decide on our entrees.  Not 3 minutes later did another person come over and ask if we wanted to order.  I then mentioned that we ordered some starters and wanted to wait to order the entrees.  Again, this was a nice gesture, but I got the sense they wanted to push us out of there. We received the starters which were delicious.  Ordered our entrees and two of the couples asked if they could split.  We received our entrees which were beautifully plated, however, they didn't not split the entrees onto two plates.  Which is a little frustrating.  Dessert menus were offered and we ordered the cronuts, PB&J and coffee. Not once did they mention anything about my birthday.  I thought they might put a candle in the cronuts.  No such luck, both desserts arrived and nothing.  All in all I have to say that the food was delicious at Sauce. I just felt the whole dinner felt rushed, the wait staff had zero personality and I was very disappointed  that nothing was done for my birthday. Like I said a candle in the cronuts would have been a nice touch. Not sure if it was an off night for them, but I am not sure I would return.
author: Anne M.

description: The food is great! The Grilled Shrimp with tomato sauce makes you want more and more; the Brussel Sprout salad was a explosion of flavors and the Mini Pot Pies were a huge hit - crunchy crust, great little pot of gravy and smelled amazing. Great staff, too!!
author: Robyn W.

description: Great small plates, staff extremely friendly and attentive. We ducked into this place in the alley during a downpour and stayed because of the staff. I'm so glad we did.
author: Joe H.

description: It was Wednesday so a light crowd there. So I was puzzled to get no service, no nothing while we drank what we had picked up at the bar. Finally someone came around to take our menu so they could offer it to someone else. Weird. We ended up going next door anyway. There was no great reason to stick around here.
author: Catt G.

description: This restaurant is located in Belden Alley which is this super cute somewhat hidden secret of an alley with cafe lights strung overhead not too far from the Union Square area where we had just been shopping. We had a large group of about 8-10 people. It's actually a pretty good restaurant for large parties like ours. We had an attentive and friendly waitress. 3 stars because the food was kind of whatever. Kind of like the TGI Friday's of San Francisco.
author: PM D.

description: The Mini Chicken Pot Pies were delicious as was the Tomato Bisque soup with Grilled Cheese Toast Sticks. Service was great. I highly recommend Sauce.
author: DaRhonda B.

description: my friend and i decided to try this place as part of the AIDS one-day event (proceeds go to local AIDS organizations). frankly, there's a lot to both like and dislike. the service was friendly, but slow. the food was good and tasty, but overpriced. the meal itself will keep your stomach and taste buds satisfied, but have good company with you and make sure you guys have good conversation.
author: Mike C.

description:
I have eaten in restaurants all over the Bay Area and at all Belden Place restaurants, I am sorry to say that, while all the other restaurants are pretty good and authentic, Sauce is the worst restaurant that I have ever tried. 
We had the Bisque Lobster and the Clam Chowder. They both were a nightmare. In Germany they say that: when the food is too salty the cook must be in love. Sauce's cook must be madly in love, because both dishes tasted like if they had been cooked on seawater.
The other 2 dishes we had were uneventful and not worth to describe or mention. Probably due to the excess of salt of the previous ones.
The waiter and staff were nice and welcoming, that is why we can give the restaurant 1 star. 
I just wish the waiter would have warned us and directed us towards a better choice, but he seemed to like or had been instructed to push the Lobster Bisque, since when we left he recommended it to another guest.
The decor is pretty poor and they should work on improving the bathrooms.
The heaters outside work pretty well, so at least you can be outside.
author: Barca.cielo.ola B.

description: Great location. The food was so good. The brussel sprout salad is a must. The hanger steak was fabulous. Great place to eat. The street has a european feel. Very great place. Always a must.
author: m w.

description: Kind of a weird location in an alley, but it works. Nice service, chicken parm was really really good. If I was in the area again, I'd definitely go back.
author: Scott W.

description: Delicious beef stroganoff. Very flavorful. And the cronuts were a great dessert. Great for date night or for a dinner with friends.
author: Marta M.

description: Just went back last week to meet a friend for late lunch outside- perfect spot! Kevin was our server and he was charming and efficient. We both decided we were in the mood for lobster so we split the bisque and the lobster (lobstah!) roll. I love how the bisque comes out with lobster sitting on a crostini in the middle of the bowl then they pour the soup over it when they bring it to the table. Amazing! Both dishes were soooo good and I'll definitely order them again but I doubt I'll want to share next time! We also split a happy hour caraffe of wine- that day it was a pinot noir and it was perfect with our meal! Thanks again! :)
author: Jen G.

description: Food is farm to table. Portobello mushrooms fries with dipping sauce are incredible. We are had mini meatloafs and shrimp pockets for appetizers. We shared a corn and tomatoes salad. The corn was fresh off the cob with tasty tomatoes. My entree was the vegetarian strudel. Others in our group had beef Wellington, pork ossco and salmon. All the dishes were excellent. The salmon was served over a spinach chiffonade salad which the chef kindly explained how he made it. My husband never eats anything green and he loved the salmon base. We finished up with 3 dessert to share---cronuts, chocolate cake bites and s'mores. The Cronuts with dipping sauce were the best and most unique.
author: Karen A.

description: Tater Totts were awesome! Epic comfort food, but really delicate, clean and packed with flavour. Will be coming back for sure! Great service too!
author: Louis G.

description:
Several things have happened in a negative way since the owners of Trademark sold to Sauce.  

1.  No more fish and chips -- was the only place I'd eat them.
2. Changed Pat the bartender's hours, so can no longer have lunch with her at the bar, which was one of my favorite places to go.
3.  Tried to make a reservation at OpenTable and can't.

Better fix yourself up!
author: Susan H.

description: As noted this place is located in a charming alleyway with a group of other restaurants.  The staff was very welcoming and the ambiance is minimalist and modern, dim but not dark.  Having it to do over again I would have sat outside to catch a bit of a breeze because the interior felt a bit warm and stuffy, but not horrible.  However this is coming from Texas where I'm used to every business blasting ac and fans indoors, so it's probably me.  Our waitress was very attentive and upbeat, yet not overwhelming.  We got mushroom fries which had a good flavor.  My husband got the stroganoff which he really enjoyed, and I got the vegetable strudel which was also delicious.  The vegetables inside were cooked down which made it very cohesive and it stayed together well.  It's refreshing to see non-boring vegetarian options on a small menu. The portions were ample and we had no room for dessert.  Every other dish we saw go by looked well presented and appealing.  Overall, great experience, very solid meal with no downsides other than the price, but we knew what we were getting into.
author: Holly W.

description: Been a huge fan of the Sauce in Hayes Valley for years, and I'm excited about the new downtown location - that is now open for lunch and also open late night.  Some of the old favorites are on the menu - but also some new great items like the deviled eggs, chili and bowl of bacon.  There was also a great salad I got once that was quite healthy.  This is gonna be great this summer when it warms up a bit and we can sit outside.  They did do a great job refurbing the inside too and the bar looks amazing.
author: Clark H.

description:
I'm so happy that Sauce opened a restaurant on Belden since I work in the Financial District and now have a great place to go for lunch, happy hour apps and cocktails. 

I've already been in several times and have taken clients there for lunch on a couple of occasions - really delicious food and good size portions.

I LOVE the appetizers and deserts!
author: robert k.

description:
Sauce- a quiet place for dinner on a quiet night. 

The pros
Super friendly, attentive, and personable staff
Trendy, contemporary decor
Barreled, air-tight wine on tap
Looks like this place would attract quite a scene on a weeknight or weekend
Most of the food was delicious
A generous promotion I wasn't aware of
Grateful for options with fresh ingredients!
Goat Cheese/Beet salad was delicious!
Short menu for easy selection- Appetizers, soup, salads, 3 entrees and salads
Micro-mini chicken pot pies were a delight for the eyes! Tiny and beautiful!

The cons (or at least suggestions)
Flights of wine might be nice way to try more things
More non-fried food options would be better
The salmon was oversalted, (and I LOVE salt!)
The gravy for the mini pot pies was bland and undersalted, could use some work.

Would I go here again- sure- just to try the wines and tasty bites, although I'd probably go here more for a drink and snack than a sit-down dinner.
author: J B.

description: Food was alright but not memorable, but service was poor.  They forgot our drinks and had to be prompted twice to get the full order.  They also forgot one of our entrees.  I would have liked them to be more prompt about water as well.  We ordered an assortment of apps which were tasty and amusing comfort food bites, but pricey.  Fried chicken was dry, burger ok. I don't think I'd go back.
author: win c.

description: All 3 stars are for good brussel sprouts salads and nice outside seating. I am not a person who ever complains on service, but our waitress, asian girl, was very disrespecting. So, it kinda spoiled the whole experience... Otherwise, i guess a nice place to lunch!
author: Alex F.

description: Service was unfriendly. No bread offered before entré. Had to wait about 30 minutes before receiving food. Soup was over salted and gluggy. Butterfish was nice. The food is priced like a nice Belden Place restaurant when this felt more like a sports bar with TVs and people yelling watching the sports. I've been to every other restaurant in Belden Place and this at the bottom of my list.
author: David J.

description: Great place to eat at midnight, I popped in and they were just about dead, but then they were one of the few places still open even.  Had the hanger steak and a Cabernet, which was very nicely done and paired well with the salad and risotto cake.  Staff was really cool and friendly, and finished with the "PB&J" dessert which was very good.  I figured the place would be a dive bar with food to match, but I was very pleasantly surprised.
author: Nick F.

description: Napkins fall apart easily so keep that in mind when you're unwrapping it and suddenly find your lap full of white lint.  $27 with gratuity because of Scoutmob. The veggie patty was super good. Wasn't that big of a fan of the mushroom fries because it had a weird squeaky texture that I hate. Lobster bisque was too salty. Cute place for a date or after work drinks.  A little too pricey for me.
author: k h.

description: I have to preface this saying that I am pregnant so things can taste a little different to me. However, I was not a big fan of the food we ordered.  I was immediately drawn to the mini pot pies. I was hoping for true homestyle creamy pot pie and instead got something much more dry that truthfully tasted like dogfood.  I had read the mac n' cheese was bland in someone else's review and couldn't disagree more... It was super flavorful and salty, almost a little too salty and I love salt so that is saying a lot for me to call something salty. The last item we ordered was the tomato bisque soup, which I was also not a huge fan of but my husband liked it. I compare all tomato bisque soup to the Nordstrom Cafe tomato bisque, which is heaven, so my standards are a bit high. The service however was fabulous! Our server Shannon was very friendly and attentive and if I had any balls at all I would have told her what I thought about the food but I felt bad b/c she was so sweet.  I have a feeling this place could have other delicious options and we just chose the wrong things. It was a super cute place and like I said, great service... Just wouldn't recommend the items we ordered.
author: Niki R.

description: Just like the original Sauce in Hayes Valley, the new location on Belden has an awesome vibe and a great take on some old favorites! Whether you are looking for a business lunch, dinner or drinks & appetizers this a great choice!  The food, drinks and atmosphere are not to be missed!
author: marsha c.

description: Do people just not "know any better" anymore?  The standards in this city have become so poor -- largely because my city is now filled with 20-something blow-ins who have tech salaries but clearly never learned table manners, how to behave socially or how to have small-talk with strangers in a bar.  Everything here is shoestring cheap: xeroxed bar menus full of typos ("High Balls" -- wtf?  "Choose from these fine spirits" and the list include "Matusalem rum," "el Jimador Tequila" and "New Amsterdam Gin."  As for wines?  "Select Red" and "Select White."  Has anyone ever HEARD of any of these brands?  Smuggled into the country in trunks of cars or..?  This is one of a group of little places on Belden Alley -- a location which tries oh-so-hard to be "boho" and pretend that it's Montmartre or something "back in the day."   The prices are fine, but I'm getting so sick and tired of these places that are so dreary and drab and cheap and not one thing done for cheer or comfort.  Like eating in a prison -- do people really think that's cool?  Not know the difference it makes to sit in a place with nice ambience?
author: L M.

description: Nothing but good things to say about my experience at Sauce in Belden Alley. My colleagues and I went here for our holiday party, ten of us. Kwame was our server, and he was AWESOME! He got all of the orders correct (food and drinks), the food came out in a timely manner, and at the end of it all, he happily took two credit cards and cash to settle our complicated bill. There's a nice assortment of bar drinks that everyone seemed to enjoy, and I really enjoyed my wine served from, for lack of a better word, a wine keg. It tasted like a freshly opened bottle, and one may purchase a glass or a caraffe (they also have bottles.) And for the food -- AMAZING! We started wth mushroom fries (admittedly they seemed weird at first because it's the texture of a mushroom rather than potato, but they were really tasty and great for sharing), and chicken wings (these were magical and came with a really tasty sauce, also good for sharing.) For dinner, I had the braised short rib with au gratin potatoes. Positively fantastic! Cooked to perfection and delicious. Several of us had this and liked it a lot. Another had the butter fish and reported the same -- perfectly cooked and delicious. A couple of people had and raved about the lobster roll. We also shared one dessert sampler, and all of the desserts were amazing. It was a little loud in the space making it hard to hear everyone in our large group, but all-in-all, it was a really great experience!
author: Becky M.
